Oh well. My bad.Overall, I am SO thrilled with these headphones. I always found the single-ear Bluetooth headsets to look a little ridiculous, so I was all too eager to get a stereo set of Bluetooth headphones that didn't look odd or awkward. These headphones ARE large, but they're solidly made, and look like an expensive, high quality piece of audio equipment. I love them, and would buy them again in a heartbeat.
summary: GREAT Bluetooth stereo headphones! I especially look forward to using these when I travel!

reviewText: My son was able to activate the bluetooth on his 16GB iPod Touch and wanted Stereo bluetooth headphones to listen to his music.  After going to the Apple Store (which had nothing) and Future Shop which had very expensive and inferior products my son found this product online and has been delighted with it!  It works so much better that the $200 inferior product Future Shop tried to sell us.

These are my first Bluetooth headphones and I must say that I am very impressed. The 7 hour battery life is great, the sound is crisp, and they are very comfortable to wear. The headphones work really well with my Ubuntu laptop and MyTouch 3g phone. I do, occasionally, have some pairing issues with my phone, but I don't think it is the headphones fault. On the other hand, it does take some time to get used to the volume and play/pause controls on the headphones, but it comes with time. The only con that I think of regarding these headphones is that there is no way to control bass, treble, etc. But, it is not that big of deal to me.
I have tried 4 other blue tooth headsets and these are by far the best!The sound is great and the ergonomics are well laid out.  I just got them and I already want a second spare pair.

I have these paired with my laptop's built in bluetooth running Vista and using the latest Toshiba bluetooth stack.They sound great and run a long time before needing recharged.I don't use the cell phone feature so I can't speak for that.For me, they are much more comfortable than ear buds.

These headphones are great! I have been searching for over the head bluetooth headphones, and these fit the biil perfectly. For me, they are very comfortable but I could see how a person with perspiration issues might have problems.Some reviewers claim these are not noise cancelling. On medium volume, I cannot hear my girlfriend talking to me. When it comes to sound, these produce. In my opinion the audio quality is top notch and youd be hard pressed to find better at this price.The ONLY complaint I have about these headphones is I literally wanted to throw them, my laptop, anything I could find, against a wall when trying to pair these things to my laptop and BlackBerry Storm. For whatever reason, they were not staying paired initially. Im still not quite sure what I did that finally did the trick. All I can say is with enough fiddling and patience it can be done but be warned.Even with that headache, I still believe these headphones deserve no less than 5 stars. Im really considering buying a second pair just because.

Not knowing what to expect, I anticipated seeing how these headphones sounded. The sound quality is pretty decent, but better yet the volume great and has somewhat of noise canceling capability. I primarily use these for a five hour mow job, and both my phone and the headphones batteries' last the duration. Would definitely recommend for the reasonable price.

I will start by saying i love these headphones. I have always loved the big dj style headphones and was very excited to order these.  Although the model is a year or 2 old, i figured you can't beat the price. I watched a you tube video about them and was in love.  Every website i found showed that it came in a Green box that includedMotorola Bluetooth DJ Headphones S8053.5mm Stereo Adapter CableThermoformed Carry CaseWall ChargerQuick Start Guidewhen the product was listed as new i expected it to come new in a box, with all of these accessories.I was very disappointed to recieve a small box with a photo copy ofthe directions the headset and the wall charger.Here are the specifications on other websitesSpecificationsDimensions: 5 x 9 x 7 inches; 2.2 poundsWeight: 5.5 ouncesPlay Time: up to approximately 17 hoursSpeakers: 40mm diameter NeodymiumMusic controls: Jog dial - track/ volume - push button- call answer/ play-pauseMicrophone: Noise, echo and wind cancellationBluetooth Class: Class 2Stereo Bluetooth profiles: A2DP, AVRCPBluetooth HF Profiles: HS 1.0, HF1.2Thermoformed Carry CasePrice: Around $40Because of the age of these headphones they are selling everywhere for alot cheaper then what they originally sold for.When i called SHOPCELL who was the seller of the item, they stated that this is all they include, i was very disappointed to here this, they said the item is new, and it looks new i hope its not refurbished, but so far i haven't had any major issues, so i'm keeping my fingers crossed. other than that i love the headphones and hope that i can find a carrying case on ebay for this product wise well worth the money, but accessories and advertisement wise i will be contacting amazon and hope i can find a case and the cable to this or some resolution. Other than that great purchase.
summary: Didn't get what was advertised on all sites

reviewText: This is the first bluetooth set i own so i can't say for sure if this is the headset's fault or not but connection drops once every two minutes. This also is a big headset, that's not necessarily bad but something to keep in mind. Other than that the build quality is fine and it sits pretty comfortably on the head.
summary: Not bad for a bluetooth headset

reviewText: My father ordered these from Amazon.com as a gift. They arrived within about a week. I am amazed at the great sound quality that I get from this product. I wasn't sure how Bluetooth would work with Stereo, but it works as well as any headphones you ever owned, and you get the freedom of moving around without wires. If you're the type of person who is usually up doing something or working, this is the headset for you. They're very sturdy, and the telephone features on it are of great quality and easy to use. People can consistently hear me over this device better than any other bluetooth device I've owned. I would highly recommend this product.

I would have to give this headset a 4 out of 5 stars, after having it for approximately 4 months now.As for Pros :1. ) Great sound clarity. I owned a bluetooth Plantronics headset before this one, and in comparison between the two, this one had the better quality in sound. Much cleaner and not so much muffled.2. ) Very comfortable. Wearing these for hours on end and while also laying in bed to listen to music or to carry out a conversation over Skype or XFire.3. ) Easy access controls for music and adjustment. The left and right ear only have one button, and a nob that goes around the outer circumference of the ear. The left nob (Located on the left ear) controls the volume while the right nob (right ear) controls skipping songs. Left button (left ear) (looks like a Phone icon) controls the Power, and pairing for the unit The right button (right ear) controls the Pause/Stop/Play of whatever media player you use. (I don't use this button at all, so I'm unable to give further detail into it.)4. ) The microphone is well hidden, if not invisible if you're not looking at it right. The microphone is actually located in the right ear cup that look like 5 holes going down the side of it closest to the leather-like ear foam, covered from the underneath to protect it from the wind. Decent clarity from the mic in comparison to using my laptop's built in microphone.5. ) If you're wearing the headset while turning it on, it does give you a confirmation that the headset is turned on through 5(?) rapid beeps, from lower note to higher note. As well if you are turning it off, hold down the power button (phone icon button), listen for 1 beep, keep holding it down until you hear 5 beeps for it to be turned off (higher tone to lower).6. ) Battery Life is pretty consistant, 17 hours is a bit of a stretch, but about 10 hours of constantly listening to music and gaming is acceptable to my standards. I have not tested standby mode or "talk-life" due to I plug in the headset when I'm done with it to its charger.Cons :1. ) As with all bluetooth stereo headsets with microphones, the moment you want to use it to talk, it switches straight to "Mono" sound. Meaning everything, as for gaming, music, etc will be in monotone (As though both speakers were playing the same thing instead of stereo quality. A big let-down for me since I'm gaming and chatting with my friends, though I circumvented this by using my laptop microphone instead of the headset's mic. Keep the clarity of the music/game while also chatting it up with my friends.2. ) The materials used for the headset are kinda cheap. After about 4 months of use (On average use about 6~10 hours a day, avid gamer) the right side mounting for the "head adjustment" that connects/adjusts the right earcup to the center headband, the plastic snapped from it causing the headset to loosely shift around and actually dislodge it from its track if you pulled it out far enough. This is remedied with Super Glue if not used very often, I tried repairing it myself with glue but didn't last very long. I still use it to this day without the fix and still works perfectly fine.3. ) The power button is a bit of a hassle, hold it down for about 3 seconds to power it on, hold it down for an additional 6 seconds to set it to pair with another device. If you don't pay attention while turning on your headset you might accidentally set it to pair with another device.4. ) The headset requires the use of a pairing password (0000), so those that have a bluetooth enabled sound jack for their CD player or other device that does not have some form for input for inputting the device password will not be able to. I do not have this type of device, and unable to go on further from it but I have ran into other reviews that others have had this same problem, and wanted to point that out here. (Just in case)5. ) The inability to use the headset while it is charging. Amazon.com or the original seller should have marked that in their description of the product.-------------Overall ::I love this headset, though I wouldn't really consider buying another one, but if it came right down to it, I would later on if I wasn't in a transition away from bluetooth headsets to Wireless 2.4ghz.  Love the clarity, the microphone is decent, if you can get past that it cuts the sound to mono from stereo.4/5 stars. Cheers
summary: Motorola s805 Bluetooth DJ Style Stereo Headset

reviewText: Between my cellphone, my PSPgo and my PC, I use these headphones a lot during the day on different devices. Thankfully, the pairing process is easy.These headphones are very comfortable, and the audio controls work great when they're supported. They are a bit huge, and I wouldn't recommend them for someone who has an active lifestyle and wants to run, jog or cycle.Through using them on different devices, I've learned that not all Bluetooth is created equal, so before bashing them, consider the products. On my cellphone, if I tried using them and playing music, I would get signal skipping with my phone on my belt clip. On my PSPgo, I have not experienced that at all with it in my pocket, so I know the headphones are not at fault.The bass levels are a bit lower than I would like, and while the volume isn't OMFGIPOD loud, the fact that they go over your ears means you can still hear your music/phone calls even when out on a noisy street.Not noise cancelling by any means actually may turn into a life-saver one day. Think about it.I used these constantly, and while I haven't tested the 17 hour battery life, they have never died on me in the middle of the day, even if I don't charge it daily/nightly. They are big though, and people next to you will slightly be able to hear what you're blasting at full volume, so keep that in mind when making a purchase.

I bought these a good while back to use with my iPod touch 3g and I loved it. I now have an iPhone 4 Verizon and these things rock on it. Great sound for calls and music. Battery run time is unbelievable. I some times wonder what the things have in them since it just keeps going and going.
Works very well for the price. Bluetooth worked well, no one complained they couldnt here me well.However the quality for music was good but not great.

The build quality of these headphones is very good. Not flimsy or weak feeling at all. If you have a wider than average head, you may experience a little tightness when you first put them on. My experience has been that this feeling soon passes once the music starts and you aren't focusing on it anymore. The dial knobs on both earpieces are convenient, easy to use, and durable. The range that the headphones can be away from the BT source is decent, between 30-50ft depending on the source. During calls I can hear the caller fine and every person I asked said that they could hear me fine without my needing to raise my voice at all. The music sound quality is only average at best and the bass response is nearly non-existent, but what do you really expect when you are only paying $38 for a set of full ear headphones. I would recommend these for average use but would suggest looking elsewhere if a serious music experience is what you require.
These a very good headphones. I use them with my laptop and my ipod and the sound is good, not great, but good enough.
These headphones are ok, but the sound and the connection is not all what I expected. The connection constantly drops, especially in the middle of a movie. Besides that, I guess they are ok.

These are great.Pairing was no problem.Charging takes about 3 hours but the payoff is 12-20 hours of hassle-free listening.Abolutely love the controls. Can't imagine listening to music without them anymore.Great sound except bluetooth digital artifacts over 10k (very high frequency) do disrupt listening quality on certain types of music.Hope this helps! :) x mwah
summary: Great wireless headphones minus hf response

reviewText: A lot of static in the signal, combined with a thin sound, make these inexpensive headphones an absolute miss. Save up another $60 and step up to a nicer model.
summary: terrible sound, spotty connection - 2005 produced item

reviewText: I bought these headphones to use with my iPod touch. Thanks to 3.0 firmware, bluetooth is now an option. Audio quality is decent, better than a lot of other headphones I've used, but you're going to want to play around with the Equalizer on whatever player you're using, because the midrange on these is set much higher than the treble and bass. I love the comfort and look of these headphones, and the price was reasonable, but OH. MY. GOD, do they get finicky about the signal. If they are at anything but full battery, it gets hard to hear anything except intermittent three second burps of song. I have no idea how long the battery lasts because I don't dare let it get low.  Now, I don't know if this is because Apple half-assed the bluetooth in the iPod, or if Motorola half-assed the bluetooth in the headphones. Since this is my first pair of bluetooth headphones, I'm trying to keep an open mind. But I'll put these on as I'm walking to class, and I'll spend the whole walk fighting with the goddamn headphones, trying to get a single, uninterrupted song out of them. They cut in and out, the A2DP drops out, and I eventually give up. According to the manual, the headphones come with a cable you can use use rather than the bluetooth. I would use this, but it mysteriously never arrived. My room mate, who also bought this same pair of headphones, is missing the cable as well. Needless to say, I'm a little frustrated, and I'm finding myself using a pair of Skullcandy earbuds more often than these.
summary: Not bad for the money, I guess.

reviewText: they held up for a good while. finally snapped the plastic where the headband branches out around the ear cup. luckily i took the band off carefully and put the two ear pieces on a strap of 2" wide elastic. they look a little silly but still work great. the 'headband' approach also fixed their tendency to slip off my head when 'running' or moving a little too quickly. so long as you plug them in every night, they wont run out of battery during the day.  overall great pair of headphones with nice quality sound. i LOVE the controls on the sides, easy to operate.
summary: great headphones for the price i paid

reviewText: I bought these headphones to use with a bluetooth-equipped laptop.  As it turns out, they evidently can connect only to a Motorola Bluetooth cellphone, a limitation not mentioned in the uninformative product description.  They may be perfectly OK with a Bluetooth cellphone, but they're useless with a Bluetooth computer.

I first had these paired with my first-gen unibody Macbook. The sound quality was simply awful, with lots of hissing, static and distortion. It turns out that my Macbook's A2DP implementation is broken, or maybe doesn't jive with these headphones, because pairing the S805s with my iPhone resulted in much better sound.Later on, I switched to a Motorola Droid and the headphones perform are flawless in terms of interoperability. The volume and playback controls (call button and volume control on the left, play/pause button and forward/back on the right) all work as advertised and phone calls come in and go out loud and clear with the built-in microphone.These are not for the discriminating audiophile; sound quality is reasonable and adequate for casual use. Don't expect big bass or crystal-clear highs, but at reasonable volumes, audio playback is fairly free of noise and distortion.Without having a different model to compare to, I can only say that battery life is more than good enough for me. I use these headphones for a 3-5 hours every day at the office. I charge them once a week and have never had the batteries run out of juice on me. I like the fact that the headphones charge via USB, eliminating the need for yet another cumbersome wall-wart.All in all the S805s not what you would call a high-end product, but based on what I paid for them I could safely bet that better Bluetooth headphones could not be for twice the price.
summary: Awesome BT headphones for the money

reviewText: I've had these headphone for a few months.  I use them with my IPOD Touch 2nd Gen and a Sony Ipod wireless adapter.  They are large but comfortable.  I find I am even willing to carry them when I travel to get the better sound.  The one major downside is that they are difficult to pair.  I also have a set of IO Gear headphones that came with a bluetooth adapter.  These headphones would not pair with that adapter.  I also have different ipod bluetooth adapter that they wouldn't pair with.  They only seem to work with the Sony one.  Yesterday, I downloaded the Ipod Touch OS 3.0 which FINALLY enables the internal bluetooth transmitter on my IPOD touch.  When I first attempted to pair these headphones with the ipod it didn't even recognized them.  I had to go to the motorola site and look at the specific directions for pairing with the iPhone. It took 3 attempts but it finally worked.  Volume adjustment works but not the pause or track changing features. On the other hand, my IO Gear headphones were instantly recognized by the IPOD Touch internal bluetooth radio and paired as soon as I put in the pin code.  I just wanted to warn others that upgrade to the IPOD 3.0 OS that you should be careful if you are buying these to use with your Touch without an adapter,  be prepared to play with it alittle to get it to work.

This product does not work as efficiently as it is expected to do. My wife was traveling from USA to India via London. She was unable to make a single call during her airport time in London or India. I was only able to call her once after trying for atleast 30 times....When I tried calling her it would say that the phone number is not available or the subscriber is not reachable even though the phone was on.. I would not recommend it to anyone...

When I first turned on the phone, I was surprised about the loud sound!  I am leaving for Europe in two days.  I really liked the reviews I read, so I made this purchase.  Seems like a powerful little phone.  The phone seems to be a more economical choice compared to sticking with my current provider and getting an international plan.  I went on the website to add more minutes, and it was a breeze.  I've also read that Telestial has great customer service, so if I am unable to recharge minutes via computer while traveling abroad, it's great to know I can call and have more minutes right away.  I tried testing out the text messaging from my current phone, but it doesn't work.  Wish there was a way to test out the phone before leaving for my trip.  Will update this review once I get back to the states.Update:The phone was perfect during my trip!  I"ve been recommending it to friends who travel often.

Received one day before trip to Europe and had high hopes that it would prove useful. Turned into a total disaster. Press a number key and 2 or more unrelated numbers popped up. Made the fatal mistake of trying to enter a pin, for security while traveling, and ended up locked out because of the problems with entering numbers. No customer service contact anywhere in manual or on box. Horrible, horrible manual.Great idea, terrible execution.

For $29 including $5 in calls, what a DEAL!  Worked great in Israel for 12 days.  Love the GPS Internet Journal you can use to track your trip and share pictures and messages with folks back home.  Went on another trip to Mexico hoping it might work (eventho' info indicated it wouldn't and it it didn't!).
summary: Great, SMALL, lightweight Global Phone perfect for travel in Israel (but not Mexico)!

reviewText: Just set up my ekitV520 to use for a trip next month to the UK. It was a simple process to register online and obtain the US number for my phone. What a great value for someone like me who does not plan to make many calls but wants to stay in touch with family and friends during my trip. I plan to use the free online Travel Journal and Map to document my travels. The phone is thin and light, and seems to be simple to operate and have the features I need.

Traveling to Europe for first time, current cell phone won't work there.  My carrier offers an international phone that they will provide but read some negative reviews on their overseas reliability.  My personal number would be used, don't think I want unexpected calls and messages to be received at the international rates.  I didn't want to be without just in case of emergency so this looked like a great deal. I figured that Telestial would be better choice for reliable service while in Europe, and per minute rate was less as well.Order shipped promptly, had it day earlier than expected.  Phone is small and lightweight.  You'll need to register your phone/account to get US number but was simple to do online.  Too early to tell how the quality is, will update with my experience after I return back from my trip. For now I give it 4 stars, hoping that I'll nudge that to 5 stars after I have chance to use it overseas.
summary: Small Inexpensive Option for Short Term Overseas Travel

reviewText: The phone is very compact and light.I couldn't test it in US before giving it to my child for the trip to UK.  There is no problem with texting back and forth from UK to US. I assume that the voice call would work as well since texting proved that it can connect to the cellular network, but voice wasn't tested.  What I like is the travel journal and the location function where from a website, you click the link and it would update the location of the phone and presumably that's where the person carrying the phone is (then found out that this costs 3 cents each time you use the location function, but that's reasonable.  Just wish I knew about it before clicking several times.)  You can send a text from a website for just 15 cents and the text from this phone to my cell phone seems to be recognized as a domestic text and therefore no extra charge to receive.(though it cost 79 cents to send).It costs almost $1 per min so you could use up your money very quickly, but it is easy to see the balance and recharge the minutes from a website.All in all, this is an inexpensive phone to have handy for emergency use.  Nowadays, with wi-fi being ubiquitous, you probably won't need anything more than this phone for most travelers.

I ordered 3 of these phones for a family trip to Italy (we just returned 7/5/11). They were a huge disappointment. I should have known something was fishy when I read the reviews and they were all from people who had purchased the phone but had not yet been abroad to use it. Here are the details...I added $30 to each phone before we left so that we would have enough talk/text time. After about 3 attempts on the first day in Italy, a call actually connected, however the quality was very poor. This was typically the experience...dial several times and maybe get a poor quality connection. Sometimes it never connects at all. Texting was very unreliable. Texts would arrive at the receiver's phone two days later in some instances. As if the poor quality wasn't enough, the reported minutes available was very inconsistent. It might tell you that you had 19 minutes remaining. You would then text or make a call and then it would tell you that you had 23 minutes remaining. Then all of a sudden you were out of minutes. So then you felt that you had to buy more minutes...but you weren't really sure. I bought a total of $140 of minutes and probably got about 5 minutes of clear talk time (that's $28 per minute...not much of a bargain!).  When I called customer service to voice my discontent, all I was offered was a $10 credit for additional time on the phone! These phones were a big disappointment. Don't waste your money.
summary: Don't Waste Your Money on this Phone!

reviewText: You can call, but people calling you get weird messages. This happened in France and in Spain. A true dud.
I could be here all day but to sum up: Don't waste your money. For me, it was totally useless in Italy.
Worked well. Used in Italy and France.
Confusing, to say the least.  Unless one is a tech-savvy person, there's a good chance you'll never get this phone to work while you're on your trip.

I have received my cell phone and SIM card and contacted customer service with a question. They replied promptly and answered the question. This package seems to be an inexpensive answer for a phone to use during foreign travel. It is as advertised.

I bought this phone to take it with me on a Mediterranean cruse.  Originally, I put on it $10. The plan also gave $5 and 30 minutes of free incoming calls. The phone worked excellent everywhere - Barcelona, Florence, Rome, Naples, Palma de Majorca, etc. We were calling home to the US. Our parents were calling us for free from the US. When on shore, never had a problem with connection. I am very happy with the purchase. Thank you.
summary: Worked excellent in Italy and Spain!!!

reviewText: I needed a phone that would work oversees for my current study abroad adventure in Italy. This phone worked great for everything that I needed it to. Its nothing fancy but for calls and texts it works great. The customer support is great as well

I received the phones promptly.  Even though the booklet of directions seemed overwhelming, it wasn't that difficult to use.  Costumer service was helpful.  However, when a call came in from a number I had in my address list, the phone still read "unknown number."  Not sure why.  Otherwise, it served its purpose.

I purchased this package unlocked cell phone with SIM card for an upcoming one-month trip to Europe. I recently received the phone and was impressed with the included documentation. While I can't use the network in the USA, The device turns on and works properly and comes with neat accessories for such an affordable little device: A European travel adapter/charger (from base US charger) and proprietary earbuds. The phone is cheap and small but it does the job and has great (loud!) sound.The product arrived quickly and in good condition - two days earlier than expected. Thanks Telestial!
summary: Everything works as described, fast, at a great price!

reviewText: I have only had this phone for a few days but I have read the instruction book that came with the phone and visited the company website.The instructions are in very small print as others have stated, but I also find them to be inadequate and not well organized.I have not been able to get service as of yet and feel that at this point I would not be able to recommend this phone.

I bought this phone to make one important travel-related call in Italy. It failed. I followed the directions, but I never got the ring-back that would complete the connection. I was counting on it to do one, basic thing, make a local call in Italy, and it failed me. I tried multiple times with the same failure each time. After posting this review, I subsequently was able to get a full refund for both the extra minutes I added to the SIM card and for the phone itself, which I had to return to the seller. The refund process took about six weeks and needed some additional prodding from me.

This used to be a good product... i've had it for many years, but in the past couple of years it does NOT work very reliably... maybe 1 out of 15 or 20 times, and they charge you each time you tried.  I just needed it for a family emergency in St Martin and burned through $30 for 12 minutes of actual connect time after about 30-40 tries.  It's interesting that there are about 10 different product reviews posted for the actual same product, which makes me wonder why so many (diluting reviews???)  PLEASE READ CURRENT REVIEWS.  This product has gone significantly down hill in the past 2 years.  (I've had it for about 4 years in different versions)I used to think it might be great as an emergency backup, but after today's experience... ABSOLUTELY NOT.  Stick to SKYPE if you can.  It's way cheaper even calling landlines if you can get a reliable WIFI connection.  If not, this is better than nothing, but probably better to buy a local prepaid SIM card from the local carrier if you have an unlocked GSM phone.

Ordered this phone as I happen to be going to one of the European countries where incoming calls are free (UK, France, Italy, Spain). The phone's brand name is Ekit (not Nokia, Samsung, etc) and appears to be associated with Telestial. Received the phone, but have not been able to test it yet as I have not yet left. As others have indicated it does not work in the U.S. Surprised by how small it is. Keypad is also small. It does come with earbuds but the phone connector is not the usual 2.5mm but rather looks like some charger plugs. The charger handles all voltages, does plug in to a U.S. outlet and comes with an adapter for the two-pin European plug type (non-grounded). For the UK you will need your own adapter plug.The package comes with the Passport Lite SIM card. For those unfamiliar with GSM phones and SIM cards, they are two different things. The phone will have certain capabilities but the SIM card is the phone's identity and the SIM issuer defines the rules and costs of use. With this particular SIM card, which comes with USD $5 pre-loaded, you get both a UK number (common with rental phones) but also a US number, making it easier for people in the US to reach you without incurring international phone charges. Another nice feature is that voicemail is free but with this package there's a catch - it can only be accessed from the phone itself and not via either a special landline number or by calling the phone's number from a landline. Since this phone doesn't work in the U.S. this setup cannot be done until arrival in a country with 900/1800 GSM. If you are considering forwarding your phone to this phone's US number, it's best if you could set that up and test it before leaving. With a quad-band phone (Amazon offers one from Telestial that you could buy separately with this SIM card) this could be done.Outgoing calls are $0.99 per minute which can add up. However if you don't plan to make very many outgoing calls this is much more economical than rental phones, you don't have to worry about returning anything and you will have the phone available for the next time.
summary: Good for US-based family & friends to reach you

reviewText: Delivery was very quick (less than 24 hours).  All items were in the box.  I just hope that the phone works when I arrive at my destination.  The not knowing aspect may lead one to order one of the quad band phones from Telestial that work in the US.

Haven't used it abroad yet, but account activation was simple.  The housing is a bit flexible and the navigation buttons seem a bit, er, crunchy but the display is good and the speaker is plenty loud.  When I tested the FM radio I discovered one of the buds was dead.  Sent an email and was shipped a new one via UPS Next Day Air, no hassle.  Looking forward to using it abroad.
Haven't taken the trip yet, but everything seems in order.  yes, you do get some credit when you post a review --will update once the trip is taken.

Just received the ekitV520 for a trip to Europe.  I am very impressed with the phone and the simplicity of obtaining a US number.  I will have peace of mind now that I will have a phone I can depend on while on vacation.

The title says it all! After doing some extensive research, it was quite obvious that the best way to get an international phone is to purchase one. Renting a phone may be convenient for a week or two, but our 2 month trip really necessitates us owning the phone. In addition to saving on rental fees, Telestial's rates are some of the best around - they even offer 30 minutes of free incoming call time. The phone is super light and easy to grip, while the feature set is limited, it is perfect for emergency or light use throughout your travels. As other people have said, everything is packaged in a super small box - but all the essentials are there. The free travel journal feature is also rather nice - you can update your location on the web via your phone, and have the service notify friends and family that your location has changed - pretty neat.
I bought this phone for my trip to Austria. It never worked and I was so frustrated.I could not make any phone calls to back home in the US.Waste of money.

Just purchased 2 of these phones for an upcoming trip to Spain + UK. I read the positive reviews on this site and would agree 100 percent about the value for the money, easy set up, good customer support at Telestial. I am not able to try them out here in the U.S. but am confident they will be perfect.

Nice neat small cell phone that comes with $5 credit on and included SIM card which should be enough to get you started in case you have to make a call. After doing a bit of searching, this seems to be the best combination for an "Emergency/Short Conversation" phone that will work in Europe (not in the both US and Europe unless it is not "Quad Band" - I think the only drawback for a phone this price).The phone is small enough to be hidden in a fist and comes with  a few small folded manuals and a simple headset/earbuds. Did not yet try out as we did not go on the trip yet.  Comes with a headset and a adapter which has a us plug and also plug adapter to fit the two round prong outlets (like Italy)and will work with both US and European voltage.If you receive calls in the right countries (France, Italy, Spain, United Kingdom), it is free (no charge against the included SIM card) but will cost the caller whatever the charge is for their country to call you as long as the +44 (UK) number is used. To call the phone when it is in one of those countries from the US you have a few options (check their website for current rates and plans):- Call the provided 800 number, put in the phone's +44 number, and you can talk at no additional cost for a total of 30 minutes; more than that, 49 cents/minutes gets charged against the SIM card credit- go to their website where you can put more money the sim card and also get a US number for the phone (no additional charge); when that number is called from the US, the rate when I wrote this was 30 cents a minute charged against the SIM card- call from a US home or cell phone (rates vary - may be close to 30 cents/minute or much more) or with a service like gmail (about 18 cents/minute) and in this case it is charged to the caller's bill, with no charges against the SIM card in those countries. Please note when researching rates it is more expensive to call a UK mobile number which this is than a landline.- Sending texts to the US number will cost 15 cents. Sending texts back is 75 cents.All of the above will still work if you put the SIM card in another GSM phone, so even if the phone gets broken you should be able to use another compatible phone and still use the same number.The simplest way to use it is If you want to call someone back home, just call them from the phone (cost 99 cents minute) or text them (75 cents), give them the US number and tell them to call you (again, 30 cents/minute).
summary: Great phone and SIM card for a trip to italy

reviewText: i wish i never got this the phone is useless don't buy the phone just get the sim card only

I am about to do some last minute travel and wanted a cell phone that could be used overseas. As my phone here isn't compatible with a SIM card, this was the cheapest and most efficient option. The phone arrived in just a few days and now I'll have a phone that is ready to go when I arrive in Dublin. As a woman traveling alone, I feel more secure knowing that I can contact someone if anything goes astray.The phone itself is small enough to fit into my purse or pocket and comes with all the necessary plus and adapters, as well as a pocketsized quick guide for making calls. Just plugged it in to check it out and everything looks like it'll work great.
summary: Quick and easy delivery, perfect for last minute travel

reviewText: I'm only going to France for a week and didn't need anything fancy.  Due to the reasonable price and the easy setup, I have confidence that this phone and plan will fit the bill.  I ordered through Amazon as the shipping was much lower than if I'd ordered directly from the distributor.  So far, I'm pleased.  Plus, they'll give you $10 or airtime if you write a review.  Hence, the preceding...

I like that it's small enough to fit in your product. And that it's simple to use. I liked that it comes with a euro adapter plug. Lastly, I like that I can get get a UK number registered in before arriving in Europe. Huge plus if you need to tell someone your number in advance. No problems!
functioned a advertized...easy to use and to manage when overseas  Pleased with the product.  Happy to recommend  nice product thanks
Seems strange to travel without a phone these days.  This one worked just fine. Hope to use it for future trips.

This phone performed fine for the most part once I figured out that there needs to be a network name as well as an "R" (for roam?) on the display for it to connect my phone calls while I was in Italy.  I got an error messages for the first couple of days in Italy because I didn't realize that I needed to "manually" select a network.  There was no "R" symbol on my display nor a network name.  As soon as I went thru the phone settings to choose a network, an "R" appeared as well as the network name on my display and I was able to place my calls and send text.  In Italy, some of the network choices I had to choose from were:  IWIND, ITIM, VondafoneIT (The directions to select Network is in your operations booklet for the phone.  It's pretty easy.)When placing a call to the USA, it gave me a dial tone then a recorded voice comes on telling me how much time I had left.  I'm not sure why it tells you how much minutes you have left when your phone works off of a dollar amount you have on credit.  After the voice, your call will be placed and you'll hear the dial tone.These are things I had to find out the hard way on my two week vacation to Italy that were not explained in any of the documentation.  Phone worked fine to make calls within Italy and to USA once I figured this out.
summary: Quirky Phone but Worked After Selecting Network Settings

reviewText: WOW! I'm impressed. This looks to be very thought out, and will be quite handy on our trip to Europe!

My daughter traveled abroad for 3 months (London) and her cell phone could not be used over there. This phone gave both she and I a secure feeling. She would have it to call for taxi's or emergencys and I could connect with her if needed. She had a problem with it not working after a short time but the company sent her a new phone very quickly which totally surprised me.
summary: Emergency phone for my daughter traveling in Europe

reviewText: purchased two of these phones at a great price for our trip to london and paris with family.  they were easy to use, lightweight , the battery lasted a long time.  we were extremely pleased.  i added minutes  by contacting the customer service which was extremely easy.  this was a great way to keep up with each other while traveling abroad.  the texting feature worked well.  we feel like we will use them again in the future so it was a good buy.

Initial phone was defective - screen display was reversed (could only use with a mirror!).  Was to be given to daughter for UK trip but she was already on way to NY when phone arrived.  Telestial shipped replacement phone to her temp NY address but without SIM card.  They then shipped SIM card to here new temp address in Oxford.  All-in-all a very positive experience aside from initial defective phone and not shipping SIM card with replacement.  Phone worked great once all resolved.

Gave it 3 stars just because I was able to set it up (I think).  I didn't know they made cell phones so small.  My biggest concern though is that the charger adapter is really, really flimsy and I am not sure it won't just melt and blow up the phone.  The holes in the adapter into which the US prongs are supposed to fit are round and you have to jam the oblong US prongs into the round holes to make contact.  The Telestial rep was no help when I called to ask if that was the correct way to do it.
summary: Don't know yet if it really will work in Australia - doesn't work in the US

reviewText: Tellestra has the best customer service I have ever experienced with a cellular carrier, they respond promptly, curtiously and most importantly they help either fix the problem or otherwise make it right.
summary: Very Reaonable Price, Excelent Customer Service

reviewText: I bought this phone in March 2011, and I'm finally going on my trip.  I lived a year in London and this phone and set-up is much easier to use than any pay-as-you-go mobile I had while living in the UK.  From the sounds of other reviewers, I think the service may be much better too!  Thanks Telestial!
summary: Looking Forward to Using a Great Product!

reviewText: We had difficulty using this phone during our Italy trip (Milan area).When we could connect, it worked as intended.Also had a lot of difficulty setting up the US based number.Bottom line, too technically difficult to setup.

This item arrives in a very small box, and unpacks to include instructions, the phone, the headphones, and the sim card. It is easy to set up, and possible to get both a international number and U.S. phone number. You can also track your trip for free by dialing a number, which updates your location automatically. The phone is very light and tiny, which is good for packing. It's also very loud if you're worried about having issues hearing clearly on it. The buttons are very clear and easy to see.

This international cell phone is exactly what we need for my daughter going to Europe for two weeks. Her US cell phone didn't support international calling at all and so we researched renting cell phones. Then I discovered this phone on Amazon and bought it after comparing it to other similar items on Amazon. I like many things about this phone: price!, small size, radio, great customer service (I asked a few questions about the service), and ease of adding minutes. Telestial's website is very informative too.I didn't give the phone itself full stars because it's battery lasts only 14 hours on a charge. This is with it just sitting on. Bad battery? I called customer support and they said this is the expected time. I may have overlooked it, but I can't find where the battery life is mentioned in the features on Amazon. I looked and other similar phones on Amazon do list talk time and standby time. This is a setback for the phone, but is one that can be easily overcome. I think this should be noted on Amazon so the user will know to watch the battery level.I will post an update when my daughter gets back as far as the call success and quality. Overall, I think this is a great phone for the price.

I was pleased to have the ekit520 phone with me when I was out of the country.  My flights were changed at the last minute, and the phone allowed me to communicate this to the person I was meeting at Charles DeGaulle airport.I had customer service to help me set up the phone and then again to increase my minutes.  They were very good both times.For the money, it's great insurance to have this phone while abroad if your standard cell phone is not usable.

The phone was represented well; lots of value for the little size. Highly portable and easy to program and use. Would definitely recommend purchasing, as there are no surprise costs or worries over losing an expensive piece of technology abroad with this product.
This is a surprisingly nice little phone. My only problem with it is that even when fully charged the battery lasts less than 24 hours. For such a small phone you would expect it to last longer.

My husband and I ordered these phones to use in France. We had looked at so many options to have cell phone access and this seemed like the best one. We wanted to be able to call each other in France, more so than use the phones for calling back to the States. We also wanted to leave a phone number so that people could call us for an emergency. The set up for using the phone is easy. You can't access the network in the States so at this point we won't know if it is working as it should until we are overseas.

Got my hands on one of those phones before leaving for  2.5 months to Europe.(The  Netherlands, Belgium and France). Came also with a $10.00 passport card I was able to use in all three countries for the same price per call. Used it mostly in Belgium.Because I spent one and a half month in the Netherlands and one month in French I also purchased local sims for each country from local providers, KPN in the Netherlands and I can't remember the one in France, that way calls made within the country were considerably cheaper. Of course those sim cards have only a local number and not an English/USA number as with the passport card. Spent too little time in Belgium to purchase a local sim there.It served me very well and I was happy with the performance of it. I also used  the Alarm function it had every morning. Never failed. Battery holds up very well.I'm a simple phone user, don't take pictures,  don't play games,  don't listen to radio etc. and I don't use the phone if there is nothing to say. Yes, I'm different. Therefore the phone did for me what I wanted it to do. Between using that and Skype my communication costs were minimal.

Just got the phone. It's really cute and so glad it's small enough for my tiny purse. I'm charging it right now, so I will have to get back about how well it works. It came with a charger, earplugs, and an international adapter piece along with the sim card. So far so good. I'm going to try it out here in the states before I leave.
This phone did all that it was advertised to do.  It works in the USA and out of the country.  Used it in Italy and it worked fine albeit, I only used it for two calls.

worked well enough for my trip to europe.  i bought more sim cards when i got over there, because i used up the one that came with it pretty fast. but for a cheap travel phone to contact people as i traveled it was great
summary: because i used up the one that came with it pretty fast. but for a cheap travel phone to ...

reviewText: I bought this phone for use in Italy.  I got a $5.00 credit with it.  I thought it would be safer and cheaper than bringing my own cell phone. When I tried to get more time, I was told that I would have to pay $50 if I went thru customer service or $30. if I did it thru the phone.  When I tried using the phone, I was sent to customer service. This happened several times so I gave up.  Also, they say that your family can contact you with numbers they give you but no one could get thru to me. My family was worried.  The only thing that saved me was free e-mail at the hotels.  If I had it to do over, I would bring my own cell phone,  It probably would have been cheaper. I would not recommend this phone at all.

I know that some of the purchasers of this product had difficulty using it, but I bought this phone/SIM for a person that I would described as a true non-techie. After placing the SIM card in the phone, obtaining a U.S. phone number (comes with a European #), showing the person I bought this for, how to unlock the phone, input the pin number (for the SIM), make and receive calls, she was able to use it when she traveled to South Africa.The phone is very small and ordinary. You get what you pay for, so this is certainly a no-frills phone.The downside is that because the U.S. uses different networks than other countries, the ability to make and receive calls cannot be tested until you leave this country. That's were some people seem to run into trouble. Of course, there is nothing that Telestial or any other company that sells world phones can do about it.If all you want is to be able to make and receive calls while you're in another country, this phone serves its purpose. I would recommend it to anyone. It's not overly complicated. But, for anyone who may consider themselves technologically impaired, practice the steps you would follow to make a call before you leave the country.
summary: For the price, it serves its purpose

reviewText: I got this phone for emergencies and phone number availability while travelling for almost a month in the UK with friends.  Staying at mostly B&Bs;, it was really helpful to contact them a day before to make sure that I had the right information and, once to arrange a quick change of plans at the last minute.The phone worked in the UK (with a UK number for the couple of B&Bs; that wanted me to have a UK number in case of emergencies) and in the EU (France).  The phone rates were tollerable (I'm not used to pay-per-minute on my regular cell) and easy to re-up, even in a car-park (that's "English" for parking lot ;) in Glastonbury.The charger is not interchangable with much, and only came with a EU plug, but since I was walking around with all sorts of adapters for my other stuff, it worked just fine.The battery life and pay-per-minute plan meant that it was really for emergency use and not for running a business or long-winded conversations with folks back home.  A full charge would last a few days with no calls, but I would need to charge it daily if I used it.And, while I didn't need to use it, I was able to provide my parents with a US number they could call me at, which was great!ProTip:  Preload all of your hotels, B&Bs;, and other numbers before you leave!  Saved bunches of time and panic by being able to pull out the phone and just dial.
summary: Great Emergency Phone While Travelling in Europe

reviewText: Bought two of these.  Used them for calling phone-to-phone and calling from Spain to the USA and from France to the USA.A couple of thoughts:- Read all the documentation thoroughly in order to understand how to buy minutes, set-up the phone and operate the phone.  The manual and quick-start give you all the info you need.- The phones were super.  Their rugged and will probably last a long time.- The phones are more suited for basic communication (calling/texting), although they can do a bit more.  I stuck to the basics.Very pleased with the service, as it was much cheaper than roaming would have been for me or then other services.  Also, I was nervous about having to use my Smartphone in certain touristy public areas, where we traveled, as the pickpockets and thieves were around.  With this phone, I felt secure.The service was available everywhere we tried it (mainly urban areas in Spain and France).The phone itself ships with a charger and a battery.Bottom line, I'm holding onto the phone and will use on other trips.  No regrets.
summary: Worked Well in Spain and France

reviewText: got this little phone for a trip to Germany and Holland. Last year, though my carrier told me my own phone wouldn't make calls but that the wifi would be working, but I found that afttr many tries and battery removal & replacement and wifi settings adjustments, that it just didnt work there at all wifi or not... so, this time I got this for contacting my travel companions. Unfortunately there is no way to test it until you leave the USA. so I was doubtful but hopeful..i tried calling someone once i got to the hostel, but it never went through, I dont know if anyone tried calling me as it never rang. the compact size makes it good for travel, but without any call going through, i should have brought a paperclip. instead.they are even smaller..  of course I added $ 50 prepaid, in the event that it worked to allow for mis-dials, unfamiliarity with product and multiple call attempts...but that never happened, so now I have an $80 plastic paperweight.  granted $ 80 is not so much to lose, but Id rather have had a phone that worked.  Luckily this year, the wifi actually did work on my regular motorola phone so I wasnt up the creek totally. It does have a rather unusual way of making calls, but with all that considered it was still a flop for me..maybe it was defective? I guess I'll never know. I dont see anyway to ask for a refund, and doubt that they would, but thought I'd warn others in case they think they can depend on it.  there are plenty of internet cafes in the cities, so Id go that route next time and for $ 5/day you can check in and post messages to keep in touch. Or just go buy a phone with global capabilities from your carrier.
summary: would be great if it worked

reviewText: Got this for my recent trip to England, had no issues (possibly because it comes with a UK phone number?).  I only made a few outgoing calls and since incoming calls were free I didn't even use up my $5.00.  I also had a converter available to charge it whilst in England, since that is not included.  I only had one situation where I got sporadic service, think that was because I was on a farm in somewhat rural countryside.

I ordered this V520 just prior to our family's 14 day trip to Spain and France, based totally on prior reviews.  I mistakenly purchased the Telestial SIM card, rather than the phone set, so scrambled to correct my error.  An order placed at 5 pm on Friday resulted in the Telestial phone on my doorstep by 9 am on Saturday.  One-day shipping indeed!  So far, setting up phone proved to be a breeze, even for technologically illiterate, first-time user of such a phone.  All of previous reviews are right on, from super small-print instructions to complete accessories (the Euro-adopter was a nice touch).  Unmentioned are the great variety of ring tones (loud ones), including Queen's 'We Will Rock You.'  As others noted, this is no frills - we have it so that we can make a call to our hosts as soon as we arrive to Spain, and so that family can reach us in case of emergency.  A sound investment for just $30.  Will offer follow-up upon return.
summary: Looks and works great so far!

reviewText: Can't beat this.  I bought one for myself and another for my daughter who was travelling in Africa and Europe. I met her later on in Europe and we used these phones to communicate.  I was able to call her for free from home in the US before leaving for Europe because they include a US number in addition to an overseas number and allow 30 free incoming call minutes.  The phones worked flawlessly, reception was clear as can be, and the instrutions were very clear.  I called customer service once and got a very rapid response to my question.  It was easy to add minutes.  The calls are not cheap (about $1 per minute, 79cents for text messages)but I felt that the cost was acceptable.  Overall, these phones made a huge difference in our travels overseas and I highly recommend them and the company.

I bought the V520 kit for my daughter who was going to France.  The phone is little and easy to activate.  I got a US phone number as well as a British number from the SIM card which comes with $5 credit.  I got another $5 credit by going to [...] to set up a travel journal which is a neat thing to keep your friends posted about your travel.  I am also supposed to get $10 credit for writing a review.The morning that she arrived, I knew that she had made contact with my friend who was supposed to meet her there, by just looking at the calling history at the website.  The best thing is I can call her.  The first time the call didn't go through but it went through the second time.  The voice was clear.  The third time we got cut off after 6 minutes.All in all, I am very happy with the purchase.  I have so far called the British number and the incoming calls for her are free.  The US number, however, was charged 30 cents a minute but that number was called from France itself. I think they say you get 30 minutes for free when the US number is called from the US.I would highly recommend this phone for anyone who is going abroad and who wants to have a way to keep in touch.  The calls from abroad are expensive at 99c a minute but you can always call them back from here, which is a lot cheaper. It gives a peace of mind that you can always reach the traveling person.
summary: Great little phone for the money

reviewText: I bought this as an emergency backup phone for travel in Europe. I only tried to use it once to make a call from London to Madrid and it didn't work.  Followed all the instructions, and there are many steps to go through, and the phone did nothing. No dial tone, no message of anything wrong or of what to do.  So I tried texting to let my family know that I had missed my US flight. The text was sent but who knows where it ended up because my family never received it.  Unreliable service when you most need it.  Phone was fully charged, I had my London and US# activated, entered my PIN, had $10 on the Global Lite Sim Card, and all that turned out to be useless.

I took this phone with me for a trip to Paris, France and it worked just fine for me.  I only made a few calls and sent and received a couple of text messages within France, and it worked just fine for both the calls and texts.  If you only need a phone for a short time, such as when traveling, and only want basic functions, this phone is sufficient. It is very small, looks almost like a child's toy, but that can be a plus when traveling, it doesn't take up much space at all. It is very basic, but it worked perfectly for what I needed during my vacation travels.

I ordered the V520 for an upcoming trip to Italy after extensive on line research on the simplest cheapest way to have an emergency phone for Europe. Unit arrived promptly and contained phone, US charger, plug adapter for Europe, and hands free cord. Activation via a US landline was easy. Haven't used the phone yet since it won't work in US but so far, so good. Based on everything up to now I'd recommend this unit.

Watch out - YOU WILL BE SORRY -  This is what the add says:FREE to receive calls in France, Italy, Spain and the UK on the +44 number; 19c/min on the +1 number <-actually, about .50 on the US number, but, if you are in Greece, about $1.50!!ACTUALLY - They stick a .30 cent surcharge on the calls to the US number.  Secondly, they charge for incoming texts.  Most carriers will not charge you on incoming - just outgoing texts.  This is way more expensive than my AT&T; rates (which suck) and off the scale compared to a European pay as you go phone.Zone 1a $0.99 $1.49 FREE $0.79 FREEZone 1b $0.99 $1.49 $0.89 $0.79 FREEZone 2 $1.39 $1.89 $1.19 $0.79 $0.26Zone 3 $2.39 $2.89 $1.99 $0.79 $1.00Zone 4 $3.49 $3.99 $2.99 $0.79 $2.50Zone 5 $4.49 $4.99 $3.99 $0.99 $3.50There are only 4 zone 1a countries - the US, Italy, France, and Spain.  You can buy an Orange phone at the airport that is way cheaperWhen you expand the rate info, you find many surcharges - so the actual rate is higher than your plain old cell phone!!!!!You are far better off just using a T-Mobile pone ($99/Minute)Also - remember, the folks calling your UK number are going to get billed a higher Mobile rate so the total cost per minute is about $150 for calls (.89+.30+.19) if someone calls your US number!!What a scam - I am amazed Amazon lets this happen on their site!!Paul

I have a relative using this phone in Europe and it's very easy for her to use.I left off a star because the service is expensive for outgoing calls. I originally bought this for emergencies, but if you plan on using it more extensively, I recommend you at least get a SIM card service that provides free incoming calls... it costs about $1.00/minute from Europe... and $1.00-$1.50 a minute from EU-EU depending on if it's a landline or cell... it can add up quickly... thankfully it's easy to log online and put more money on the SIM...small price to pay for piece of mind.
summary: Great phone for basic overseas use

reviewText: I could not get a network or connection attempting to use it in Brazil.  I tried changing the settings to no avail.

Ordered this to have an emergency phone when I had to travel to Europe for 10 days leaving ailing parents at home. The package arrived promptly, the set-up was easy, the phone was compact and easy to carry. Unfortunately, it was also a dud. Died completely on my fourth day out. Wouldn't turn on, wouldn't charge, nothing. Return was also easy; money refunded, no questions asked. But while deft customer service is nice, having an item that actually worked would have been much nicer. A real disappointment.There are lots of four-and five-star reviews here, true, but take a look at how many are written by people who say clearly they haven't tried the phone yet. What are they reviewing? That they got a package in the mail? Just be aware that the company offers some free airtime to anyone who writes a review...
summary: everything about the transaction was fine -- except the useless phone

reviewText: I bought this phone for my brother studying abroad in France. By his report the battery lasts many days, but the minutes were very expensive to refill. He got a new sim card and number and it worked fine. Perfect for emergency use.
summary: good cheap simple phone, expensive minutes

reviewText: Everything seems to be included in the package. The instructions are clear. I will be anxious to use the phone once I am in Europe.

Got this for my parents, who are using it for their Europe trip right now. No real complaints. This is a good, relatively inexpensive option, especially for those who are not comfortable shopping for a new SIM in every country. The pricing for texts and calls is better than what they would have paid if they used Verizon's global plan. One thing I should point out is that the phone is smaller than I expected...nothing misleading about the size in the description, just that I didn't realize how small it would be.

I ordered two of the V520 kits for my upcoming trip to Europe. I previously ordered a sim card from Telestial since I already had an unlocked phone. I was so pleased with the service and rates that I ordered these two kits for my travel companions. We use these phones if we get separated or if we are doing different things during the day. A quick call or text message to let your companions know where to meet is so much easier than trying to coordinate everything in the morning before you leave the hotel. Keep in mind that it's a pretty basic phone, but that's exactly what I was looking for. I don't need a camera or an mp3 player on my traveling phone - only something to make a quick call or text. It's also a snap to set up and the Telestial customer service is great if you have any questions or problems. I would highly recommend the V520 kit - it's the perfect in a pinch vacation phone.

I have always like the idea of having a phone that works in multiple counties. This is about as cheap as you can find an international phone/sim combo. The price is good, the phone is not a very high quality phone, but it is a phone that will work great to take on vacation with you. It has basic features such as calling and T9 for texting. You dont need too much more for a vacation phone.

Received phone quickly...phone is very small so not advised for people who need larger print etc...worked okay...I had another phone that I found and purchased in Ireland as the phone number for this was in England...fees much higher it seemed for people to call me who lived in Ireland...
Phone works well for Spain. Had a lot of trouble receiving messages. Some bugs fixed, and I can contact my host family in Spain, and my family in the United States.
summary: Phone works well for Spain. Had a lot of ...

reviewText: I ordered this product for a recent trip to Europe. (May 12, 2013) It never worked.  Several emails back and forth with customer service availed NOTHING.  I was left dependant on total strangers lending me their phones or free internet at hotels to keep in touch with my family.AWFUL product!!!Sat next to an International Communications and Technology expert on one train ride in Paris.  He checked out the phone and the sim card..."total piece of junk" ....his official conclusion.
summary: Total Waste of Time and Money!!!  DON'T BUY IT

reviewText: I purchased this phone for a trip to Africa.  Unfortunately, I never worked.  The instructions aren't very good.  I don't recommend it.

Don't waste your time with this product.  It DOES NOT work in the US, so you can't test it before you leave the country & travel.  I bought it for my trip to Costa Rica & it DID NOT work at all.  Since it didn't work the great customer service others have raved about did not help - I could not contact them!  I used the customer service prior to my vacation to try to ensure I had everything set up properly before I left & the service isn't as oustanding as it seems.  I felt I received canned answers to my questions that didn't always relate to what my question & issues were.

Even calling and getting instructions step by step, I had a very difficult time using this phone.  I don't think it was just this phone, I believe it is any phone that has this kind of capability.  As a travel agent, I wanted to try this but didn't have much luck.  The written instructions were sketchy at best and would never work so I had to call and have someone explain it to me.  I tried it when I was in Rome but it took several tries and used up most of the air time just trying to get a call started.  From now on, I will just go to my local cell phone store and have them set up a package on my smart phone before I leave the country again.

Worked for me on my trip! Very lightweight and small, great for emergencies. I even called Telestial customer service while in Europe (keep the handy info it comes with when you travel!!), and although I had to go through a typical Press-This-Number Menu initially, a HUMAN BEING answered promptly and answered my question (I could not figure out how to dial a European number on the phone what with all the + signs and extra numbers, as I had purchased the trip in North America, but was using it abroad.. I'm sorry I forgot what he told me, but whatever he told me worked!).If anything, I'd buy a phone with more minutes on it, as they were quickly used up!! Also, I found the menu very difficult to use, as I'm so used to Smart Phones. I couldn't figure out how to go "Back" on a menu, and had to start over repeatedly to get to where I wanted to. Obviously, this is an old-school phone, so don't forget to put on your old-school thinking cap when using this.

When the phone arrived I had a problem setting it up so I called Customer Service and was helped by a friendly person. When I got to Europe I sent my family a text message. I thought I was on my way when I had replies from my family. A few nights later we had an emergency and I needed to contact my banker. Well I couldn't get through, I followed all of the directions and even tried variations. Then I tried customer service with the same results. I tried to call my daughter, who I had successfully text, and could not get through. We had the hotel connect our in room phone and successfully made our calls with the same numbers we had used on the cell phone. Needless to say we will never buy one of these phones again when we travel abroad.

I bought this to be able to check in with my dogsitter while in Europe for 2 weeks. The service was at best spotty. In London it took 6 calls to connect to 1 person, in Le Harve there was no service at all. After 4 days of trying I finally reached the dogsitter to find that she had been sending text messages every day.......none were ever received. When actually able to make calls the conversations were painstakingly slow due to the number of times we had to repeat or have things repeated to us. I never did try to contact customer service.......it's a phone, I should not have to spend my vacation with customer service just to place/receive a call.

I'm happy with the phone!  I received it on time, and the size is perfect for travel.  Do not look to this phone for much on the side of tech-savvy extras, but it is excellent for emergency calls and text messages.  It is nice that you can call your family and vice-versa free of charge for 30 minutes, and the customer service availability is a treat!  It comes with an round prong adapter for use abroad, just in case :-)
summary: Great Simple Phone for International Travel

reviewText: I need a phone for travel in Europe and sub-Sahara Africa next month.  After a lot of research, I ordered the Telestial Kit 4c.The kit arrived promptly (3 work days after ordering) and had full documentation.  I had an issue with installing the SIM card and emailed customer service late on a Sunday afternoon.  I received an informative response with 30 minutes that solved my issue.Both the U.S. and UK numbers are working properly.I'm pleased with the purchase!

Travelling all over the world for an extended vacation.  I wanted a simple phone that lets me call when I need to and enjoy my quiet time when I want it.  The phone is small, light and the sim card instructions are easy compared to most worldwide sims.  Great service and quick delivery.
The phone was not easy to program. Required call to the CS help desk to resolve. Hope it works as promised.

If you are going to need a cell phone while traveling in Europe for emergencies, you will not find a better service.  Check out their website for rates, but in Spain, France, Italy and the UK you get free incoming text messages and incoming calls on a +44 UK phone number that is provided for you.  If you want a US based number, incoming texts are only .15 and incoming calls are .30 cents a minute which is still a good deal for a international pre-paid plan.  Outgoing calls start at .99 cents a minute and outgoing texts are .75 cents, but this phone is not made for people who will be making a lot of outgoing calls while traveling.  The phone is very small and fits in the palm of your hand.  It comes pre-loaded with $10 in credit.  The phone is easy to set up and a charger and headset is included.  You can do the research yourself, but you will not find a better price.
summary: Great phone at a great price

reviewText: I took this on a trip to France and it worked for maybe a second.  It was very hard to find a signal and when it did, I couldn't get a call or text message to transmit.  I was in Paris too, which shouldn't have a signal problem.  I suggest skipping this cheap phone.  Too unreliable to be of any use.

This is the first time I've needed a phone for travel to Europe.  I came across a lot of information and service providers while searching the Web.  Telestial seemed to have what I was looking for at a very reasonable entry-level price.  The reviews for this company and its products are what prompted me to make the purchase.  So far I am very happy with the purchase and what the kit came with.  The phone is simple and small.  There was a headset, charger and adapter for European electrical outlets.  The Web site was very straightforward to work with.  The only thing that is left is to make the trip to Europe and use the phone.  Based on what I have read by others, I am confident that I will not have any problems.  More importantly, if I do have problems, I feel assured that they will be resoved based on other reviews about Telestials customer service.
summary: So far, pleased with this purchase

reviewText: I sent an e-mail a while back with a few questions about how to use the product for an upcoming trip(maybe once in a lifetime) trip to Europe and have heard nothing from the company at all.  Both phones are still unopened and await your reply.

Good things arrive in small packages.  But this small surprised me; I thought it might be missing the full kit as directly sold by Telestial.  Yes, everything was all there; the unlocked phone, sim card, battery, recharger, and electrical adapter for Europe including written documentation pamphlets and a wallet sized quick reference card.  This no-frills cell phone clearly is designed for the frugal traveler.  Frugal because the vacation is not about telephoning on it every day to talk with the people back home; use the telephone at your lodging.  The phone's features and services provided deliver the essentials.  It's not about taking photographs with your cell phone.  Your brought your own and better digital camera for that.  Yet it includes a travel journal that is automatically updated and that you can manually update on the web with your camera pictures.  It's not about game playing and web-surfing but it does have texting too.  It's about a phone to place and receive a call when its necessary, an address book, and has voicemail.  These three are the most important to me; it has more and sensible features as well.  Such as fast dialing to essentials like local emergency services for the country that one is in, customer support, and either automatic or fast dial recharge of call minutes.  But that's not all, as goes the saying.The customer support by telephone is very good.  The people who answer your call are very knowledgeable and courteous; they are excellent.  You quickly get answers and the right ones.  Yet one needs to be prepared for heavy call volumes sometimes putting one on hold.  Were it not for that I would rate it overall excellent.  But it is not trying on one' patience as within a few minutes wait one gets through to a real person without playing voice menu maze.  And here they must be heralded for sensibly minimizing that nonsense.  One finds it much easier to wait when it takes at most two levels to get to someone.OK, what are the downsides?  Fine print.  No, not the legal stipulations.  It's that all the documentation provided is printed too small for these old eyes to read without strain.  Go to the web-site or call customer support when one's eyes give out.  And don't throw away anything that you get in that small box including what looks like advertising because it is useful sooner or later.  There is one other thing that could be better documented.  It's the free thirty minutes one can use to receive calls without being charged or charging the cost to the caller.  It took a telephone call to customer support to get it properly explained.  But these are hardly onerous inconveniences that detract from the overall value and convenience.I liken this cell phone and service to another low-cost provider in the U.S. (name intentionally withheld) that also provides excellent value in the phone but the main difference is that Telestial's telephone customer support is superior.  For the traveler who wants to vacation hassle-free, then this is the overall best value phone and service to have.

I purchased this product for my daughter to use in Paris this summer.  All functions have worked well. The website details all the charges posted to the account.  I am pleased with this product and would buy again.

I didn't know what to expect with this desktop charger, I mean how excited can you be about a phone charger?  But its so convenient to be able to charge my phone and an extra battery at the same time.  I was pleasantly surprised.
My old charger eventually gave up after 2 years so I needed a replacement. The new charging station I purchased works great! Fully charges batteries in about 2-3 hours.

Only fits Moto Q, not the newer Q 9h or Q 9c.  Has a mini usb adapter not the micro usb needed for the Q 9h.  Asside from that the unit is great will fit either battery, standard or extended life. will also fit the phone with the extended battery installed unlike the boxwave unit that will handle the Q 9h or any situation involving the extended battery. Great unit just pay attention to which phone it is for.

I received the Motorola desk charger recently. Good quality, charges quickly. One problem, I can't leave the battery cover on the phone while charging. Does not fit. Also, the charge port fits too tight as you slide it in.Overall a good product.
This is very easy to use for myself, as I have a disability and limited dexterity. i no longer have to plug in my phone. I can simply slide it in and out.

After reading J. Bailey's review, I almost passed on this item.  I am SO glad I took a chance and bought it!  It does everything the spec's claim without a hitch.I'm using a desktop computer with powered USB port, one extended life battery (in the Q) and one standard size backup battery.  The charger AND data sync work fine with the same cable at the same time. (Not sure why Jay had so many problems with this unit - perhaps an underpowered USB port? This is covered in the documantaion as a footnote.)The snug fit of the Q in this charger base is a BIG plus!
