I have used other chargers that had a looser fit and I often had to wiggle the Q to get it to line up with the mini USB plug inside the charger saddle - Not with this unit - It alignes perfectly and slides right in with one hand!This charger is also heavier than the products I've used in the past, which is really nice when using the Q, again with one hand, while in the charger - it stays put on the desk (as long as the rubber feet are dust free).One caution involving the battery indicator light:  When I inserted the Q and a spare battery at the same time, the indicator showed a flashing red light after 2 - 3 minutes.  The documentation describes this as a "bad battery" light.  But as soon as the Q was done charging, this light turned to a flashing green ("charging") and the battery charged without any problem.  The light turned to solid green when the spare battery was fully charged about an hour later.I give this product a 10!  It addressed all the reasons I bought it with flying colors: Data synce while charging in a nice, solid, attractive interface, able to charge Q and spare battery together, automatically, overnight without the use of a separate power supply and cable.  The one handed operation was a nice surprise.

If you own a Q, you know the battery life with the standard battery is horrible.  This charger also has a slot for a 2nd battery, which is great. So I can charge my phone with the standard battery, and have the extended one Verizon sells in the back slot. Never having to worry about battery life again. Also, it makes a wonderful stand for the phone, and when hooked to the USB cable, you get data conectivity too.  Only downside, it won't charge the extended battery until the phone is fully charged.

This model is very slim and although ideal for a Motorola Q2, it will not work with a Q9x.  There is not a whole lot to it, but if you use your USB Sync Cable, it will synchronize and charge, and if you use your USB Charging cable it will do that to.  BUT you must have a Motorola Q2 (the skinny Q) ONLY.  The Q9x are too fat to fit in the charger.  Buyer beware... check your p's and q's :)

The Krusell Multidapt Blaze cell phone case is a top of the line protective case made for small to medium size flip phones. It is compact and easy to handle and has a mini slide clip on the back for clipping onto a belt, pocket or on a purse. I gave the case 4 stars, the best part about the Multidapt is that it is just that, it can adapt itself to wherever you need it to go. Krusell makes many more products that are compatible with the Blaze so that you can adjust it to your tastes or for whatever activity you need your phone for. The elastic strap on the bottom part of the case helps you to adjust the case to whatever length of cell phone you have and over time will stretch to suit the phone that you put in it. It also comes in a variety of colors to match your mood or lifestyle.Some of the drawbacks of the case are the interior lining, it tends to thread apart and you need to have a set of trimmers to keep the case from looking ragged. Another downside of the Blaze is the magnetic clasp, it sometimes will come undone and has a tendency to flop around. A stronger magnet would help that. Overall, the Krusell Blaze is a great cell phone case for the style and price, and as far as I know is not in stores.
summary: Stylish and adaptable cell phone case.

reviewText: The product was of good quality, but it was rather snug for my XV6700 Audiovox PDA.  Each time I would pull my phone out of the pouch, the battery backing would come off. I haven't used the leather pouch much since.

The previous reviews helped me finalize my decision to purchase this item. The cradle works exactly as promised. I wanted a desktop cradle so that I wouldn't have to be constantly searching for or tripping over the wire for the charger. As with previous reviews for this product- keep in mind this is only a cradle- you need to purchase the wire for charging seperately or use the charging wire that came with the phone to connect to the cradle. Honestly, I would have paid a slight premium to have the wire connected permanently and have a separate portable charging wire that came with the phone (rather than having to make an entirely seperate purchase for no solid reason). Also the cradle was designed so that you can not keep any kind of protective gear attached while in place (i.e. leather or silcon skin).

You have to buy the power supply separately. Why the box says "Desktop Charger" is beyond me. Wish I'd seen this review before I spent $40 on it at the Verizon Wireless store. I'll be taking it back for a refund.
summary: As others said, this isn't a charger despite what the box says

reviewText: When i first got this item i was very pleased, the free 2 day prime shipping got it here as expected and the product arrived in an unopened box from Motorola. Although i was disappointed that it did not have any sort of power supply ( take note future buyers)  i knew this from other reviews of this product  and simply hooked up my charger to it. The product it self feels very well built and has a relatively nice look to it. To my great disappointment  when i tried to put my phone which is a Motto Q9M it wouldn't fit and the mini  USB ports wouldn't align. For the $4 i paid for it it is certainly is worth it just to charge my second battery and since it seems as if the dock just isn't big enough to fit the phone I will just try to file out the dock so the phone fits. If you have an original Q this would be a great product or if you simply need a charger for the second battery motorola BT61 or BT91 for $4 you cant really go wrong

IMPORTANT INFORMATION!!!This will not work with the AT&T; or any other Moto Q smartphones that have the Micro-USB adapter. It has the Mini-USB adapter which is used for older versions of the MotoQ and other non-AT&T; models.I am disappointed because it looks like a well made and convenient piece of equipment.  Too bad it won't support the Micro-USB adapter which is the current standard for smartphones.No fault on the seller as it clearly states in the description this is for Mini-USB. I should have done some more research.  I ended up throwing the thing thing away as it's not worth bothering with a return on a $4 item.
summary: Do Not Buy if you have the AT&T MotoQ - Will Not Work!!!

reviewText: Once I got my Q I searched everywhere for a great base, and this is it! It will even charge your Q if you have the Extended battery on it (That battery is twice as thick as the standard one). It even has a spot to charge a spare battery! This charger has made my life much easier, because I always have a charged phone, or a backup battery ready to go.
My Moto Q has a micro-usb bult-in to the side.  This station has a mini.  Nothing in the tech specs.  Useless here.  Not even a good door-stop.

The "charger" is perfect if 1) you use an extended battery and/or extra batteries, and 2) if you don't have a rubber skin on your phone, since it won't fit in the charger.I have an extended battery, and the charger accomodates the extended battery whether it is on the phone or placed directly in the battery charging slot. The charger first charges the phone, then charges the extra battery in the battery slot, which makes a lot of sense.The Motorola belt holster works great, I recommend it instead of a skin case.
summary: Works great with extended battery and/or extra battery

reviewText: I dont have a Motorola Q.  I have a Sanyo Incognito.  I got this stand because it was priced right and it looked like a nice item for my desk at work.  So I got it, I used pliers to take out the annoying little docking port on the side and my phone sits in it perfectly.  Looks TERRIFIC on my desk.  It should work with any phone that has a relatively flat bottom edge.
summary: Nice looking stand for just about any phone

reviewText: I opened the charger, plugged it in and was able to use it as expected.  It also charges my spare battery in a seperate slot in the back.

I guess this would just OK if you just wanted a charger and didn't want to sync your Q with your PC, but if you want to do both (and who doesn't?), its a terrible design, here's why:The base only has one connection (mini-USB), so you can't plug in both the charger cord an a USB data cable at the same time.  Yes, I know that the PC USB port will also charge the phone, but only while the PC is not sleeping.  Also you must turn the phone OFF to have it charge from a USB port, otherwise it just "maintains" the current charge.  And if you do turn it off, then it doesn't SYNC.  Then your PC goes into sleep mode and turns the power off to the USB port and guess what? The next day, dead battery!My Treo charger is MUCH better (and somebody put some thought into it) because you can plug BOTH the data cable (for syncing) AND the power cable for charging into the back of the charger for the Treo.  That way, it both syncs AND charges (even if your PC goes to sleep after syncing your data).  This is just a DUMB motorola design.One other option is plugging the charger into an outlet so that it does charge and syncing the Q using bluetooth, but if your PC doesn't have bluetooth....I'm hoping I can find another charger for this phone that does both.  Anyway, NOT RECOMMENDED.
summary: This product is very poorly designed

reviewText: When I used this and purchased this item was great, just got around to rating these items that I haven't rated in the past.

Got this product, opened the box ready to charge and sync from work  only to find out it did not come with a cable and the accessory port doesn't match the cable that came with my Q making this product absolutely worthless. I now have to spend more money to get this product to work at all. I recommend finding something else to buy.John

I had to return it. It would have been useful if compatible. The construction of the thing seemed ok and very presentable.The thing is I own a Moto Q gsm. There is no real information about compatibility in the add so it was until I opened the package that a note informing about exclusive compatibility with Moto Q 2, was revealed.The location of the mini usb conectors varies by probably less than a cm. but it simply turns the thing useless if you own a recent model.(I'm still expecting my return to be processed, by the way).

I have a moto q9c with an extended battery, and many of the reviews mention that this unit does not work with this type phone. I have found if the battery cover is removed, it is a tight fit and takes a little careful pressure to insert the connector into the phone, but it functionally works. CAREFUL pressure is the essential approach here. The back battery slot is great!!

They did take it as a return,post office charged 6$ to shop back!! The Mororola Website said this docking station was universal, it was not!!! Sure wish it would have, I was so excited I bought batteries!! I was disappointed
summary: Did not fit my Q9 or Q9m

reviewText: This is an excellent product for the Moto Q.  I have one at home and one at the office.  It charges your spare battery and phone at the same time...so you never run out of juice.

Seems like a good little charger. Functional. Easy. And the battery charging station in back is nice as well. Sadly it doesn't fit my Q9m. You have to really jam it on there and then it says "This is not a valid Motorola Charger." So it won't even charge it.If you had the classic Q I'm sure it would fit though. Still for 4 bucks, it's worth it if you've got the right phone.
summary: Doesn't work with Q9m or Q9c Verizon

reviewText: After reading reviews here & "user forum's" I decided to purchase thisDesktop Charging Station.It can charge a secondary battery in the rear compartment AND can chargethe extended life batteries as well while the Q is on the charger.The "three color" LED indicator is added benefit, w/a simple guidethat is located underneath the unit.The charger can not "over-charge" the battery which is an added benefit.And, you can easily access the Q while on the charger for SMS texts, using any app., or even using the speaker phone while on the desktop charger.
summary: Great accessory! Almost a necessity, this should be included w/ the initial Q purchase

reviewText: This charging station works as advertised.  You must supply your own charging cord cord or usb cable. Those that came with the phone work fine.  The relatively inexpensive travel charger for the Q sold by Amazon also works.  When connected to your computer it will allow you to both sync and charge your Motorola Q.The unit is made from  medium weight plastic and your Q slides in from right to left (facing).  The three star rating is due to the fact that the station is just not a good value at its present price of nearly thirty dollars.  In fairness, I knew that when I bought it but went ahead anyway because as far as I know its the only game in town at the moment.
summary: What you see is what you get

reviewText: Excellent charger if you have more than one battery for the Q.  Accepts the regular and extended battery.

reviewerName: meow. "be kind, it's the least you can do. :)"
reviewText: I reeeeally didn't like this thing. I had to jam my phone in it every time I went to charge it and it was just a matter of time before the usb end of my phone becomes unusable. I love the idea of these things, I own others for my otehr phones, but this one is just not well made. :(

I understand the comments made by another reviewer about the lack of a power cord, however, since the "Q" comes with a cord, no problem!  This charging stand allows you to set up both the "Q" and an extra battery so that they charge simultaneously.  I like having not to have to switch batteries so I can charge from the device.Simple and functional product.
summary: Keeps both batteries charged in one operation

reviewText: Very tight fit with a MotoQ 9C with an extended battery.  If you are not careful to make a full connection it will completly discharge your battery instead of charging it.  Also since it is such a tight fit, it is difficult to connect and even more difficult to remove the phone from the charger.  I'm concerned that this might damnage the USB charging port on the phone.  Also be aware that the power cord is NOT included with the charger!!!  You need to provide your own USB charger(cord).

This clean-looking & simple little device [ASIN:B000HE8RI6 Motorola Q Desktop Charging Station] & [ASIN:B000HE5298 Motorola Moto Q Dual Pocket Desktop Charging Station] does all it's expected to: Connects Moto Q to Outlook on computer via MS ActiveSync (USB cable), keeps battery charged without removing it from Moto Q (via either USB cable or travel charger - either, not both, at one time), charges a spare battery in a second slot (with travel charger), & Moto Q is fully-functional in device (either USB or travel charger, same as above).  No setup required, assuming ActiveSync is already configured for Q via USB cable.  Obviously, you have to remove the Q from any case it may be in & then just slide it in the slot with built-in side plug.  All in all, very convenient with minimal desktop footprint, and Q can be always charged & ready to go.  Note: 'Not sure how long it would take via USB cable, if ever, to charge a fully-discharged battery while it was still in the Q (USB ports have power limitations)....  Motorola doesn't recommend charging via USB, but it does seem to work fairly quickly for a battery that isn't deeply discharged.
summary: Moto Q Desk Top Charger does it's job

reviewText: I wasn't able to get it to work with my phone of which I order it for so I return it eveen sending E-Mail to try to reslove the matter

I like this docking station because my cat loves to chew cords. This prevents that by hiding the cord well behind the end table, so that it's easy to take on and off.  I have no problems with this unit.
summary: Nice docking station for home or work

reviewText: I actually like this little docking station a lot. Yeah, it requires a separate cable, but that's a minor point, since I always buy extra cables for business travels.One thing I'd like to clarify is that both charging and synchronization DO INDEED OCCUR when the docking station is connected to my notebook computer, so I completely disagree with one of the criticisms noted in J. Bailey's prior review. See my comments on that specific review for more specific details (i.e., click the "Comment" link below that review.)Some of the things that I really like about this dock are listed below:1) The upright position of the dock allows easy viewing of the phone's screen while charging. (Cable-only chargers usually force you to lay a phone flat on a table or desktop.)2) The tight fit of the phone in the docking station actually supports the phone well enough to allow typing of quick inputs without removing the phone from the dock and disconnecting the charge/sync process (e.g., answering a call using the speakerphone feature, dismissing or rescheduling a reminder... things that you don't really think about until an event occurs when the phone is connected and you have to quickly decide what to do).3) It accommodates both regular and extended-life batteries, and allows both the battery inside the phone and a spare battery outside of the phone to charge simultaneously. This is VERY important to me, since I use extended-life batteries, and I always carry a spare with me. So when I return home, I simply plug in the phone and pop my spare into the charging slot behind it. (Cable-only chargers usually only charge the single battery inside the phone, and don't have any way of easily accommodating spares.) If you only use a single battery and never remove the phone's battery cover (like a sealed iPod or iPhone), then this probably isn't an important consideration for you.One thing I've noticed after buying my Moto Q is that I eventually discarded protective skins as too impractical, because I often swap batteries throughout the day when one of them gets low. I eventually tossed all of the protective skins and now just use the phone as is, so the tight fit of the phone within the dock is not an issue for me. (I prefer it this way, since it provides better support when making quick inputs without disconnecting.)Bottom line: The more I use this little docking station, the more I appreciate some of the subtle design features that the Motorola engineers incorporated into it... features that I never actually considered when I originally purchased it.If this product came with a charging cable, I'd definitely give it 5 stars, but without a cable, it gets 4 stars.
summary: Very nice design... Correction to one criticism on a previous review...

reviewText: This item was returned to the vender. It is only compatable with a computer.It does not have an alternative 12 volt plug.
Motorola should include this with each Motorola Q phone as standard equipment.  This should not be an add-on.
Very very unsatisfied with this product.My desktop charger accepts only the old style fat Moto plug.My Q9h has the new micro usb.This base is only useful to charge extra batteries

Its been said before, it doesn't come with a charger. It's simply a stand for your phone. It will charge a second battery if you need it. But the only reason I have a second battery is because the first one went bad. I would also be surprised if someone owns a cellphone that isn't in the case. So this means that you have to take it out of the case if you want to use this stand.So for what point would you buy this? Just lay the phone on the counter with your charger plugged in. You just don't need it.

I was really excited about getting this desktop charger.  I had purchased an extended battery with my Q, so I had two batteries that I needed to make sure were kept charged.  This was the perfect answer.The problem came however when I received it and did not get a cable with it.  Now I am sure that the store says something about it, however, one would expect that if they were ordering a "desktop CHARGER", it would come with the CHARGER.  But other than that, no complaints so far!  Thanks!
This case is perfect, no complaints here :)
summary: Platinum Skin Case w/Swivel Clip --LG VX8300

reviewText: the material ripped after 2 weeks of use . So I was forced into getting rid of the cover. This wasn't a good purchasable item. But I am still a believer in Amazon. Scott Bingham

reviewerName: Dwight McCann "So Much To Do, So Little Time"
reviewText: I bought this case because the plastic one that came with it originally cracked and wouldn't hold the phone securely.  But when I read the reviews of the replacement case, they were not good.  I will probably go back to the original style again.The major problem for me is that this case design makes the phone stick out from my belt significantly.  It catches on things.  And for some reason the phone flips open frequently.  The second thing I dislike about it is that moisture seems to collect between the clear plastic windows and the phone ... no I don't swim with it ... I have no idea where this wetness comes from.The good thing ... it looks OK and is what is advertised, which is more than you can say for a lot of stuff these days!
The quality is good.  The plastic around the ear side is a little sharp, so you can't press you head so firmly to hear your conversation.
I love the case.  It fits the phone perfectly.  My only complaint is that it gets in the way if you want to take a picture and it's very hard to remove from the phone.  Otherwise, it's a great item.
summary: Platinum Skin Case w/Swivel Clip --LG VX8300

reviewText: After a few days of wearing it, the button, which holds the case on the belt clip, came out.I thought that the word "skin" in the title would indicate either leather or cowhide. In fact, it is neoprene, a plastic!I would have given the product 0 stars, but, that was not an option.

I bought this 7 months ago.Pros: nice looking, stylishhas opening for micro SD cardhelps to protect phone if you're a clutz like meCons: covers up the volume control, camera and voice command buttonsswivels a bit too easilytends to "sweat", moisture underneath......which leads me to....case breaks if you try to remove!  I wanted to dry off the moistureI'm going to try and find a better one, otherwise I'll just have to buy the same thing again and don't try to take it off this time!

We purchased this case for our Samsung A640 phone with Sprint service and it is too tight for the pone.  The directions say "your case may seem snug when you first try to insert your phone, this is normal and it is important for you not to force the phone into the case but rather insert it gradually.  The case will quickly stretch to conform to the phone's shape."  We followed these directions and it is still too tight.  When the phone is inserted, the case depresses the photo button, turning on this function and disallowing the use of the phone for talking.  Also, my wife liked this case because of the stylish stitching, well, it started to come undone immediately.  We are sending this product back today.
This skin case looks great.  What's more it's snug but it fits fine.

Well constructed/crafted case of soft neoprene, clear plastic vinyl, and hard plastic belt clip.  Snugly fits the Samsung A640 except for one snafu - the side buttons (volume rocker, cameraphone button, speakerphone button) are compressed by the tight fitting clear plastic covering them.  This leads to accidental activation of cameraphone and speakerphone and volume changes unintentionally.  I recommend taking a thin, slender object and stretching the plastic until compression lessens.  This seems to remedy the problem for me.  Another option - insert a thin, slender object on both sides and leave in place to take away compression on these side buttons.Otherwise, a very stylish case.  The phone closes normally when the case is properly fitted.  Clear plastic protects camera lens and phone screen from undue scratches and damages.  The neoprene seems to do very well to absorb jolts and shocks and short drops.  Belt clip is a little stiff but fits securely wherever I choose to clip.
summary: Quality case for this specific model.

reviewText: The case for Samsung SPH-A640 flip phone that I bought is sleek and fits the phone well. The design is good, case has two sections which can be put on each section of the flip phone separately. It appears durable. It is good value for money.
summary: Case for Samsung SPH-A640 cell phone

reviewText: The headset was just as advertised and easy to use, once I figured it out.  I'm guessing, to save money, Plantronics does not include written instructions in the box.  The illustrations on the back of the box aren't the clearest or easiest to understand.

I bought this case as something different from my silicone case. I had seen hard clear plastic cases for ipods, and this was the first one I'd seen for the ZVM. I bought the neon pink one, and over my traditional black ZVM it looks great.Pros:Hard plastic case, esp. screen cover! Nice bright pink color, other colors available which look pretty. Really and easy to use secure belt clip. The easel wire on the back is handy for watching videos.Cons:Bulkiness. It has large hinges at the bottom and the sliders along the side are a bit bulky for my taste. They could definitely be slimmed down. I immediately cut off the lanyard on mine; the ZVM is a bit heavy to use around the neck. The port for the earphones is a bit small; my non-OEM earphone plug is L-shaped and if it twists, it can come unseated. There is  an opening at the bottom, but the OEM adapter doesn't fit. Maybe the second party slim adapter will? The shaping over the buttons is a bubbly kind of pattern, and over time the pattern shows up on your player; I'd personally have liked it squared off arund the buttons. And the silver "frame" around the screen is a bit...silly.So overall there are definite issues with this case, but it works just like it should for me. It is my 3rd one that I swap around with every once in a while, (others are a silicone and a leather one) and I really like it for when I am in college and going from car to class and sometimes it gets tossed in my bookbag. I hope new ones come out that are a bit more slim!

I bought my first Krusell case for a Nokia 6555. I liked it so much that I also bought this one for my ATT Tilt.My requirement for a case was to have a belt clip AND belt loops. If you use the clip then it is easier to slip it on and off and to place it in any area on your belt. If you take off the clip and use the belt loops then it fits slightly closer to your body and is far more secure without any shifting.Just be aware of the size. Krusell makes 6 different sizes. I suggest you go to their site and see what the different sizes are. My Tilt was not listed, so I simply measured the cell phone and found this size also fits phones such as the Blackberry, Moto Q and Treo. So, I figured it would fit my Tilt, and it did... perfectly.These cases are nice looking and well made. I highly recommend them.

Quality product.Highly recommended.Very functional Multidapt. Krusell should make one in brown so I can match it with my belt. Beltloops needs a little bit reinforcement.Will definitely buy this product again.
summary: Perfect fit for my Nokia E65

reviewText: I have searched for a decent holster for my HTC Hermes (Cingular 8525) with very little success. Most companies use the Treo case and tell it fits - not completely true.  I have a Krusell for my Razr and although i do not use that one a lot, liked the multiple attachment methods and the quality.  The case for the Hermes is extremely well made, looks good and functions the best of any i found.  It would get 5 stars if they could come up with a mount that had click stops on the rotator.
Love it. I've worn out 3. This is my fourth. The belt buckles are very sturdy and the case looks good. The clip it comes with is also good for casual use. Recommended.

Bought this for my new AT&T; 8525 phone.Fit: The phone seems to fit snugly in the case. If you don't lock your buttons, some of them will get pressed. It actually fits so tight in there that you have to pull on the cover to get the magnetic clip to lock in place. This may go away with use (but I'm not keeping it that long). The case seems a little stiff to my taste (although that might provide some extra protection to your device). The case has an opening at the bottom so that you can push the phone out (presumably for single handed removal). This didn't work for me and the only way I could remove the phone from the case was to hold it at both ends with thumb and index finger and pull it out. this caused several "almost accidents" as the phone slid from my grip.Quality: No complaints - the leather and workmanship seem to be OK. The only small issue was that the logo was glued on crookedly.Comfort: This is the reason I'm returning this case. With the provided clip (non swivel) the case actually extends 2 inches(!) away from your body. It tangles with everything - the shirt, the seatbelt, not to mention blocking all access to my Jeans' pocket. After removing the belt clip and attaching it using the belt loops the case fits closer to the body, does not rock as much and is generally less annoying. The pocket, however, remains out of reach.Perhaps, with the swivel attachment you can rotate the phone to the vertical position and that would help the pocket situation, but I'm not going to try. I'm returning the case and the phone goes back into my pocket until I find a better solution.
Very well made case.  Good quality materials.  I wish it had a swivel clip included.
I used this a couple of times, it is a cheap headset.  People complained they could hear me very well while I used it. For the price....it's to be expected.

I ordered this product based on the claim that it would be able to Sync with my iRiver H10 and allow me to add more songs to it. I needed a new Sync cable, because I had lost mine, and thought that this pack was a great deal so I went for it. When I received the items, everything appeared fine, and all of the charging devices worked. However, when I used the USB cable to Sync with my computer, all it did was charge my H10. It would not sync to the computer for information exchange. Obviously I was very perturbed by this, so I called the company I purchased it from, and they sent me a new cable swiftly to fix the problem. However, when the cable arrived it had the same problem. So I spent several days troubleshooting, only to come to the conclusion that I should have just bought a cable direct from iRiver.
summary: Great at charging, but wont sync

reviewText: Had to buy a 14x17" portfolio for graduation to put my work in. I hate this size in general because it's costly... BUT IF YOU HAVE to get one, buy this one. For price, functionality, and look, you can't beat this. It comes with 10 sheets protectors, a card holder, a slot to put extra papers in, and it zips closed. Hey students, if you're out there and missed a deal at Blick's or don't have time to go and get one in person, I will save you the time and research and suggest you buy this one.
summary: Perfect for professionals and graduating students!

reviewText: I think this is one of the best aftermarket chargers you can buy.  I own 2 and wouldn't be without them.  Not only can I use it to charge my cell phone 4 different ways, but with the multiple tips included I found I could use one for my Palm PDA, which enables me to charge 2 things I carry all the time, and need to bring only 1 charger wherever I go.  I keep one at the office and one travels with me wherever.

I had the earhugger before...it's great for only needing one cord for cell phone, i-pod and car charger. When I changed phones I looked for the new one and the info said it would fit my series phone. When it arrived the adapter did not fit. A call to J&R confirmed that I would need a different adapter. They transferred me to earhugger and for an additional $5 they would send me the new piece plus shipping...so this tiny piece cost $10 more to send. So the total was $10 more. Now that I have the piece it still doesn't work with my earhugger...waiting to see what will happen next but a total waste of time. They should have each series phone listed not 5400 series....very misleading...
summary: didn't fit my new phone although the info said it would

reviewText: I always am running out of juice on my Treo so this thing is perfect. I can use my car lighter, wall plug, usb port or a 9v battery!Great product.
summary: The best cell accessory  I have ever used!

reviewText: I love the PowerPod and used it all of the time with my MotoQ but now I have a Blackberry Storm and need the micro USB which they don't currently make.  I wish they would sell the adapters separately also.  I could switch to the I GO but the PowerPod is so much smaller.

I just wish they made an adapter for the new LG micro-USB. I used the PowerPod all the time with my old Moto Razr and my husband's LG when we were in the car or 'up north'. Love the retractable cord, that way I could keep my phone in the hands-free holster while charging in  my car. A really great after-market product, a couple acquaintances have bought their own since being in my vehicle and seeing mine. Very handy for travellers.
summary: I used it all the time

reviewText: i'm  getting another one becuase I wore my first oen out!  It eliminates the need to carry multiple charges when travelling and I have bailed out many a person becuase of the different phone attachments available!

I own 2 of these, had 4 at one time, one in each vehicle and one for on my boat and Quad, sold 2 to my friends when there phones died, they liked them so much that they bought them on the spot, I own the next generation one that is silver and includes about 10 tips, I have not found a phone that this won't fit yet, and i use an I-Phone and LG Vue along with always having a phone from my business, Can't believe they stopped making these units, thay are a real life saver especially to someone who's business relies on heavy phone usage. No Complaints from me about this item.

I purchased this item thinking it would be great to have with my Blackberry Storm phone and even on thier website where you can buy the tips, it says the tip will work for Blackberry 9500 and 9530, but even thou I have the 9530, it should work just fine as there is no power input difference between the phones. My bet and guess it that the power up unit probably does supply at least 5v output, but not enough mA which I believe needs to be 500mA or above to power the BB Storm phone. So, this unit it useless for me now, but it is a good concept and did work great with my roomates Samsung phone. Power Up needs to fix this so that it supplies more output in Amperage.
summary: Does not work with Blackberry Storm

reviewText: Definitely not as useful as I thought it would be.  The mini USB cable is very flimsy.  I doubt it would last long with much use.  The 12 volt plug-in seems a little flimsy too.  For some reason I thought there was a place to put a 9 volt battery inside so I would have back up power for my phone when waiting in the airport.  But the 9 volt plugs into the outside of the unit making it ungainly.  It works though I have already thrown it in the junk drawer as it is not very useful.  If you bought it on Amazon for $19 you probably got your money's worth but if you bought it in the airport for $35 you got ripped off.

This is a great travel charger (I have one) but if you buy here you get the older model (CCT-8351), which unfortunately is not compatible with Motorola phones like the RAZR. You need the CCT-8352 if you have a Motorola phone.

This product is the Swiss Army knife of rechargers.  Most of the time you will probably plug your device into the wall at night and forget about it.  But when you do forget about it (or you're traveling) this is the answer to your prayers.

This is a great travel charger for cell phones.  However, the car lighter charger needs a little help.  I had this for 2 weeks and the car lighter charger locking mechanism broke.  The charger is still functional, but it won't lock into a fixed position anymore.  That being said, I like this charger so much that I am considering buying another one to keep in my office.

This product didn't fit the Razor Phone that I purchased it for.  The cut outs didn't align and I couldn't charge the phone when the plastic cover was on it.  The cost wasn't too high, so it was worth the chance, but it didn't work out.  I ended up purchasing a quality cover from the AT&T Store for $30.00 but it's a lot nicer and everything works on it.
I can't really complain, because I believe that this was a case of you get what you pay for.  This phone case broke as I was installing it onto the phone.
summary: You get what you pay for

reviewText: I love my product.  I just wished I should picked the clip with my case.

I've been searching for a case that would protect my phone without altering all it's appealling features such as it's sleek profile and great looks.  This case does the job...you barely notice it once it's on there!

This case started out good but then began to collect a lot of dirt under it. the case is quite thin as well and one of the clips that hold it to the phone broke off. it's also easier to put on than to take off. it can scratch the phone as well not to mention getting scratches itself. not the best add on.

I ordered this for my girlfriend for her B-day. She has a Red Razor and I did not want to get a cover that would hide the phone. This cover was perfect! She loves it. I t made her happy so I am happy! A+++

This cost $6.67 through Amazon, with super saver shipping.  Other vendors are selling it for a dollar or two less in total, even though you have to pay for shipping through them.  Much to my disappointment, the plastic in this cover is sooooooo cheap; how cheap is it?  The first time you drop the phone, I'm positive the plastic will break, which is why you shouldn't pay what I paid, much less the suggested retail.On the positive side, the two parts fit my RAZR3 phone perfectly.  Even I, a super klutz, was able to put these on without breaking them, but it should be done gently.  I carry the phone, with the plastic cover, in a leather case, which is necessary to protect the phone in my purse.  Unfortunately, the plastic cover on the phone is necessary for me to keep the phone from slipping out of the leather case.  If you carried the phone with just the plastic cover, rest assured that the plastic would break, just in the course of normal wear and tear, very quickly.  Even at that, my last plastic cover, which was a great deal on Amazon for $2, was good for only a couple of years, so expect this cover not to last.

The Motorola RAZR V3 Plastic Shell Casing is a nice fit for my red RAZR.  I wanted the clear one so the red would show and it looks very nice.  I also like the fact that it protects me from inadvertently pushing the soft keys on the side (happened a lot prior to getting the case).Nice product!
I do not use this as it just did not fit my phone. Threw it right away.
summary: Did not fit well my motorola V3xx

reviewText: The image is slightly misleading, as each of the 2 pieces of the case is not a single piece of plastic but several pieces fitted together, so there are these bold, ugly lines running down and around the plastic casings.The top piece fit really tight the first time I put it on, and was really difficult to remove. After the first time, though, it wasn't much of an issue (I guess I simply "wore it in").To those saying that the case will "only" last a couple of years, come on, what do you expect? It's just a plastic case, and a thin one (although this one is actually thicker than my last) at that. It is what it is, and it'll serve your needs.
summary: More or less what you'd expect

reviewText: I found this to be slightly less dense than I first thought, that being said it has survived a beating and has protected my phone.  It was well worth the purchase.

I bought two of these plastic shell casings - one for myself and my one for my son.  They appeared sturdy and I liked the idea that they were clear so that you could still see the color of the phone.  Within one week, my son's clip broke.  Since I did not use the clip on mine, he traded with me and took mine.  That one did not last a week either.  Although the casing has worked fine, the clip is made cheaply and does not last.  If you do not need a clip, I still do not recommend it because you will have a protruding piece on the back of the casing where you would insert the clip.

I recieved this case 2 days BEFORE the estimated shipping date.  Very impressive.  It is nylon (not leather) and kind of plain.  But then I'm comparing it to my Hot pink case, lol!  The clip makes it bulky.  You can take the clip off and use the ring to hang a wristlet strap, but the plastic clip attachment won't come off and it sticks out (kinda aggravating).
The product was ok. It did a nice job of covering the phone but the clip on the back broke off after a couple of months of normal use. You can still use the shield but becomes much less useful.

I got the Razr for it's sleek styling but this cover, which I was hoping to be a slim fit leather, made the phone quite a bit bulkier. I thought the production quality was rather cheap. There were uneven stitches and crooked seams.It does it's job, but not a product I would recommend.
bought this for my wife so she would not bang up her phone  she loves it  stylish and clips well to her pants. perfect for her constant conersations
This product broke within two weeks of having it. The front piece also would not stay attached to the phone. It was not what I had expected.

My original shield from the AT&T store was a bit better quality, but this is  ok.  It doesn't look too "cheap".  I've had it for 3 months now and the black plastic around the camera part had broken off, not a huge deal.  The clip works really well.

Pros = It fits perfect on the Motorola Razr v3. Its hard shell works well to protect the phone. The rubber coating allows you to grip the phone easier. Cons = you can't see the blue tooth light. The belt clip stinks. So over all I like the snap on phone cover is great and it blend in well with my black V3 Razr

Just received my case today. I have the black RAZR V3 and this blends in quite well. Everything fits right, and the rubber coating allows for better grip. If you're looking at your phone closed, the bottom edge of the top piece rests higher than the rest of the phone...which doesn't happen when you don't have any case on. But I don't think there's anyway to get around that with faceplates. Overall satisfied.

The shell casing is great for preventing a razr from breaking, but looks apparently aren't of the highest concern for this product.  The rubber coating on the casing comes off with the simplest pick of the fingernail.  Not exactly what I wanted..
Decent cover for my V3re, but it isnt that strong. But it does have a good look and feel to it.
I don't have the phone or the case anymore but when I did have it, the case fit great on the phone.
Good design, fit and looks (before using.) Unfortunately, within days the rubber coating started to rub off leaving behind spots of shiny plastic. Too bad for an otherwise nice product.

I purchased this for my new Motorola RAZR V3 and it looks great.  The cover fits fairly well and provides a better grip when using the phone.  I would recommend this product to anyone looking to change/enhance the look of and protect their RAZR phone.
Product is great and fits very sleek. Only it should've had a plastic to cover keypad.
I love it nothing much more to say, except one thing, i did not like the clip option for this product, i wish this product was designed without this with only a flat back

Like some other reviews- this item fit great and felt secure-but after a week or so mine also began to just break apart with only light use and is now useless, I guess for the price you could buy a dozen extras, but I would pass on this model.
Works pretty good. I like the color and the feel. It's real nice and smooth and has a very good grip. It's exactly what I wanted.
This item cracked three days after I put it on my phone.  I loved the look of the item, but it was not very durable.

This cover started out great. Looked good and fit nicely, but the thin part near where the phone charges broke off and continued to fracture into little pieces. Wouldn't recommend this at all unless you're not going to be doing much with your phone. Mine sits in my purse and the cover still broke really quickly.

Product arrived alright, but simply does not stand up to day to day use. I've owned this for about two months now, and little bits of the case keep coming off. The plastic appears just to be too brittle to make it just sitting around. I am disappointed, to say the least.Additionally, there's no cover for the inside or outside screen, but I haven't seen that as a problem.

When I received this case for my Motorola V3, I liked it very much. It was perfect fit for Motorola Razr V3 and its look was really good... BUT it was not even one month and this case started breaking itself. First one small crack at the bottom part then two..three.. and it started cracking apart peace by peace.. finally I threw bottom part of the case and then same thing started with the top part in few days.. So I had to throw this case within 1 month
summary: Craked within one month... but excellent look

reviewText: Nice way to protect the phone but the belt clip , and or belt swivel holder is very easiely broken when you sit down or catch it on something.I have owned two because I liked them but I finally gave up and got a different type.

This is great.  I doesn't add bulk to the phone, yet protects it and I can now get a good grip on the phone.  I own several of these and the ruberized case is the best.  It also doesn't show finger prints like all the shinny ones do.
summary: Motorola RAZR V3 Plastic Shell Casing- Black, Rubber Coated

reviewText: Very nice, handy, working exactly as described(charges, connects to computer, syncs your camera etc)fits in my case with the rest of the stuff or in my pocket!VERY useful on the road and @ home,I have been using it with my cellphone too.I'd give it a 5 if its design was futuristic/elegant!
Don't waste your money on it!  The usb connector is just the normal mini usb connector, not the proprietary usb mini thats on the E330.

I am really enjoying using this stylus pen.It really works in using on my Mesmerize phone.I sometimes had difficulty texting with my fingers and with this stylus, it is a breeze! Also works in working with the phone on other pages and apps!
This adapter does not directly plug into the Fuji F10 plugin socket.The F10 socket has a diferent shape and 14 pins. This adapter has only 8 pins.
summary: Does not fit the F10 plug-in socket

reviewText: Works as advertised for my Kyocera Finecam SL300R. No problems so far, does 2 in 1 from a USB port in your computer.
Works like a champ - one cable to charge the phone (or any mini-USB device) and a motorola Bluetooth earpiece at the same time from the same charger.
summary: Motorola cable to charge bluetooth and phone from one charger

reviewText: This Y type splitter is great.  original Motorola equipment and no need to chase different cords around the car.

Did not detect my LG CU500, although it was advertised as being compatible. Emails to MobileAction went unanswered. Got the toll-call support number, and the tech said I needed a "secret" utility and he would email it to me. Never heard from them again.

Had a problem with software. It did not detect my phone. Had to called the company to fix the problem. The company does not have toll free number. It works now but I would buy original samsung data kit at ebay.
Buying a new battery allowed me to hold off buying a new cell phone for the time being.  Delivery was as quick as I had hopred!
they say the battery fits a mot krzr,, not, wrong not eeven close,, cover will not fit,,
This battery arrived on time, well within the time frame given. I'm pleased with the purchase.
Keeps my phone working! It is a regular battery that fit perfectly for my old cell phone. I will purchase this type again!

I bought a new Motorola C261 Tracfone about 6 months ago and it worked well when I first got it. The standby time was about 2 weeks, just like they said on their website. As the months went by though, the charge began draining faster and faster from the battery, until about a week ago I came home from work and it was dead again, so I charged it to full and went to bed. When I woke up the next morning the battery was dead again - it didn't last 8 hours, and I didn't even use it. I ordered the same model battery from right here on Amazon and plugged it in and charged it up, that was yesterday. The stupid thing is dead, right now, as I am typing this review. I can't believe this, I bought this brand new and its already dying out just like the last one did.I love the phone, and minutes with Tracfone are dirt cheap, but these crap batteries just really ruin a good thing.
summary: BC60 battery cant keep a charge

reviewText: Bought this battery to replace old one that was still good but standby time was shorter than 36 hour.Guess what, the  one I just have bought, is even worse.Because of low price I did even bother to return it.
The price was very reasonable and the service was excellent. I received the batteries in just a few short days of ordering them, placed them in my phone and was back to making calls immediately.
THIS WAS A REPLACEMENT BATTERY FOR MY CELL PHONE.  IT WAS THE PERFECT CHOICE BECAUSE OF THE REASONABLE PRICE AND FAST SHIPMENT.
Good OEM battery, seemed to be fresh and it holds a charge better than my original did when new. Shipping was very fast.

My phone came with the BC50 and after some research I purchased 2 of these batteries.  They work great and actually fit in the phone better.  There use to be a small "gap" between the battery and the phone back cover, now that is gone.  As far as performance, the BC60 in my phone a "SLVR L7" I get around 3hrs and 15 minutes talk time, and standy is about 16 hours. This is not great but with 1 of my BC50's it was about 2hrs talk time and 9-10 hrs stand by so there was an improvement. Not a bad price.  All in all I am very satisfied.
The charger is okay. It is built sturdy and I had no problems with it. However, it doesn't seem to charge my phone very quickly. It takes almost double the amount of time as the home plug-in charger.
can't complain.  it was cheap and it worked :)  it outlived the phone i had so that's always a plus

Waste of money.  Landfill fodder - and there's nothing I hate more than buying things that go straight to the landfill.  We used it once, then it broke.  Didn't drop it.  Didn't spill anything on it.  It just doesn't work.  A total piece of garbage.
summary: Garbage - a complete waste of a product

reviewText: This car charger was delivered in an "E wireless accessories" plastic bag from CellularFactory a quick three days after ordering.  The invoice reads "NOK-6101" and white imprints on the side of black charger read "6102/5310/E71  NK6102CC".  Although there's no confirmation on the unit indicating that it's actually a DC-4 car charger, the end does go into the phone's power connector rather than the USB port.  The Nokia 6102, 5310, and E71 cell phones listed on the unit use lithium-ion batteries similar to my C6-01, versus the car charger "suitable for Ni-Cd and Ni-Mh batteries" recently returned to another company.  Initial tests indicate that it's working as promised, but it has a RED charging light rather than the green light listed under Product Details.

Came in a genuine Nokia package. Works with my C6-01. Works flawlessly so far. Cord length is perfect from the outlet in my CR-V up to my windshield where I mount the phone. Happy purchase! And a lot cheaper than ordering from the main website ^_^
I plugged it in and it worked.  It works every time. A great buy and the quality is good.

I purchased the mobile charger to use it while navigating with the GPS assistance on my E71, I must say it works great, and it has been a great thing to have in over 2 hour trips, since the battery does get drained.
The battery for Nokia N75 goes out during a conversation, so having a car charger at hand just in case is really useful, not just reassuring.
bought for my Nokia E71 well over a year ago and it still works great!!! Much cheaper than buying one at retail store and this one works just as good!! would defiantly recommend to others!!

The phone car charger is fine. The customer service is not so good. Shipping was very slow arrived after promise by date which made it late for a gift. Answering email was also slow. I would by this product again but I would NOT buy from this company.
items works exactly as described, works great with my nokia e61
The charger that I received works fine but the one I got is not a genuine Nokia. It is branded "EZ Vehicle Charging Solution" and is made in China.
Reliable, original retail accessory shipped promptly.Indicator light and large (long) tip. Perfect for my Nokia phone and headset.
Works Great for Nokia C3 Cell Phone.  I use it everyday. To put it simply WORKS GREAT!  I would recommend highly.
summary: Works Great for Nokia C3 Cell Phone

reviewText: The batery of my 6120c lasts less If I surf in the Internet,  so I have it in the car every time i need it
This car charger does what it's supposed to, not much else to say. Doesn't feel cheap either. I'd buy one again.

THis charger arrived promptly and it works as advertised ! The DC-4 is a rapid charger so ur battery will heat up a bit but nothing to worry about !Also , the charger is a snug fit , but not as tight as another reviewer reported , maybe they had a defective unit ? . Mine fit nicely with no bfroken parts . Very recommended !
Bought it after my trip...my old one didn't work from Dollar General...works fine...just need to take another trip to use it.  Thanks

The local ATT in my town say to be weary if its not real NOKIA electronics because they my differ and damage my phones battery.Unless this is completely counter fit, I am very happy. This charger has a light on it to let you know its powered and itcharges my phone when I'm on the go. As far as I can tell its made by NOKIA -Has stamps/stickers, and the materials it's made out of are consistent with my stock outlet phone charger that came with my phone.Dealer shipped my charger fast and packed it as well as it needed. I would buy from them again.
summary: This Beats Paying $30 At My Local Dealer

reviewText: I had about given up trying to keep my phone charged while on the road.  The place I got my phone said they didn't exist.  Thank you!
summary: Absolute necessity for those who travel

reviewText: works seamlessly. it works great with a nokia phone and does what it was intended to do. a must-have product in your car for your phone.

excellent product unlike the car  charger I purchased recently online this charger syncs well with my n95. I was a bit apprehensive but it worked out well for me. I have the utmost confidence in this amazon seller
Unit is well made, performs well.It replaces an aftermarket that burned out and blew fuses. This unit is a genuine Nokia part.
Excelente cargador para el auto, al ser el original de Nokia, me aseguro de no dañar mi smartphone.Rápido en la carga y elegante diseño.
The barrel connector is too loose to fit securely in any Nokia phone and constantly falls out, and the cord is absurdly short.Save money and frustration, buy an aftermarket charger instead.

This Nokia DC-4 Mobile Charger fits the Nokia E63.  The charging time is normal rather than quick (such as when using a quick charger).  The construction is average.  If you prefer using an OEM charger in the car then this is it.
The coiled cord is coiled tight and can pull itself out of the phone while charging.  Otherwise it works well.
The order was acknowledged, filled and shipped promptly. The item was as advertised and the price was right. What more could I ask?

This thing works exactly as it should with my Nokia E71. As other reviewers have pointed out, the cigarette lighter plug does fit rather tightly, but I didn't have to force it in as other reviewers had. It's just as it's picture...the cord is nice and springy, and doesn't get tangled up. The plug fits nicely in the phone, and isn't loose or anything.

I don't have high expectations from a product like this. It charges my phone fine, and hasn't broken on me.I needed a car charger, but there's no way I was going to pay what they normally charge in stores for something like this.Like some others mentioned, it does have a cheap looking plastic, and is a tight fit, but none of that prevents me from getting the most out of it.I would absolutely recommend this charger.
I never received it from the vendor. USPS showed it was delivered, but I never got it. I contacted Vendor, but they haven't responded.
I needed a car charger and this one was the most affordable. It works great and charges my phone rather quickly.  I would recommend this charger to anyone looking for a car charger.

This charger works perfectly with my N810.  I had purchased from another location a charger that was supposed to work and it did except that the contact seemed intermittent.  This one charges the device perfectly.
In the website the description says that the product is Nokia original, but for my surprise the product is generic.
It's simply working fine. What do you expect from a car charger? It's robust and well-made.

Got this charger for my Nokia 6300 in Dec 2007. So far it's been working well, but after upgrading the firmware of my 6300 the phone refuses to charge, saying "Charger not supported".If this is caused by Nokia engineering they've screwed up - but if this charger is non-genuine I guess that may also be the cause. Buyer beware!
summary: Watch out if you have a 6300 with latest firmware!

reviewText: Though I bought this item a few months ago, I only just used it for the first time yesterday during a five-hour round trip.At first I had trouble pushing the charger into my VW car charging outlet, but all it took was a bit of shove and it was in.  Worked like a charm then, easily charging my phone up (Nokia 6650) within a two-hour leg of my trip.A few months ago when I bought my data cable and phone snap-on case I thought, "what the heck!" and threw the car charger in as a bonus since it was only a couple of bucks.  I'm so glad I did!  Because I needed it yesterday.  What a STEAL.

There's not much to comment on here...as the Nokia charger does what it's supposed to do...it charges my Nokia e71.  The fit is a little tight and requires a bit of force to plug into the cigarette plug.
very good product, i prefer buying the mobile charger from the same manufacture of my cellphone, the others may damage it.

I always have enjoyed nokia's car chargers.  It's a quality charger but is only compatible with Nokia phones/accessories.  With that being said, it has served me very well (E71x).  I would definitely buy it again.
Let me recharge the cellphone batteries in the car, since the one I'm using drains a lot of power.

I purchased this charger (Nokia branded) rather than a knockoff, assuming that I was going to get a superior product.  How wrong I was....I only resort to using this charger when my cell phone battery literally dies in the car.  Otherwise, I use the home charger only.This charger squeals/hisses extremely loudly (I can hear it over the radio) when my phone is plugged into it.  If I leave it charging for over 5 minutes, I begin getting a headache from the noise.  My girlfriend will not ride in my car if I plug my phone in.  Maybe I am just a lucky one with an extremely loud charger, but I will NEVER buy a Nokia branded charger again....ever.Dont waste your money.  Buy an el-cheapo charger that is quiet.
summary: LOUD high pitched noises when used

reviewText: Good product, would like it with a longer cord but it is ok, charges well, looks like made with quality materials...
summary: Good price, seems to be original

reviewText: What can you say. It's a genuine Nokia car charger. It's high quality. It's cheap, and it works. Bought one for myself. Bought one for my girlfriend. Bought another one for my girlfriend when her rabbit chewed up the first one. They all worked great.A friend of mine bought some no-name brand from a big box store. Paid more and it doesn't work as well. The no-name crapper charges so slow you'd have to drive around all day to charge your phone. If you are using the GPS feature while plugged into that one your battery still gets drained.No such problems with the Nokia DC-4. It charges fast, and will continue to charge even when using power hungry applications.EDIT: Note that this 2mm coax style charger will charge your device faster than the DC-6 Micro USB version (890 mAh vs. 500).
summary: It's OEM Nokia, it works, and it's cheap

reviewText: This product was exactly what I was looking for, at a great price, since I had just purchased a Nokia N95 cell phone.

reviewerName: Gilles Gravier "Geek et pere de famille"
reviewText: It's the original Nokia charger... and the only one to charge at more than 500mA... so it's fast on any Nokia phone. Get that one. Other ones that have USB circuitry only charte at 500mA.
Cheaper than buying it at the so-called authorized dealer. I bought one at the dealer for $25, and then found the exact same charger at Amazon for $9.64, "Nuff Said"

The connection for this charger was too small for the Nokia N75 cellphone, which uses the new smaller Nokia round connection hole.  It's a problem I've also had with a Nokia travel charger bought from an authorized retail seller. Maybe Nokia is having some quality control issues.  In any event, the seller of this mobile charger provided me with a reasonably prompt refund.

The Nokia N82 is everything one would dream of in a cell phone. It however has one little weakness- poor battery life.  Being a former Sony-Ericsson user, one thing I like about Sony phone is its lenghty battery life.  I can go 4 days without charging the phone.  The N82?  About 2 days of normal usage- camera, music, several calls, GPS, etc. Without charging via USB connection, it's good to have a car charger handy for emergency situations (that is, if you own a car).The DC-4 charger is just a basic car cigarette charger.  Plug it in and that's it!  Juice it up for about 30 minutes until you can get home for a full charger.  It has a green led indicator at the cigarette charger end letting you know it is charging your phone with electricity.  Leave it in your car under a hot summer sun?  No problem, and the plastic won't come apart exposing the inside wiring like some of the cheaper version.  This is the Nokia factory model, and I definitely recommend N82 users to invest in one.  Forget about the spare battery- it is a cell phone not a digital camera.  You have to remove the back cover to switch battery, turn on, wait for reception, and perhaps enter your phone security code.... too much hassle, just get a cigarette charger instead.

It works!  Sturdy and well built, does not overcharge my phone (yes I hooked a dmm up to it) and fits in the 3 car power outlet/cigarette lighters that I have put it in. Not five star because it does not have any unique feature that makes it excellent...
summary: Power goes in, power comes out!

reviewText: Although the charger has a Nokia label, I expcected better quality and wonder if it is a knockoff.  The charger was very tight fit into my car's charger port; so tight that I was concerned about damaging the charger port.  I attempted to squeeze the two spring blades a little closer so the fit were not so tight, but one of the blades cracked.  Now, however, the charger fits much easier.My next disappointment is the short cord, which barely reaches from the charging port to a tray on the console.Oh, and, yes, it does a great job of charging my phone.
This is the Nokia OEM car charger. Better than ANY off-brand charger.It charges your Nokia phone in the car.For the money you can't go wrong.

One of the frustrating realities of cell phone purchases is that Car Chargers are not already included in the basic package.  I was happy to find this Nokia Charger on sale here at Amazon and at a reasonable price.  The product arrived in commercial packaging on time and was exactly as advertised.
summary: Delivered on time and as Advertised

reviewText: Product works well and it was cheaper (the shipping was cheaper too) than at Nokia's website.
Works as intended. The only drawback is that the cord is a bit short, so you cannot power the phone while using it as a gps on the windshield.

Be careful, this is a high output charger, so battery charges quickly, but also heats up. The charger is solidly built, no rattles and feels like it can survive repeated plugging and unplugging. There is a bright, easy to see LED so you know it is plugged in properly.
This is the perfect phone charger for a car if you have a late model Nokia phone.  It works exactly as it is supposed to & was much cheaper on Amazon.
I have owned and used this product for over a year and I have to say it does its job and does it well with no problems
Very Poor quality, lasted barely 3 weeks under limited use. Would not purchase this item here again. Also purchased cell phone belt carrier and that tore apart after a few months of normal use.
What more can I say?Amazon has this genuine Nokia charger for a lot less than I could buy it for locally.
This is a really good charger for a great price. Does the job with no issue so far.

I was shocked to find this charger at the AT&T; store for $29.99 so I searched around and found it for less than $5.00 with free shipping.At first I was skeptical that this was an original Nokia Charger for that price. When it arrived it came without any fancy packaging and I was concerned that it might damage my E71 if it was a cheap knock off. Well I tried it and it works fantastic, it is the original charger. Who wants fancy packaging, I hear the packaging is most of the price.Makes me wonder why the AT&T; store rips us off.The second time I used it I accidently touched the plug on a metal part of the vehicle and I saw sparks, after that there was no power, however it turned out to be a blown fuse in the car, so no damage.It still works well after 3 weeks of continual use.
Faster charging than wall outlet, this is an original nokia item, very useful in road trips and emergencies.

reviewerName: Life Coach, Pam Alexandra "Certified Life & B...
reviewText: I'm really glad I purchased an "authentic" Nokia Mobile Charger.  This item works great!  In the past I've purchased mobile chargers from Cingular & AT&T.  Neither had the speed that this charger has.  I highly recommend getting the genuine Nokia if that is your brand of phone.
I got this charger, it is packaged in a plastic, and there is not written NOKIA brand name. It is chinese product, but it charges the phone. If you want a NOKIA charger, do not buy this!
I bought this charger for a Nokia E5. It works and the quality is good. It is an original Nokia charger and I would recommend it.
Works very well, and the price was right. Have used it a great deal to charge phone on trips; nice unit.

It's a charger for Nokia phones for use in your car!  The only thing I'm querying (and hence 4 stars and not 5) is whether it has the right voltage and won't spoil my phones.  From my initial check, it may be higher...but I will double check and then update my review AND add or deduct stars accordingly.
The Nokia DC-4 mobile charger has served well. I have been using it for the past few days. its performance is perfect.

I needed this device for my iPhone.  Keep it in the glove box for emergencies.  It is rather hard to seat in the cigarette lighter receptacle  in my Lincoln Town Car, but after a lot of fussing, I am able to get it connected and working.  Not the best design, but since it's only used in case of an emergency, it's fine.  The price was right.
Item arrived as expected.  Nothing really to complain about.  Too bad Nokia is now Microsoft.  Just waiting to see what the next great thing will be.
Fair price, good quality. The cord is a little short if I need to use the GPS on my phone while it's plugged in, but otherwise I like it.
Glad I paid for the authentic stuff.  Fast charging! Works great on my N95-3.

I'd seen car chargers for Nokia phones in several convenience stores but they were always made by some off-brand company, such as "Captain Billy's Whiz-Bang Charger". This is not only made by Nokia so that I knew ahead of time that it would work, but it was less expensive than any I'd seen in stores. I received it in the mail one day after ordering it and have used it regularly since.If you need a car charger for a Nokia phone, I'd recommend this one.

I bought this on Amazon praying that it would be the real deal since most people sell fake one online. I think I, for once, actually got the right thing! Been using it for the past two months. Went camping for 3 days and drove to and from CA to Canada so car charger was really necessary so that I can keep my Nokia maps going. It's just like my house charger and it charges up really fast (says it's rated 890mA, same as my house charger). Couldn't be happier with this. As long as you're getting the pictured item, you should be good. By the way, the fake one are usually pretty easy to tell. If it seems fake, most likely it is a fake. Return it if it's suspicious. The originals really makes a difference. After using it for both trips, my battery life seems pretty much the same as before. So no worries there.
summary: Looks real, feels real, works real, i guess this ain't a knock off.

reviewText: Great product for a great price..works like a champ with my Nokia E51..very useful when I go for long drives or out of town. I was able to manage with out having to carry a wall/travel charger along with me.
summary: Great product for a great price

reviewText: No complaints. Had it for some time with no issues. Does what it's meant to do.
It is worth to use it. However, I don't like my cell to be out of power during traveling:)

This charger arrived packaged in a full retail package.  I expected it to be bulk packed and in a plastic bag.  All the material was marked with official Nokia logos.  It seems to be well made and of excellent quality.  It has a coiled cord and no LED power indicator.
this charger just works perfectly. i love that it has a green indicator light on it.It is definitely an essential thing to have in the car!
Good charger.  Works well.  Very helpful if you use the A-GPS on your phone (which eats battery life pretty quickly).
I had a 3rd party one that died an early death. This one seems to be built better and is performing fine.
Excellent quality. Very useful in long trips, when I need the GPS for several hours, and then to get back home.

I keep this in my car in my console as a backup, because I usually charge my cell phone in the house. I only had to use it once, but it worked just fine when I needed it. I bought it, because it has a nice tight coil and takes up little room in my console. I previously had a straight cable and it was too messy in the car.

I'm fairly new at ordering items on-line, but I am extremely pleased with the Nokia charger.  It arrived very quickly, works great, and was considerably less expensive than buying it at AT&T.  I can't tell you how many times I've been caught with a 'dead phone', so it's very handy to be able to plug it into the car to recharge.  I would highly recommend this product.

Arrived in a retail package, appeared to be genuine Nokia. This has to be stuffed in the lighter receptacle because of an excessively tight fit. My concern was that it would ruin the receptacle, but so far other plugs (Belkin, Sprint, Sony) still fit. Once connected it charges my 6126 just as it should.
Have always been a Nokia phone user and this charger is good and reliable so far, charges my Nokia N8 pretty quick in the car.

This is genuine car charger from Nokia. It is cheaper than eBay knockoff with top quality from Nokia. Many retailers are selling it for $20+. Get it here less than $10 with warranty. Couldn't be happier.
I had to push down hard for it to go into my car's charger port and it takes a longer time to charge my phone.
I bought this charger for my Nokia BH-900 Bluetooth Headset. It does an outstanding job on over the road trips when quick charging is a must.
This is a great FAST charger. It fully charged the phone in less than an hour.This is a great product and comes in handy considering the battery life of this phone.
For the money spent on it, it is a very good deal.It is useful in the car, when your mobile is on low battery. Of course, it does take some time to charge, but nevertheless, it is very useful.
Good seller. Fast shipment. This is for a Nokia DC-4 Mobile Charger. Item works as specified.
Fits well into the 12V port of my car. The cord is a bit short, especially when I attach my phone to the windshield. Works without a problem with my Nokia 5230.

Very pleased with purchase.  Original Nokia charger.  Store price CAN $37.00 (including taxes) bought online for $2.36 + Shipping & handling TOTAL COST $13.77 .... nice saving of $25.00.  CCMACCESSORIES & AMAZON thank you....!

For some reason I had never bought a car charger for my Nokia E71 before, but before I replaced the battery, it was not holding a charge very long and because I had my phone synced with the car bluetooth it was running out of juice fast. So I got the cord. I have already used it on a long trip and the coiled cord allows me to use the 12 v outlet where the cigar lighter is or the one in the rear of my center counsel without any problem. it fits nice and snug in the socket and does not fall out. It makes me wonder why I didn't do this sooner.

Doesn't come in a box or blister or anything, came in a bag.  However, that being said, the item appears to be brand new and works perfectly.  Also appears to be O.E.M. Pretty dang happy with the product.  For the price, I can live without the box!  Much, much cheaper than buying retail.  I bought one for each of my cars, very happy.  Thanks guys!
It is exactly as described and of course works perfectly with my Nokia N76. Shipped quickly by Amazon. ¡Excelent!

Well, what really can be said of a car charger for a cell phone ? Finding Nokia products is becoming somewhat of a challenge these days, and in my country, only the unbranded ones can be found and they were running at the equivalent of US$15.00 !This Genuine one is quite solid, works as it should, and even more amazing was that the price ranged from just under $3 to $8 on Amazon. I went for this at under $3 and wondered if indeed it would be a genuine unit for that price. It was, and works exactly as it should.My only gripe is not so much about the charger, just that it would be nice to see nokia make the mini USB port the standard charging point rather than the proprietary charge port.
Excellent charger. charges my 6555 very quickly (about 40 min) which is comparable to nokiawall quick charger. Highly recommended

I bought this part as its Original Nokai part, but I was disappointed. I doubt it's original. When it's connected to my phone on the move, it's barely charges because it disconnects and connects again with each stop.Also it's hard to plug the charger, which it should be smooth.Don't let the low price fool you.
summary: Low Price ? Yes, Original part ? i don't think so.

reviewText: nothing else to say, it is a good chargeruse it for my nokia e71didnt have a single problem with the charger since i bought it

Excelente... me gusto mucho el adaptador Nokia DC-4 Cargador de móvil... antes de comprarlo verifiquen si sus nokias funcionan con este cargador, ya que otros modelos requieren el DC-6 que la entrada es diferente...
Awsome job!!!  Was very happy with the speed of the whole transition.  Will definitly do business in the future.  Thanks for making everything so easy.

My phone came with a generic car charger, which I wasn't happy about to begin with... And it finally bit the dust "after really light use" so, I bought the official NOKIA product and  I'm back in business!!!!Save time and money... Buy the NOKIA charger for the NOKIA phone!Steve

This is the first time I have owned a Nokia phone, so when I had to order a charger for my car, I did not hesitate when I found this item in Amazon. It is a name brand product, and has worked great since I received it. Definitely a must for anyone that uses their cell phone a lot and needs to keep the battery charged at all times.

reviewerName: Suzie "be careful what you wish for"
reviewText: I ordered two, one for each vehicle. Like other reviewers said, the plug is a little tight fitting, but I want it that way. I don't want it to fall out. The other end fits nicely into the phone and won't try to slip out. Would purchase more of these if I needed them.

I would never take a long car ride without a phone charger. This one replaces the one for my old phone (Palm Treo 650) and assures me that my phone always has a good charge. I didn't want a clone , since I've had bad luck with them in the past. Yes, I know I paid a few bucks worth, by I have an expensive phone (Nokia N95 8gb) and I wasn't about to risk it with some third party product. I am very happy with my purchase.
summary: Always be ready while in the car....

reviewText: Seems to be the original Nokia Charger. Cheaper than most other websites. Works well so far. Cord long enough for the front seats of the car.

The item pictured in the ad is not the same as the one sent. The phone plug will not engage and must be held in manually to charge my E71. 12v end plugs in but is obvious shoddy manufacture and finish, as is the cord. No matter, though, since phone plug renders it useless. Everything about it conveys, "NOT NOKIA". Not worth the trouble of sending back or pursuing with Reiko just to recoup "shipping" charge. Typical China-made junk. Had exact same plug issue with Radio Shack version, also. Difference there was they didnt have the obvious cheap price/bogus shipping charge scheme. They just sell you the junk and charge a lot to boot.

Excellent build quality, quick charging.  This is exactly the kind of hardware I expect from Nokia.  Far better than the more expensive gas station chargers.  The subtle green charge indicator works well enough in sun or at night without blinding or otherwise distracting the driver.
I brought this charges but never used it, so please before you judge or make any kind of decision please read other review to make a fair decision.
This Nokia car charger for my Nokia 5800 XPress Music came in a total sealed original packing. No doubt it was Original. Great charger, very convenient price.
This original Nokia charger is excellent quality. Even includes an LED to indicate ON status.
this charger is great, now i dnt have to worry getting low batt signal on my 6131 nokia.
This is the genuine Nokia product.  Sturdy Scandinavian design.  A green LED on the top to indicate power. The at&t store wanted a lot more for a charger that was not Nokia brand.
