Since Costco has the good return policy and I fed up with the damned ear bluetooth(I've 3), I decided to take a chance.  And it works well! I would recommend it to try.  Nothing is perfect in this world.  Just Try!CON:Caller ID is not understandable, no music playback, no linking to FM

I bought this item from my local Costco and it worked reasonably well the first couple of weeks then I started experiencing unexplained power-off's. This happens regardless of duration or battery level. Sometimes it will power off after a few minutes and other times it will power off after half an hour and sometimes it stays on for a while. This problem happens around 80% of the time I use the device. I could not get any response from the manufacturer and I unfortunately lost the original receipt. Even though they say to not return the product, don't listen to it. Take/send it back to the store you bought it from.Other comments have been pretty much echoed by other reviewers, i.e. quiet, difficult to see display, not very user friendly. I can't imagine how they won the CES award.

This is a great buy for a basic speakerphone!It's simple and easy to use. The battery charge holds up well with regular use. However, I've found that when driving on the freeway, it can be a bit difficult to hear the caller because the volume only goes up just so high, and it can possibly be due to road noise. But, if you listen closely, you can still hear the caller when the windows are rolled up.When driving on the city streets I've had no volume problem at all. My callers have told me that they can hear me very clear when  I'm on the freeway or when street driving, but it could also depend on the call connection. Overall, I'm very pleased with this device.-ToneXman
summary: A Very Good Speakerphone For The Price

reviewText: This works great, no problem setting up. Speaker is loud, clear. The unit also rings when a call is coming in. One button to answer, and end. You don't even have to flip your phone open to answer, it's all one button on this unit. Also displays number that's calling.
I gave two of these as gifts and both recipients love it. Only problem, there is some feedback when they call me. Otherwise, does what it says it will do and very convenient.

This item was purchased for my son for father's day. He is a person who loves to use his cell phone while driving. My son contacted me upon installation of this item.  I was surprised at the clarity in sound. I asked to call him back to see if the clarity would be fine whether receiving or sending a call, it was I am impressed.

First, I like the display that shows you the caller ID number for received calls, but there is very little other information that is displayed, more could have been done to improve the utility of that feature. For example, there is no indication on the screen on the speaker volume setting. The sound quality is marginal - the system supports voice dialing, for example, but I could never get my phone to recognize my saying "home" when using the speaker, when it works every time using the phone itself. Battery life was good, and recharging was easy. However, after about two months of pretty light use, the microphone stopped working altogether, so the unit is useless now.

I bought one for me. I liked it. Bought one for my wife. She went nuts for it.  Bought a third for a X-mas and the recipient LOVED it.(He is an amputee). Costco had these for less than $100 at first. Week before X-mas they were on sale for $39.
summary: Works for me - I bought three!!

reviewText: this is a great idea, but for me the volume is not loud enough to hear. I drive a small SUV and I guess that the unit is just to far from my face. I am going to return it and go back to a wireless headset
summary: O.K, but not my cup of tea

reviewText: This is not a good hands free. The sound is low at its best and it was not that easy to set up. When I called the number on the package, I got placed on hold indefinetly. I tried several attempts to call at different times of the day and it did not matter. The instructions say not to call the store that you purchase it at but to call the company. No wonder, they don't want you to tell the merchant how terrible the product and service is.
The item is good but needs an upgrade.The wires feeding info to the screen can break from regularly opening and closing the screen.thus rendering  the screen blank,yet still functioning.

No problem connecting to a Samsung bluetooth cell phone, but the device is seriously handicapped by the fact that it automatically shuts off when charging.  The charger requires DC from the car's lighter socket, which is available only when the car is running.  But that's when I want to use it!  Also the charger's curly cord is too short and must be stretched tight to reach the unit on the visor.Finally, the maximum volume is too soft to use comfortably in my Camry, which is not a noisy car.I plan to return it.

I picked one of these up the other day.  I wanted a safer way to talk on the phone while driving, but I hate having anything in my ear, so a normal headset was out.  But then I found this item, and thought for that price, if it works it's a steal.  I was very impressed with the ease of the setup and installation.  It paired with my Sony Ericsson 580i with no problem, and I was able to place and receive calls within a minute of having it out of the box.As a few of the reviews have said, the sound quality isn't the greatest, but it's good enough compared to a lot of other speakphone type devices.  For $50, this is a great deal for a hands free device that you don't have to have crammed in your ear.
summary: Hard to beat this for the price.

reviewText: Very good product.  Easy hands free when driving.  Sometimes too loud a projection of caller's voice.  Works seemlessly to connect with my Treo 700P which is unusual

I purchased one of these today at CostCo and tried it out on my way home. It linked up to my Sony Ericson easily but the sound quality was poor. I called my wife who said the sound was not clear but rather muffled sounding. I had the unit mounted on my sun visor about 8" from my face. It also sounded muffled to me over the speaker. We have a Prius which is a quiet car, I was driving 60mph on the freeway. The sound volume was sufficient.I'm going to return it. Too bad because the idea is great. I actually refrained from purchasing it on the spot yesterday. I came home and read the comments here on Amazon.com, my source of user comments. The comments were largely supportive so I went back today to buy it.You may want to try it yourself. Who knows I may have purchased a poorly working example.
summary: Muffled sound quality on both ends of the conversation

reviewText: This speakerphone has great features: a large display which shows the number of the incoming call; recent call lists (short but functional) which you can use for dialing; cordless operation; and most importantly, pretty good sound quality for a vehicle speakerphone.I like the visor mount.  It puts the display and microphone close to your face, which works great (although the mic picks up passengers pretty well, too).  The speaker is plenty loud.  It automatically adjusts mic and speaker levels for your environment, although doesn't work well with windows open even a bit.  My unit linked up easily with my Motorola phone.  Unfortunately the unit neither powers on nor links up quickly enough to establish a link when a call comes in (unlike my Moto headset, which powers up and links up within a few seconds).  But if you keep it on while driving, it does fine.My only major complaint is that this unit works great, only when it works at all.  It seems to be prone to powering off at random.  At first, I thought the battery was low.  But the battery indicator never showed low, and the unit continues to work for many hours, even when it starts shutting down randomly.  Other times, it works great for long periods without problems.  Maybe I just have a marginal unit - but that itself speaks to VR3's design and/or manufacturing quality.Other than the possible power-off problems, I'd definitely recommend this unit to anyone who doesn't like the idea of wearing a headset in the car.
summary: Good value, great product - when it works...

reviewText: Three annoying problems with this unit:1. If you find that the unit needs charging while you're in your car, plugging in the charger shuts off the unit.  I'm in CA where it's now illegal to hold and talk on a handset.  So if a call comes in while it's charging, I have to- unplug the charger- remount the unit on the visor (the charger cord is short)- turn it on- sync it up with my phone- by now I've missed the call.  Call back the person using my cell phone- transfer the call to the unit on the visorThink this "hands free" routine is safer than holding a phone to your ear?2. The call logs on the unit: outgoing, incoming, missed, come with "phantom" numbers.  Probably random junk in memory.  But there's no provision for erasing the numbers.  You need a magnifying glass to see the icons that designate which call log you're viewing.3. It must be charged for 4 hours before first using it.  It doesn't come with a mini USB cable for the charging jack, only a cable for plugging in to a 12v accessory outlet in your car.  That could work but only if you're going on a 4 hour car ride.

I got this to keep from neding to use my cell phone's speaker mode, which other callers reported as being muffled.  This works much better - the reports on audio quality are good.  Battery life is pretty good too - I only need to charge it every few weeks.

Just bought the vrbt300v from Costco last night. Set up with my Razr was simple. Love the caller id function. The charger for the moto razr works on the V3. No need to use car charger. Sound quality is good, both sending and receiving. Since all Ca. drivers will have to be hands free on July 1.This is a nice alternative to the over the ear hands free devices.NICE FEATURE: Unit disconnects when you are about 30-40 ft from the car and then reconnects as soon as you get back to the car.There were a lot of phone numbers already on the call log, but they are "moving off" as my numbers come on. The call log will only hold 5 numbers  on each of the 3 logs. Missed calls-Dialed calls- and Received Calls. I can only assume that the strange numbers were there from the original programming of the box.Voice dialing is not a problem. I have my phone set up for voice dialing and the VR3 calls just like using my Razr.Had a little problem with call waiting, but it was my fault, I couldn't remember which way to move the 3 way button to answer the incoming call or drop the call I was on. I've only had it one day..So I'm sure I will get better.Don't know about battery life. I have had it on all day in the office at my desk and have been receiving calls like crazy and the battery is still showing fully charged.
summary: A necessary item for Ca. Drivers

reviewText: I bought this recently. Quiet sleek and speakerphone is good and excellant gadget until you expect it work for its main purpose i.e. making phone calls.Pros:* Speaker phone clarity* Relativly easy to pair* Battery life* Though nowhere mentioned, USB charging works - that allows you to charge from your laptop!Cons:* You will get frustrated to do voice dial using this. If you get through, its your luck.* If your phone goes out of range, it doesnot automatically pickup.* Lots of background noise to the person at other end of the phone. (Not to you, as the speakerphone is very good)* It is meant to be fixed in the visor. But, only charger that comes is car charger and obviously you cannot charge while driving (dur to hanging chords at your face) or keep the engine/battery on just to charge this.
summary: Cool but unreliable when it has to work

reviewText: I really love the convenience of this device.  The charge lasts a long time, and it works great, except.....The volume isn't quite loud enough, and the microphone, when mounted on the visor, points straight down.  I find that I have to lean in and nearly shout to be heard, even at low speeds with the windows up.  It would be great if it could be mounted with the mic/speaker pointed toward my face as opposed to straight down.
I am hoping I get more adept at using this before the CA law requires I use something like this in July 2008!
summary: Not as handy as I had hoped

reviewText: I really like the design of this model. You don't have to wear one of those annoying ear pieces. The unit operates above you on your sun visor and is not a distraction while driving. The charger is compatible with the Motorola "Razor" cellphone charger and is quickly charged. One concern is the warranty which is only three months. Companies that really back their products typically have a much longer warranty period.

The product I ordered: Virtual Reality Labs VRBT120PVR3 VRBT120P Bluetooth Speaker Car Kitwas to fill an immediate need.Shipping was very fast.The unit(s) are pretty much as described.My only con is; not enough volume.Even though the unit is on the visor above your face, it is notquite loud enough for clear understanding of caller's voice.Pro; people I called all said they could hear and understand mequite well, no "huh?" or "say again!".Initial pairing took over twenty minutes, but once paired theywork every time. Battery life is great.Except for the volume problem, this unit lives up to it's ad.Yes, I would buy this product again. I have already advisedfriends about it with the recommendation that they not use itfor example, with windows open, .NOTE: The item pictured is NOT what I ordered and received.

I bought this device and tried using it outside the US. while in the US it worked pretty fine (with the same mobile), but outside, the calling number just doesnt show up on the screen! if its all about the link b/w the mobile & the device, how should it matter where in the world it is being used?and don't bother trying their tech support forums - they do not allow users to post comments there!

Bought this unit and charged it for 8 hours.  Battery still showed only 1/2 full when instructions say 2-4 hours for full charge.  Also, volume low and unit display to dim to read during the day.  Returned the unit.  My recommendation..... Look elsewhere.
The unit leaves a little bit to be desired when it comes to volume.  In a pick-up with no carpet, it is difficult to hear.

Got this unit as a Christmas gift. Here are some pros & cons in the event you're thinking of purchasing it:PROS:IT WORKS!It sounds GREAT!It linked up with my Bluetooth phone quickly (I use a Samsung model)!It's ESPECIALLY handy with voice recognition Bluetooth devices. (I just tell it to call a name in my cellphone directory, and it does the rest!)The price is reasonable for what this does.It's one of the few devices of this type that has a big display area for the phone number, HOWEVER...(see CONS below)...It's easy to operate!It seems to hold a full charge for a long time period (at least a week so far for me).CONS:It only comes with a 30 day warranty!It needs to be charged for 2-4 hours when the battery drains. The problem is, the ONLY way they suggest you charge it is through your vehicle's cigarette lighter. (No adapter to charge it in our home.) And they suggest NOT charging it when you aren't in your vehicle. I don't know about you, but I seldom drive around town for 2-4 hours. (FYI, I just left it plugged in while I was at home and all worked well.)The "log" area is supposed to keep track of calls in and out by way of logging them with a 0-5 first digit in front of them so you know which calls were most recent. The unit I have puts no such digit in front of the number. And there are some mysterious numbers in the log I have no idea who they belong to which DO have a #1 in front of all of them. (There are no 0, 2, 3, 4, or 5 numbered calls to be found! All the "mystery" numbers have a "1" in front of them.)While this unit DOES have a large display area for the number, it's hard to see in bright light.Hope these PROS/CONS help you to decide if you want to purchase it. Would I buy it again? Yes, I think I would. Mainly because I believe the pros outweigh the cons...especially the fact that it really DOES work for hands-free calling. After all, isn't that why you're REALLY thinking about buying something like this?Good luck in your decision.

I had a headset, didn't use it much, lost it or it was taken so I thought this might be a better product to replace it with since when it was used it was on the road (I'm not the type to walk around with a blinking ear).  I tried the motorola hands free unit first, could not get it to stay paired with my phone.  Which is mysterious because I've got an older pair of stereo bluetooth motorola headset which work perfectly.  I suppose I could have just gotten a bad one but I didn't feel like trying a second one and this unit looked a bit better in terms of the size of the speaker and the display screen (which I'll probably never use) and it was also cheaper than the motorola.  The unit comes with a headphone and a USB car charger, I didn't need these because my phone uses USB to charge and I just hooked up my RAZR charger to this and it charged fine.  It also will provide power when the internal battery is weak or not charged.  After I got past the instructions that were telling you to press the wrong button to get it into pair mode it paired with my phone right away.  I'm using the well known tmobile MDA pda phone and this works fine with it.  I played with it a bit in the car last night, the volume seemed a little weak when I called the movie line for the local theater to hear how it worked but I'll give it a little more chance before I decide whether to keep it.  Target carries these on the shelf in my local stores, so far it seems pretty good and works right with my phone.  The ability to put a call on hold and grab a second and the internal call list is pretty cool but I don't know if I'll be able to remember how to make it wall will be carrying the instruction sheet for awhile.

I bought this because I get few calls in the car and do not like having a headset on. I would not recommend this product. The volume is very low on incoming calls and very difficult to hear and all reports are that who ever I am talking to can barely hear me and it is full of static etc.  The manual has an error as to which button to push when you try to get it synced with the phone.  They give you and 800 number to support but all you get is them telling to go to the web site and you stay on hold for longer than I was willing to wait 2 different times.  Website support is lacking also.  I would recommend you spend a couple of more dollars and get something that will work.  Mine is going to the recycle bin.

I have tried a bunch of bluetooth headsets and speakerphones.  This one is the best speakerphone I have found though not ready for prime time.  At times, people have difficulty hearing me and I have difficulty hearing them.  Most of the time the speakerphone is adequate.  At other times, especially when I am driving, I have to turn the thing off and speak on the phone.  Not great, but I haven't found a better speakerphone.

Directions to use Bluetooth very vague!  Un-sinks to easy.  Should wait 10-15 minutes before un-sinking.  Screen nor button lites not bright enough when day time if sunny.  Not angry just pointing things that could be more user friendly.
summary: So what happy.  See notes below.

reviewText: This is the best pen I have ever bought. It writes beautifully! The only problem I have with it is the stylus tip came out after just a couple times using it. I will be emailing fisher about it this morning and see how their CS reacts. I don't know if it just my pen or if it a design flaw. That is the only reason for giving 4 stars instead of 5. The pen itself writes smooth and feels good in the hand. I did a little test of my own: I smeared Vaseline all over a piece of paper and tried to write through it. It did. I do most of my writing with the pen tilted in an upside down position and it never skips or writes dry. If one needs a quality pen this is the instrument to use. However, be leery of the stylus. I will update my review depending upon Fisher's answer to my email.
summary: The greatest pen i have ever owned

reviewText: The pen feels and writes just like all the other fine bullet pens by Fisher, but the "stylus" is deceiving because it cannot be used on any touch screens (tablets, Iphones, computer touch screens).  They make another pen that does have a capacitive end, so look for that one for touch screen use.  I just wish Fisher would find a better clip so they do not fall off--sort of defeats the purpose.  How about making a pen with an attached lanyard (do they, because I have not seen one?).  That could still allow you to put the pen in your pocket but it would not get lost due to a clip that fell off.  I do love the Fisher quality pens themselves!  Just some design improvements that would make users much happier.
summary: Bullet pen great, stylus not for touch screens!

reviewText: I was skeptical at first about the small size of the Space Pen, but was pleasantly surprised when I got the chance to write with one. With the cap in the writing position, the length is just right with the best weight and balance I've ever felt in a pen. While I'll probably never need to write in zero-gravity, and little need to write underwater, under normal writing the pen still performs admirably. It is definitely the best line quality of any ballpoint I've used.This version with the stylus tip is perfect if you have a PDA or touchscreen phone, as there are times you just can't or don't want to use your fingertip. The clip is handy, but removable if you don't need it. The black matte finish is superb; it's a joy just to hold it in your hand. I prefer it over the original chrome finish.My only complaint is that I lost mine two weeks after I bought it! Guess I'll have to be ordering another soon...

I love the Fisher Space Pens, but this product does not perform the intended function for me.  The stylus is not conductive enough to work on any of my capacitive touch screens.  So it doesn't work on most iPhones, iPads, smartphones, or tablets.  It might work on an older pressure-sensitive screen (like a Palm Pilot) or the like.  UPDATE: I'm told in the comments that this DOES work on a s-pen for Samsung and most Windows 8 devices
summary: Nice pen, but stylus does NOT work for any known touch screen

reviewText: I remember ordering this pen because it was recommended by Lifehacker on user-suggested writing tools. I was quite partial to the strong aluminum build (at least I think it's aluminum) and the compact design. It's a decent pen you can carry in small places and looks neat, too.Only one issue I had with it is the ballpoint. I'm somebody who doesn't really like ballpoint tips in general and feel more comfortable with more precision in my pen tip. It's decent if you just need to have a pen on you for whatever reason like writing a signature, filling out a check or something quick like that. Using it for long periods kind of hurts my hand, too.Another drawback that some may find rather minor is the clip slid off a few times. Nothing really keeps it in place other than the tension from squeezing the barrel, although slipping it back on is easy. If this bothers you enough, you could possibly look into gluing it in place or something.It's still a decent pen if you don't care about a ballpoint tip, and I still find the design pretty cool. Eventually I settled for a Lamy fountain pen, which has its share of pros and cons as well.
Love the compactness of the Fisher Space pens, especially with the clip. I mistakenly purchased the pen with the wrong end, thinking it was for the iphone.
summary: Great buy, but this is not the stylus for the iphone or Android

reviewText: I’m confused why Fisher bothered making a product that does not work. The stylus plastic and does not work on any touch screen devices. The pen is nice though
I was looking for a stylus I could write on my ipad with. This isn't it. The stylus tip is hard and and is for pushing buttons is my guess.
summary: Not what I was looking for

reviewText: I too bought a Bullet Pen with Stylus in January. I love the pen but immediately had problems with the stylus falling out and the clip falling off. Customer service wasn't much help so I put Super Glue on inside to hold stylus...it worked great. I didn't get around to Super Glue on the clip and I lost it. I wish Fisher would deal with these 2 issues but I'll glue my new one immediately.

I bought this ClearPro headset and a very similar Plantronics headset (that cost more) at the same time. Tried them side by side, and to my surprise, both the sound quality of the earpiec and the voice quality on the microphone was appreciably better on this inexpensive headset than the Plantronics one.However, I only got to try once: When I disconnected the ClearPro after this first test use, one of the two plastic prongs of the pop-port connector broke off. I suppose that we can partially blame Nokia for this proprietary and somewhat retarded connector style. But in comparison, the Plantronics version of the connector was much more solid.In general, the construction of the over-the-ear, mic boom, etc., on the ClearPro was all somewhat- to greatly-flimsier than the other headset.
summary: Great price, good sound quality, bad construction quality

reviewText: The headset worked fine, but the pins on the connector snapped off after two months, rendering it unusable.
summary: audio is fine, but has a short lifespan

reviewText: I got this to use with my Nokia 8801 and laptop computers.Using with phone: while the sound quality itself was surprisingly good, with better than expected yet not boomy bass and clear treble, the sound would stutter or drop out, even with my phone very close to the headset. I tried several songs and all did this. I suppose it could be the phone, but some web research suggests this is a common problem when using wireless bluetooth headsets. It may be a bandwidth issue with Bluetooth v1.2.With my IBM X40, using the included USB audio gateway: many fewer dropouts, but still some--even though I was sitting at the computer.Bottom line: probably not ready for prime time. I also found them to be uncomfortable - a bit too pressing on the ears - after about 5 minutes. I wear mens' hat size M, and the headbands are not adjustable.

Nokia have managed to fix nearly all of the BH-501's flaws - the 601 is a substantially better product in almost every way. Unfortunately Nokia have introduced a range of new problems, which I am sure they will get round to fixing ... in a year or so.The first major improvement is that it's tougher. Nokia have eliminated both of the weak-spots in the bendy plastic adjacent to the earphones. The curves around the earphones of the BH-601 are sturdy bars of flexible plastic with shock-absorbing rubber inserts. They have the appearance of being able to withstand a great deal of twisting and bending. That's good news because I have a feeling that I will get more than a few weeks use out of this device.The next major improvement is obvious - they've added a few more buttons. Not quite as many as Jabra with their confusing  BT620s, but enough to allow some nifty new features. In addition to the original volume controls and select/power button we now have a track-skip controller.Oddly enough the volume controls work in a different way to those on the BH-501. They do not seem to be linked into the phone's volume control. The two act independently rather than (as with the BH-501) change a single volume setting.Another neat feature is that for the first time Nokia have noticed that nobody likes to be lit up like fairy-lights. This device has two LEDs adjacent to the standard Nokia charging port. The blue light blinks to show that the headset is active and the green light blinks when the headset is on charge. There are no lights visible from the side or front. That's good news for people who do not wish to be the focus of attention.It never occurred to me to complain that the BH-501 could not operate while charging. It just seemed like too small a thing to mention, but that's another thing that Nokia have changed. I'm not sure that I'd ever want to talk while charging as having a charging wire plugged into a headset somewhat negates the benefit of a wireless device. It's nice they thought of it though, I can confirm that it works.And now the bad points: The reception range of the BH-601 seems to be considerably worse than the BH-501 (which was excellent). In ideal circumstances the BH-601 will give me 10 metres of range from my Nokia 95 while listening to stereo audio. In an environment with moderate to low levels of radio interference (e.g. a normal city street) the signal will often break down unless I hold the N95 almost adjacent to the headset. I guess the thicker plastic used to make this device absorbs a lot more of the signals.Speaking of range, a related issue is the device's ability to recover from an interrupted signal. Unfortunately it's not good. As I wandered around my office building today, I noticed that somebody operating a photocopier nearby was enough to interrupt the signal. Also the motor which opens the steel gate of the cycle-park put out enough EMF to completely cut the connection.While a brief interruption may be acceptable in the face of interference, the problem with this device is that once it looses a connection the the link stays lost. The only way to re-connect is to power-down the headset, and then re-boot it. The phone appears not to have detected the fact that the link has failed resulting in complete silence.Another oddity is that this stereo headset seems to switch to monaural mode every time a call comes in. A phone call is always in mono but one of the advantages of having a headset with 2 earphones is that you can hear the mono audio with two ears at once. When you use the BT-601 to talk on the phone only the left can produces sound. The right can (which includes the microphone) remains silent.It's also worth noting that the look and styling of this product seems quite cheap. It's a better design than the BH-501 but the quality of the plastic molding is poor, and the silvery insert in either of the phones looks very cheap. That's sad because I would have been willing to pay slightly more for a device that has a more elegant design.On the whole the BH-601 is a modest improvement on the ill fated BH-501. It's definitely the best Nokia stereo headset I've tried but they still have a long way to go before they deliver the headset I really deserve.

Despite the price, and despite the fact that the label on the cables says 'for SAM T809/Z510', it worked just fine with my SGH-T629.  I had to get the software from Samsung on my own, but that's not the cable's fault.Word of warning:This cable did not charge my phone.I also have not had any success connecting it to my Linux computer with or without PC Studio and Wine... but that has more to do with the phone's lack of USB Mass Storage mode.

I am sure it is a great cable but it does not work for Apple computers. Samsung does not have a driver that supports the cable and a mac. The company I ordered the cable from is great, easy to work with, but once again it does not work on a mac. Bummer. I have repeated that it does not work on a mac multiple times because I want to make it very clear that it doesnt work with a mac. I blame Samsung.
summary: Great cable but not for Mac

reviewText: Cable allows me to copy music, photos, and video plus Microsoft Outlook phone numbers, and calender events.Cable does it's job perfectly, but for some reason my appointments are copied with the wrong times.
It did not fit my phone and I was forced to go out and but another one.
Cable is cheap, works perfectly, and arrived quickly. All you have to do is download the software from the samsung website and plug it in!

When I ordered this item I already knew it didn't come with the driver/software cd but minutes after I ordered it DLN sent me an email telling me that I was able to download the software for free from Samsung and event sent me the link. That was nice of them... i'm kind of bummed that that charge feature doesn't work on my phone (D807) but that's just an issue with my phone I guess and nothing with the product.

probbaly a great product, but u should know DONT BUY THIS WITH A MAC!!!!!!!! it wont work. it was useless. and all the drivers for the samsung t629 are for pc's, so i cant even use the included software. macs and pc's should learn how to coordinate, and not make ervything such a hassle to figure out compatibility issues.
When T-mobile charges $50+ for the same item, I was very happy to find the same cable for about $12-13!! It arrived promptly and works great.

I bought this cable thinking that it would work as a charger cable from my computer USB port, but it works only for data. I don't know what data you can download or upload with it, but for sure it cannot be used to recharge your phone.

Works as expected, kind of strange paying more for shipping and handling than for the cable - Shipping and handling was $14.96 and the 3 cables were only $0.90 each.  Good service and fast turn around time.  Would purchase from Webtreo again.  These cables are $40 from the Samsung website.
summary: USB Data Cable for Samsung T629

reviewText: I received the USB cable just a few days ago and so far I am pleased with it. The product description says "Phone Driver is not included. Software is not included" which I didn't notice until after I placed the order. But that is no problem as the CD has a readme file which gives you the website to download the software that is necessary for the cable. The only thing I found to be a negative is that the connection is lost if the phone is moved around. Now whether it is the cable itself or my phone, I do not know. I do know that if the phone is resting on a spot and isnt touched the connection remains. Overall, I am very happy with my purchase and would recommend this to anyone that would like to save a lil bit of money for the same product offered through their phone provider.

This is a DATA ONLY cable; it does not charge the phone.  I really wanted a cable that I could use the charge the phone on my laptop when traveling.This cable does work fine as a DATA cable to transfer music, make ringtones, or even use the phone as a modem on your laptop.
Better than buying the whole samsung cd and cable package for around $50.Just downloaded the software from the samsung site and bought this.Quick, cheap and concise.
The cable was shipped promptly and a great price.  It arrived just as described and worked correctly.  I am very happy
Allows you to import/export pics and mp3 files. Also edits contact information, sends texts, and edits calender.

I ordered this USB cable for my Samsung SYNC and it came fast. While there is no software provided I quickly found out it syncs with Windows Media Player so I could add music to my phone. After searching I found that Samsung actually provides the necessary software on their website for FREE! If you want to fully utilize your Sync's camera and MP3 capabilities I highly recommend buying this inexpensive wire and going to Samsung's site for the free software.
Sadly, the cable does not come bundled with the phone, Samsung A707. :(Make sure you get the free driver (PC Studio 3) from the Samsung website before plugging it in.

It works well with my Samsung D807. Does not charge though. Using Samsungs PC Studio I can sync with Outlook and transfer files. Not terribly fast though transfering to added MicroSD card. (Maybe 0.5 MB per second at best?)
i paid a couple of dollars for a data cable that samsung was charginf over twenty dollars for.it works great and lets me connect my cellphone to my PC.also came with software.great product!

I bought the cable to transfer pictures/files from the phone to the PC.  The cable/software allow the T-509 phone to connect, but it doesn't seem to support any of the functionality I want.  All it does is charge the phone from the USB port; can't transfer files or anything else.  I suspect it's a limitation of the phone.  I searched on the web and it looks like I'm not the only one that had this problem.  I haven't tried Samsung tech support yet.  They may have a solution, but I'm not holding out much hope.
summary: Cable worked fine, it's my phone that's lame

reviewText: it took a while to get, but it works with no problems. Just go on samsungs website and DL the program for free

I like this for more than one reason...so read on,Reason #1 - It keeps on charging your cell phone when you are transferring data, trust me this helps, when you are transferring 1 GB of data you will loose reasonable amount of battery charge on your cell phone.Reason #2 - Only data that can be played by your cell phone gets transferred, so this way you will know before hand that all the data you transferred will actually play when you are in the back seat of your car.You will have to use windows media player to sync this phone (Samsung Sync SGH-A707) in order to transfer files. MP3 and WMV/WMA formats work with this phone, i do not know whether other formats work or not.Let me explain in brief how to sync this phone with windows media player. Connect one end of the cable to your phone first and the USB end to your computer USB port (Preferably USB 2.0). If you have already inserted media card into the phone you will see two drives named samsung phone and samsung media card when you open My Computer on your computer. Now open Windows media player, you will be able to see the following tabs just below main menu. From left to right you will be able to see in this order - Now Playing, Library, Rip, Burn, Sync, and Guide. Click on Sync. Make sure your Cell phone is connected, now you will see two halves in the same window, left half is for you to drag and drop your file that needs to be transferred and right half is where it goes (your cell phone name apears on the top), usually windows media player prepares to transfer the file, this takes a while. Also just above the right window in the drop down box make sure you select Samsung media card, as the Samsung phone option has very limited memory.Once you are well versed with what your phone can play, i would recommed copying files to your MicroSD using a USB reader/writer as windows media player takes time preparing the windows environment for sucessful transfer, this saves you a chunk of time and battery power.
summary: There is a feel good thing about this....I am sure you will agree with my conclusion...read on

reviewText: I bought this cable so I can transfer my pictures and my videos from my phone to my laptop.. When I got it, it did not come with any software. So I went to Samsung's website and downloaded the software. It does not recognize my phone. I've tried it a few times with a few other samsung downloads too and nothing works. Apparently i'm not the only one who is having this problem. If you have a T-509 it just doesn't work.. the only thing it does is charge my phone which i really don't need it to do.

Well, it will charge my phone through USB, but the sync cable is useless for data transfer on a Mac.  Samsung has no software drivers to enable it to work.  Everything must be transfered via bluetooth.

The price is good and the product works but if you don't have and in-depth techinical base, it is very difficult to unstall the software. An  CD comes with the cord, but all it does is tell you where online to search for the installation software.I couldn't do it myself and it took a frend of mine who works for Direct TV about 45 minutes to get it to work. If Samsung would send a CD that would actually install the software, it would be the perfect little cord. But unfortunately, that's not the case.
Door stop....They have the M610 listed so I took a chance, but it will not charge the phone.  So, I'm out $10.00 (50% of the sprint price, however, Sprint is out of stock right now...)
Great vendor.  It arrived quickly and was exactly as promised.  It;s much cheaper than buying from Cingular and works without a hitch.
i have a t518 phone little did i know that although my phone works with the cable i asked for the software did not support my phone so i brought the cable for nothing lol.

Ordered this cable for my Samsung BlackJack works great. I was able to update my phone to windows mobile 6. Very pleased. Don't know if it matters but it does charge the phone, just not as fast as with an outlet.

I can't speak for how this works for other model of phones but the software did not recognize my T509 model phone. I used the updating feature on the software as well but it still didn't work. I could not find the software on Samsung's website either, just the manual in pdf. The product may work on other models I am sure, but I could not get it to work with mine. The cable seems to be physically working because the computer detects it when plugged in, but not the software.
My 14-year-old had very little trouble hooking his phone up to the computer with this cable.  Great price.  Quick shipment.
I bought this, yeah its great ya da ya da. but when i plug it in it says that the cd rom isnt found blah blah. what website is it that u go to to do this stuff? please help.

It arrived promptly but the included disc's information as to where you can get the program didn't work out so well, the links were basically useless, and I had to go google like crazy to get the correct program.  But after I did, it worked out great!

Works just like it says it does...Seems to take longer to recharge my phone from a USB cable than from the wall outlet cable that came with the phone.. but this cable turns the phone into a little flash drive..  I can bring new favorite song(s) to work and play it while working... Next I'll add a memory card and watch movies at work

Got cable for 2 bucks. Came with a "homemade" CD that I didn't trust. Downloaded the program directly from Samsung website. Not tech savvy here but all I wanted to do is transfer pics/videos from cell to pc so I can share via e-mail. It works!

reviewText: This cable is much more expensive when you try to buy it elsewhere.  I received the cable quickly and the company even sent me an email to let me know where to download the appropriate program free from the Samsung website.  Works great!
It's a Cable It has two ends and does what it Says...
I paid 7 dollars shipped for a 40 dollar samsung cable. It's an official samsung product and was brand new. Looks good to me and saves me a ton because I can upload my own ringtones/mp3s.
We have an older Samsung cell phone with a camera and no way to download the pictures we took. The USB Data Cable for this model of Samsung was just what we needed.

I waited 8 days for my order to be shipped only to receive an email today saying they are cancelling my order because this item is out of stock.  Now I've lost more than week's time and I have to find another vendor.  This is a terrible way for them to treat their customers.  I will never buy from them again.

reviewText: Ordered 2 cables from DLN.  They shipped quickly, keep me updated and the cables arrived well packaged.  They are good quality and work well.  I like that it charges the phone as you Sync up.Highly recommended - and at such a good price!

Does what it is supposed to. well built. Didn't use the supplied cd (used a downloaded driver) for my LG VX8600. Also, though the description says USB 2.0, this cable is recognized as a COM port device and therefore will transfer data at that speed, which is pretty slow; but this should be expected. Arrived in a few days. solid product, good service, fast shipping.
It may be a data cable, but it does not charge the phone when plugged into a USB port.  Useless for its intended purpose.
It did not work when I plugged it and ended up being useless, too much trouble to rerturn. It was very disappointing.
This works great, just like it's supposed to. It lost a star because they sent a CD that I have no idea how to use and it came with no instuctions whatsoever.

It's a simple USB cable that works as advertised.  The only real disappointment was the entirely too long shipping time.  11 days from order to doorstep is not exactly what I would call stellar service, regardless of the cost.
The cable didn't work.  What more can I say. But they did give me a refund. It was a waste of time.

I bought this for my LG Mint Chocolate VX8500.  When you go to install the driver, you're supposed to select your phone from the list.  Well, it just so happens that the list is extremely incomplete, and my phone wasn't on there, which probably means that yours won't be either.  Don't waste your time on this cable and just buy the music essentials kit that is actually made for this phone.
Does what it's supposed to! However you might want to download a driver from the internet if you have a VX9900. BitPim doesn't help the computer recognize the device.
this item is very nice and works the seller sent it out fast, thank you to all
I received just what I wanted and more. This cable has a Headset Charger Input which was not on my original cable from Verizon.

reviewText: I received this product in much less time than predicted by the seller, and am very pleased with it.
I have a VX9900 enV and this cable works great with it in conjunction with BitPIM.  Not much to say about it really, it does what it should.
Software on CD is garbage.  You will have better luck googeling the drivers you need yourself.  Otherwise, great price for the cable.

I threw this cable away and wound up buying Verizon's Music Essentials Kit for my LG VX8600.  The Music Essentials Kit provided a cable and driver that work fine.

The cable fits perfectly well. I have not had any problems. It is alot cheaper than buying it from verizon directly.

This USB adapter does the job, but only marginally so. It seems to require a wall plug to work. If I try using it directly with  a laptop or USB charger, it does not work. Instead, I must piggy back with another device/cable having its own AC/DC power supply. I wish the seller had made that clear.
hey i want to buy this cause i need a data cable for my phone.i was wondering if this data cable would fit my LG EnV 2 VX9100please answer thisand sorry for putting this in the wrong section

Received exactly as stated. My only complaint is in the description- they don't state the length of the cable. My tower for my computer is in another room that I keep at 65 degrees which is maintained constantly. I had to extend this cable by soldering on another 3 feet of wire, as the usb ports that are connected to my computer are mounted on my wall. I projected the cable to be about 6 feet, and if you do yourself, you're in for a surprise. This cable is only about 3 feet long, otherwise everything is fine. One last thing...The description doesn't state this but, the cable actually comes with the drivers for the phone models, which really helped me.On a better note, shipping took a mere two days compared to the six days USPS estimated.
summary: Great Product Comes Up Short. Literally.

reviewText: I had it up and running in minutes with my LG VX-8600 (Verizon).  I downloaded BitPM free software to use with the cable.  I just followed the installation instructions that came on the CD that comes with the cable.I clicked on "discover phone" in BitPM to have it automatically find the phone.  (I didn't even need to go and look for the com port as the installation says because BitPm scans the ports until it finds the phone)Note..When installing, make sure you pick the right driver.. if you have XP, choose the XP driver, not the NT, or Win98 or other driver.  It's part of the file name..look for XP in the driver file name.

You need to find and download a driver for this cable before you can use bitPim. I found a driver that works for my Verizon LG Vx6000 here: [...]Verizon has Win XP drivers for many phones along with its free Music Manager  download as of 7/2/07. It allows you to rip CDs and transfer the songs to your phone all in the same application.[...]LG Vx8600 headphone adapter is for a small 2.5mm stereo jack. You will need a 2.5mm to 3.5mm adapter for most headphones.The $30 Verizon Music Essentials data cable, SW CD and headphones is not a bad deal.

Works well. Driver installation is somewhat tricky becuase it is not obvious which driver among all on cd you have to install. No synchronization software is included so you have to use a third-party tool like bitpim. Which is ok.

I took a chance and bought this even with all the bad reviews(it was only $2) and the bad reviews were right. This cable did not function at all. Did not charge and did not enable me to access the phones data on my computer (yes I did download BitPim) I cannot speak if it works for the other chocolate models but if you have a old VX8500 you want data off of avoid this cable.
summary: Did Not Work on LG VX8500

reviewText: Received quickly.At two and a half bucks, this is quite a deal.  Compare to Verizon's music kit at $20.  I did have a problem with the shield pulling off of the connector.  I replaced it with a drop of super glue, and it's good as new.

I emailed the company to ask if there was something wrong and the response was "it not supposed to". That was it...no suggestions about what I could do, not even a sorry for the inconvenience. Some of the WORST customer service I've seen in a long time.
Works perfectly, snaps in to place on the phone and never failed during the time I used it.  Great purchase.

The CD that comes with the cable contains only confusing html files that try to point to drivers and software to download. The cable never made a good enough connection for Windows to recognize it. It kept saying "A USB device has malfunctioned." However, the cable is not worth sending back. The shipping is more than the cable itself.

reviewText: The included software on the CD wouldn't load onto my computer. But after a little fiddling and internet research, I managed to make a connection between the phone and computer.

I have tried at least 6 earpieces, including the Jawbone. The flamingo is hands-down the best earpiece i've used. Quality is excellent, super confortable and extremely light. As any earpiece i tried they are all poor when its windy. The neck cord is very handy.

Small size is super convenient, yet battery life is great.  Novel way of fitting to your ear with exchangeable ear inserts (just do once to find the right size among the different ones provided) and good sound.  Best one.

I bought this headset (though not from Amazon) thinking that this would be my end of searching for THAT bluetooth headset (anyone who's shopped for a bluetooth headset knows what I'm talking about).  I love the design of the headset and I love the way that it stays in your ear without needing an ear hook (allowing for glasses to be worn).  But that's about where the loving ends.  I've used this headset and have asked others how I sounded and have even called and left myself a voicemail (in a variety of environments).The results were mixed ranging from I could be heard to being asked to repeat myself.  The problem is that the microphone points down as opposed to pointing towards your mouth.  If they were to position the microphone so that it is directed closer towards your mouth - that would hopefully improve being heard by other callers.  In terms of how callers sounded to me - the earphone could use a bit of a boost as it's just loud enough to hear (even at it's max volume).  Maybe it's my phone and phone OS (I have an AT&T; tilt and windows mobile 6) and bluetooth version (the headset is 1.2 and my phone is 2.0).  Hopefully if the company comes out with an updated version (and not just additional colors) they'll make it bt 2.0 or BT 2.1 and will increase the loudness of the earphone (I think it is the design of the ear clicks that are used to hold the headset in place.  They don't allow for the speakerphone to get close to the ear canal to get as much sound as possible).Overall - if you're looking for a headset that can be worn with glasses then this is your headset (as long as you use it inside of your home).  If you're looking for a headset that can be worn with glasses AND provides optimal performance then look elsewhere (where that is I don't know).  If you're looking for a headset period - if you get this - don't expect much out of it - else look elsewhere (where I don't know as this is a sad state for bluetooth headsets.  There's not ONE that is THE IT headset).I hope this helps.

I purchased this item on Dec 26, 2007. I received a notice from the seller that my item was shipping on the 27th. Then over a week later I received an email from the seller that they ran out of the item, did I want a refund!!! I was ordering this as a gift and the company was falsifying that the item had shipped over a week earlier because it actually had not!!! I was sooo upset I went online and put in a feedback with this information. The seller then offered to send me a more expensive case in place, not the one wanted and a horrible looking one  on top of that , but the seller demanded that I would have to delete my feedback before they would work with me even though everything I said was true. DO NOT USE THIS SELLER YOU WILL NOT GET THE ITEM YOU ORDER!!!!!
summary: Don't buy this item from here you may not get it!!!

reviewText: I like it. Since my phone is big enough and I did not want a bulky case so this thing is perfect for me. I always keep my phone in my pocket so I didnot care for a belt clip, however I didn't want the phone to get scratched by keys or other objects in pocket. So this was the perfect solution. The rubbery skin keeps the phone from slipping out of pocket aswel. Great product.

It did the job until my phone and the cover got stolen. Even though I liked it, I did not get the same product for my new phone. This one is just too "sticky" when it comes to placing phone into my pocket.
This was a great product that provides safety and daily protection for my expensive smartphone.  Great product!  Great Service!
what can I say, didn't like it and doubt it would protect my moto if I dropped it.  lint sticks to it

It was just like the pictures but a it is a fragile case and does not protect the phone so i would be careful with it so you wouldn't break it. if you are a clumsy person then the case wouldn't be the best for you for a everyday case but a one in a while case...

I love this case it is so cute because of the aquamarine color but the protection stinks I was standing on tile and my phone slipped out of my hand it hit my slipper and fell on the ground when I picked it up the whole screen was shattered I heard stories because my friend has this case and he phone broke too but I thought let me give it a try I was so happy when it came but I've had it for one day and my phone already broke so i dont know about this case?!
Got so many compliments on it. It just worries me cause it doesnt protect the phone at all. Or barely protects it. So cute tho!
Hard to get off once you get it off and when you get it off the case cracks at the corners.
I was looking for cheaper iPhone 5 cases and this one really caught my eye. When I received it I fell in love with it! I love the 3D design on the back. I also loved the price.

definitely very aesthetically pleasing and the 3D facets do not protrude out so much as to add unnecessary bulkmy only complaint would be that the edges of the case do not come up past the phone itself so if i dropped it it would most likely provide no protectionother than that its very pretty and catches the light quite nicely!

No protection.  Dropped my phone once shattered my face first time a drop had done that in 3 years only with this case

I love this case. It's gorgeous, and it fits perfectly, it doesn't obstruct the iPod cable in my car. I was a little surprised though, the pictures didn't show how little the coverage on the sides were, but it wasn't a deal-breaker. It's still a really great case and serves its purpose.

I love this case. It's super cute and I like how the "gems" feel. I would definitely get other colors.
Cool 3d design but the case is heavy and bulky. Definitely not ultra lightweight as advertised. The corners chipped and cracked after about 2 months of use and Im a gentle user.

Love Love Love this case. I expected the case to be flat in the back and simply appear 3D but it was not flat and better then I thought.
amazing case with great quality and beautiful color. I would recommend it to my friend. I love it very much.

Feels flimsy and I ink I could probably break it with my hands.  I paid $2.50 but that's probably two full dollars more than it's worth.  Shipped very slow too!

Looks grest, fits great but hard to get off. Wish it had better protection. I have scratched top off phone because it doesn't cover enough. It's my occasional case.
Bought this case in pink and aqua and I really like it.Wish there were more colors to choose from.Pretty case.
I got my case before the date I was suppose to, which was amazing. The case is exactly what it looks like in the picture. I highly recommend it 😊
Got a lot of compliments on this phone cover, so simple & very inexpensive but neat look, love this & it looks like ice.
Snapped onto my phone and is snug. Looks awesome. Happy with it so far, will come back to revise review if I have any problems.

It's an inexpensive case with a cool look. It had free prime shipping and compliments the phone well.There are only two things I'd change:First, I wish it weren't flush with the front of the phone. I'd like a bit of a lip or ridge to extend just past the front. Sort of like the rim on a coin.Second, I'd love to see this in matte black. The clear is cool, but a bit sparkly for my taste. Flat black would make the facets evoke a "stealth fighter jet" look instead of a gemstone.Overall though, it's a practical, inexpensive case that does the job it was designed to do.

I like this phone case but I thought it would be a tropical blue when I put this on my I phone it wasn't that sparkly like I wanted to be! Plus it's kind of slippery so I had to wipe it off with a wet wipe to make sure it will never slip out of my hand, because we all know what would happen if a I phone dropped on the ground not good results.

Loving the case and the color!!!  Made my daughter very happy...she's been wanting it for a while.  Her friends ask her where she got it.  Will be sure to send them your way.

I bought this case mainly because it was on sale for 3 bucks. It's a fun and interesting case. I like the 3D design on the back. I wish that the case had more protection on the front. Very pleased with the iPhone 5 cover and the service. Recommend this cover if you want a stylish cover, however it doesn't provide a great amount of protection if you drop the phone. In other words it is mainly for looks.

I bought this case to wrap around a Motorola Droid Razr M, and for the most part I am pleased with it. I learned way back in the days of PDAs that an aluminum case is really cheap insurance against the vicissitudes of day to day phone torture. This one is very well constructed, and it is easy to get to all the ports and controls on the phone. Camera is totally operable in the case. None of the sound ports are covered either. The only issue I have seen, and for me I can live with, is that the case seems to attenuate the cell tower signal. It only seems to be an issue in weak reception areas. Popping the phone out of the case quickly solves the problem.Do yourself a favor, and get yourself some aluminum insurance. Aluminum is never having to say you're sorry,
summary: Seal your smartphone in a metal vault.

reviewText: the cases is good but doesn't stay closed all the time, it could have been alil stronger. but i like it.

Good case. Fits and protects well. Do not buy if you use the GPS on your phone for navigation or need cell signal in low signal strength areas, as the case blocks about 30 percent of the cell signal and makes GPS unreliable.

excellent product just as described, despite with the other comments that says prodct is bad the product is what it is and fits just perfect on the note 2. Is made of aluminum and it opens as a door from the screen.. I have small hands asn I can handle the phone with no problem I am vey happy witht the product.
summary: This is very good product if you want a good case

reviewText: The BoxWave case for the Samsung Galaxy note 2 is awesome for the price, fits the Samsung perfectly and protects my phone quite well. I would recommend this product to my friends.
It is not good keeps opening up and when I dropped it it came open and it bent all up a wast of my money
...but heavy. Button can be hard to reach from time to time, but easy to get used to.Fits like a glove.

I'm giving this a good grade because it does a lot of things right. I really wanted a metal case for my phone, but I also wanted one that encased the entire thing (Otterbox style without the inflated price). This is the most attractive option that I found (I even waited until they released the black one) and I really do love the feel that it gives the phone. If you've made the decision to get the Note 2 you don't mind bulk, and I always felt that the material and weight of the phone didn't fit what it should be. The case adds a good deal of weight to the phone and the metal has a really nice feel to it. The problem is of course the design, like every other reviewer has mentioned. The idea of making this thing a clasp complete with a protruding hinge rather than just a front plate that slides on seems brain dead. However, I have not experienced issues with the clasp not holding and I am constantly using and moving around my phone. Also, I got used to it really quickly and don't feel it really impedes the use of the phone, especially considering you are supposed to hold the Note 2 with two hands. I'm still going to keep looking to see when a really good metal case comes out, but I'm gonna keep it on for now
This is good for about a drop or two. The box actually warps through continuous use. Nice to look at but that's it.
case not made of good quality, the face cover bends easily and does not stay shut like it suppose to. My phone fell out 3 times. Good luck if you buy this one.

I purchased this because I was interested in the industrial feel and look. Big mistake. It looks ridiculous and feels worse. The latch that holds it together comes loose too much and it sticks out so far it catches on your pocket. The case it very slick so you're more likely to drop your phone too.

When received my box wave case it  was bent and will not sit level any flat surface.  The clasp will not stay close  an every time I seem to grab it wants to pop open. It fell out of my pocket once in theater phone flew out it's case an s pen was lost. Would not recommend this case. Poor design! !

But it was junk.Thin gauge aluminum. It felt cheap.Sort of ugly when I held it in my hand. I was hoping the pictures were simply not doing it justice.The internal padding is thin.It opened far too easily and randomly with its poorly designed and unsightly protruding latch.That was enough for me to return it rather than wait for my phone to spill onto a concrete walkway.
summary: I wanted to like it but...

reviewText: i like the aluminum that the case is made of,however the design ofthe case is poor.on the left there is a hinge that protrudes off the side about 1/8of an inch,and is about 3 inches long.on the right there is the clasp.the hinge is very annoying,and i didn't realize it was therefrom the picture before i bought it.i had the same problem with the clasp not holding,and ibent slightly downward the clasp piece,and it holds firmly.i can't recommend anyone buy this,it would be pretty goodif the hinge was flush.

While there are a lot of things I didn't like about the case, the biggest flaw for me is a big one...the latch doesn't hold the cover shut! Also, the latch protrudes to an extent that I can envision it snagging on my shirt and pant pockets which is where I carry my phone.  Not a good case at all.  Avoid this one.
summary: Poorly designed.  Sent it back after 5 minutes of use

reviewText: This product far exceeded my expectations.  It installed very easily with no bother and has functioned perfectly since the first day.  It has far out performed and put to shame the more expensive bulkier unit it replaced.  This navigation system is truly a useful tool when traveling in areas you are not familiar with.
summary: Palm GPS Navigator Smartphone Edition 2 - GPS kit for Palm Treo 650, 700w, 700p

reviewText: Unlike the other review, I can not recommend this at all.  The GPS regularly takes at least 10 minutes to find satellites (sometime longer), the Palm needs to be resynced (bluetooth) with the GPS at least once a month.  When it does work, its great though.

I purchased this item for my Sprint Motorola Q. While it does not fit as snuggly as I had hoped, it is does a good job protecting my smart phone from bumps and knicks. I travel a ton and am very hard on my stuff. I suggest this item if you carry your phone in a purse or a coat pocket.
summary: Good protection at a great price

reviewText: It was easy to fit over my Moto Q and protects the key board and casing. The  screen protector is NOT part of the plastic casing. That is a separate item that is packaged with the casing. It was a little tricky, but does a great job too.

This program is a simple Wav Editor. No way to save your final results. Only available option is to send to their website and then download to your phone. I wonder how many other people share your ringtones. I did not find it to be compatible with my Motorola RAZR nor with T-Mobile as advertised. Agent469.

A complete waist of American dollars. Sooo not worth the money. I've gotten better quality with "free" software from the Internet. If I were the merchant selling this junk, I'd be ashamed to take anyones money. And if I were the creator, I'd hide my face in shame.The, "Tech Nut".
summary: Find free software on the Internet

reviewText: software worked great until the website went down that sends the ringtones to your phone, could never get a hold of customer service, so much easier to download free apps online
Xingtone 5 Create Share Ringtones & MoreThis product is TERRIBLE!! The first time I tried to use it, IT SHUT DOWN MY COMPUTER!!!DON'T BUY IT!!!!

Roxio pretends that the created ringtones can be used with an LG VX8100, but Verizon offers no way to use sounds as ringtones, and Roxio's directions to the phone don't correspond to the software options on the phone. After wasting a couple of hours in futility with this software (which often crashes on a Mac), I found myself mumbling "iPhone... iPhone... iPhone".

This product is NOT worth the disk it is printed on!There is NO customer support and this product does NOT work with Vista (No matter what they tell you)!I could not get this program to work at all - even following the instructions on their Fact Sheet!For a far superior product use DJTone Express!

Xingtone 5 is advertised as being compatible with a Nokia 6030 phone.  After buying the product I discovered it is not compatible with the phone.  Roxio admits there is a problem but continues to advertise it as compatible.  Don't assume that your phone will work with the software even if it is listed on the Xingtone website.Not good

We bought this for our sixteen year old daughter and she had the program installed and her ring tones created and on her phone in no time at all!  Software runs great on Windows XP and the tones sound great on her Pantech C300 phone running on the Cingular network.  Not only does it save us in download fees, she has a greater variety of music to pick from by using her own CD's.

The miniSync fit very tightly into my Zen. When I tried to take it out, it came apart. After this, I tried to turn my Zen on, nothing. (It did have a 50% charge.) Nor was I able to get it to turn on after plugging it in to the USB port on my computer. I had to return my Zen for a new one.I never did try the VersaCharger, didn't want to take the risk after frying one Zen. Some people have had good luck with this charger, I certainly didn't.
Product seems well made and was accurately described.  It accomplishes its purpose quite well.

I like the leather case, just the fact that it's made of leather. But it takes a little time for it stretch into a perfect fit. Recommend it for people with V180s, but I would recommend a newer phone.
summary: Good, but needs 2 stretch after some use.

reviewText: I used this for about one week before I returned my Nokia 6822 (see my review).  The case was a little too small and I found myself always pushing it up so I could see the top of the screen and also for the camera lens.  It fit ok, and I probably would have put up with it.
summary: A little too small at first use

reviewText: Fits my 8300 OK. Not a perfect fit , just OK. I'd say its worth the price though.
I got just what I needed. A small light case for my Nokia. The case prevents my phone from chipping when dropped and that happens alot.
Nice quality leather.  Keeps phone from scratches.  You can take a picture without having to remove the cover.

Product is of good quality.  It protects my phone very well.  Has a wrist strap, which is good for women who often wear clothes that do not have a waistband or pockets.  The clip on the case is a little difficult.  Mine always came off after a few minutes of moving around.  Good product.

I had been looking for something like this for a long time and had odered on from some place else and wasn't very happy. This product is exactly what i was looking for and it fitted the phone perfectly. This case had the slots cut just right, it is great. thanks

This was pretty difficult to attach to the phone so that it looked nice.  Once it was attached the edges didn't stay down, possibly due to the way they wrapped around the edges of the phone.  It just doesn't look like the picture.  I'm glad I didn't pay full price for this.
Tho the general condition is a bit chintzy, I still love this cover as itdoesn't cover up most of my red phone as others have. Strong clipclips to anything!
Fits Samsung phone that it's supposed to but it's quite cheap looking. In this case you get what you pay for.
Great!

When I first got this, it did not look like it was big enough for my phone, but as soon as I opened the package and put my phone in it I could tell it was a perfect fit. I really like the clear window, which I did not have on my previous case, now I can see who is calling and answer my phone without having to take it out of the case every time.
summary: well made, fits phone very well

reviewText: I choose this holder partly because of the price. Well "you get what you pay for". It was a nice tight fit w/ a clip that stayed very secure, but the cheap plastic holder for the phone itself, that held the phone to the clip, lasted 1 1/2 days. The plastic simply seperated from the clip a little at a time and finally just dropped my phone in the street, while I was walking.
Not too bad, but it isn't the best case I've had--kind of stiff, plasticky feeling.  But what do you expect for $3???  FOr the price it's OK.

Case fits E815 Motorola phone nicely, the only bad part is when you open the phone to talk the case moves over the speaker somewhat so you have to hold it down a little. But it is definately worth it for the price, nice leather with a good clip. This has more of a flat metal clip wrapped in leather instead of the big bulky plastic clips that spin around.
Fits my E815 with the extended battery. Clip looks sturdy. No swivel on clip, but looks like it should hold up. Not bad for the price.
Excellent!  Way better than the one I got with my phone!
Unlike some, it stays with the phone flip, which makes it great compared to other products.
it keeps your cell clean from scrathes.  the plastic screeen protector is cheap.  it leaves bubbles on yourscreen

i was worried this case might be poorly constructed at this price, but i was pleasantly surprised. comes with a small lanyard for your hand that hooks just above the belt clip. looks exactly as pictured here. i would buy this again; very nice if you just want something to discreetly protect your phone. for the money and Prime shipping, 5 stars.
The delivery was fast. thanks. Unfortunately the case did not last more than two days. the plastic cover fell off. Thanks anyways. Im sure u have other products that are better quality.

I was skeptical about the quality since the price was so reasonable compared to similar products sold by the cell phone companies. I was wrong. The leather case fits the cell phone like a glove and every hole lines up perfectly. I'm a skeptic no more. For less than half the price of similar products it's a steal.

If you have this phone, you know the mic is on the side of the front of the phone.  Well, this case has part of the leather seam covering it.  I took some sewing scissors and cut a little out and now it is perfect.  Also, don't depend on the clip in the back with the strap.  It is very cheap and will break off.  Mine did.  Over all, it keeps your keys protected fromgerms and stuff.

The case fits well but it certainly doesn't feel like leather.  It appears to be vinyl.  In spite of this, it is durable and works well.  It is well worth the $5.99 price with Free Shipping.  However, anything over this price, I'd recommend purchasing one that is better quality.
summary: Leather?  More like "Pleather" but still not bad

reviewText: I found the quality and size of this leather case to be excellent.The price was very competitive.

I ordered this case for my desired phone through amazon only to find that I could not get the phone so I ended up with a different phone that did not fit the case and it isn't worth it to pay to send it back.  There should be a warning that you can't buy a Cingular phone service through Amazon in California.Burned
No es muy bonito, pero bueno para el precio.. cumple su funcion

The belt clip in the rear is too tight, making it difficult to clip the phone on your waist band or belt.Cannot recommend it even for under $6 -- chances are you won't be happy with the quality...

reviewText: Fits well. Does not protect the top corners. Belt clip is not detachable. Once its on its not easy to get off. I ripped mine trying to get it off.It does look pretty good though.
