Also it came in a little plastic bag, and not a plastic bubble case. Also it was all black, with no white. I am forced to keep this because I have no money to send it back and no way to currently do so. I am very sad and dissapointed and say you should not buy this. If there quality control is that bad, then why bother buying.
Sturdy, strong, and versatile! With some modifications, it really will attach to anything and is strong enough to hold several pounds. I use these for my lightsabers. They work very well!
Like many others I bought this to use on my Star Wars costume.  It is very nice and sturdy, as well as very low priced.

If you need a lightsaber holder for your belt than this is the one. The one used in the movies only in silver. Great for any jedi belt. Fits my "hero" lighsaber hilt (the stunt version) and probably fits any other hilt.

Bought a couple so I could wear my lightsabers at cons. If you use the plastic wheels they come with, perfect. If you're planning on using the metal wheels like I did,  you're going to have to modify the clip slightly. (Shave off a little plastic on the sides of the channel because metal wheels are slightly wider)

awsome item, works great for lightsaber clip, strong, dosent move around. perfect. and for the price you cant go wrong, ive searched all over and bought a few other ones taht were about 30 dollers each and they were cheaply made, thise one its the stongest one ive seen yet.. a must buy.
the clip in the picture is NOT the same as the one i received and was not in a blister pack but a little ziploc bag. However the clips work exactly the same way so i have no issue.

Did not arrive in the pictured packaging, instead arriving in a zip-lock bag. Also, the white portion of the clip tends to stain quite easily. Otherwise, a functioning clip that came with several additional screws.

I ordered the Covertec WIPS spare belt clip and received rather promptly. In fact it came sooner than I expected. It had all it's parts and it works exactly as I expected. That is, my lightsaber hilt is easily and quickly placed and removed. Also it works with the two belts I tried it with. If there is one complaint it's that it came in a plastic bag and not the actual packaging. But I didn't order it for the packaging, I wanted the Covertec WIPS spare belt clip and that works just fine. So I am very satisfied.

This is the best Clip I have ever used, and I have tried many.  The round piece that attaches to the device works best if you can attach it with the screw in the middle (I haven't tried to use it with an adhesive/
summary: The Best Electronic Device Clip I have used

reviewText: This clip works very well for my lightsaber. The only downside to it is the light-weight material, although it hasn't taken away from its effectiveness so far. Overall I would and have already recommended it to others.

The clip arrived in a plastic bag, not normal packaging, and as I pressed the two buttons to see how it worked, the top popped off, and the whole thing fell apart.  A total of 30 seconds after I opened the shipping envelope.  It looked like the top two mounting posts were never glued, and the bottom two posts just snapped off. I would NOT recommend this product to anyone. The Krussell All Metal Clips are much better.  (Though out of stock by all vendors on Amazon.)  The silver lining of this whole purchase was the Seller, GPSCheap.  They were prompt and courteous and had taken care of the issue right away.  Very good customer service, very poor product...

I bought this clip because it looked very similar to the ones used in Star Wars Episode III.  It works perfectly to hold my Master Effects Anakin Skywalker lightsaber. Thanks for such a nicely priced and functional product!!
summary: Perfect for Star Wars lightsaber cosplay

reviewText: This belt clip was purchased to hold a lightsaber prop that has a covertec wheel attached to the hilt.  The belt clip works perfectly with this.  Would work well for a jedi costume. It is hard to find these clips off-line! Good product!

I have not had any problems with this phone.  It's easy to use, and I haven't experienced dropped calls.  The only way the phone could be improved is if it were a flip-type phone.  That way, it would have a built-in cover.  I ordered the clip leather cover which does an excellent job protecting the phone--better than the flip cover would do if the phone is dropped.  So far, I have not experienced making any accidental calls.

I chose this phone strictly for its looks. It's slim, light-weight, and gets more oohs and aahs than any of my other phones. The etched metal key pad with blue backlight makes it one super sexy phone. Display screen is large and the colors are great and on par with Motorola's previous phones.The sound quality for the MP3s is good, except that I abhor iTunes and am trying to work around that bulky program without having to flash/reset my phone. The removable memory is a great feature for upgrading but they hook it up with 512MB standard.The camera and video camera are good but only in well-lit areas.Lastly, the phone is sturdy. I dropped it on ceramic tile the moment I put it together and there was not a scuff on it. I have also never had a problem with the phone resetting as some of my previous phones had.There are a few areas that could be improved. After using a Nokia which is super user-friendly, Motorolas are a little harder to navigate around. Finding some applications require navigating through folder after folder. I am sure I will get used to it, but it's been over a month and I am still  sometimes confused. I occasionally had problems with the phone not locking, so I had to develop a habit to lock it manually after each call.It's a great little phone that I chose over the popular Erickson and am actually glad that I did. Why? Because it looks and feels better and has everything I need.As for Cingular's service plan. It's great and I have no complaints. Be aware though, that you will be charged an upgrade fee if you change phones. I don't know why they do not disclose that to buyers.

I could not see the keys since they were tone on tone in color.  The speaker phone was not very loud.  When I sent the phone back, I had to wait two weeks for the return to be processed before I could get another phone.  This is a BIG downside to getting a phone from Amazone.

Motorola SLVR: Slim, fits in purses and pockets; Light 'n convenient; Has all basic features one needs in a phone; iTunes & sound quality are fantastic. Only one complaint - the lowest volume for music is still a bit high for me, when I'm using headphones!

I have the original V3 Razr, and although this is nicer in many ways- I miss the flipstyle that protected the screen. Its also very small and easily lost, I've lost and recovered mine a couple of times already. The 100 song limit on iTunes is fine for people like me, who mainly want to use it for audiobooks.  There is no arbitrary size limit for mp3 files, so put big files (albums) on instead of individual songs! The built-in speakerphone works great!
Hi, its good one. i got it in right time. you can not have a number portability if you buy it from Amazon. i checked that before from Cingular so i knew what i was getting so i am happy about it.

I absolutely love this phone!!!!!!!!!! It is easy to use, the sound quality is excellent to play songs on iTunes. It is thin and easy to store anywhere, which I love. The picture quality is decent for a phone, although I wish it had a flash for pictures I want to take in lower lighting. I haven't tried the video camera function yet, but I hope to try that soon.You can use a lot of Java programs with the phone such as MapQuest, Gmail, and Myspace Mobile (If you have a data plan). It is also good to surf the internet when you need it in a hurry on the road.You can put a 1 GB card in the phone to store more photos, video, and music, however you can only store up to 101 songs on the phone. If you want to put a 1 GB card in the phone, you need to have a SanDisk 1 GB card for it to format. I tried using a Kingston 1 GB card in the phone and it wouldn't recognize the card, so I ended up exchanging it for a SanDisk 1 GB card which the phone did recognize without any problems.The only thing I don't like about the phone is the speed dial system. The software doesn't let me change speed dial entries without erasing the original speed dial entry (which the phone automatically assigned to my contact when I transferred it over from the SIM card).

I like my phone.  Pretty straightforward review!  A few more things:* It is possible to have multiple contacts under one listing on the phone book but you have to dig around in the options to make it happen.*  Don't buy this phone for the camera, it is a "fun" camera only, not a serious one at all*  iTunes on the Slvr works fine and I like it!  Although it does require an adapter to use your regular headphones that is easy to lose.Strong reception for such a small phone.  Beautiful screen.  Be sure to lock that keyboard so you don't call france by accident!

This phone is easy to use. I was concerned about the keypad size and though it is smaller than the Razr's, I haven't had a problem with it. I like that it has a little heft to it since it's so small. It makes it feel more substantial. It is solid. I've accidently dropped it pretty hard a  couple of times and there's been no damage that I can ascertain.The screen gets smudged a lot, but it is easy to clean. It's bright, large and clear.The menus are fairly easy to master in one sitting, even if they can seem a bit illogical at first after you've gotten used to the menus of another phone. It does offer a number of ways to one touch access the menus you want without any drill down or search.It's small enough that I don't require a holder. I just slip it in the watch pocket of my jeans.Even with the 100 song limit I like the iTunes and I love being able to use any MP3 for a ringtone. I can't imagine why anyone would need to purchase ringtones for this phone.The software that comes with the phone is very useful and easy to use. I had to download a free utility to cut out the ringtone from my mp3's.I don't think I've ever had a dropped call but getting a signal outside of major metropolitan areas can be a problem. Also being inside large buildings like Walmart, a church, or a mall makes getting a signal difficult.The sound quality is excellent. Battery life is excellent.Camera is OK and viewer quality is very good.This camera is quite hackable which gives the user a lot more options.My original bill from Cingular was incorrect, but it was corrected quickly and there haven't any unexpected charges. There hasn't been any $18 charge for using Amazon or anything like that.This phone is easy to sync with iTunes or with folders on a PC.I personally like the USB cable and charger that came free with the phone. They are free and they work.The headset earpieces are very uncomfortable and although an adapter to allow the use of other headphones came free with the phone it eliminates the ablility to answer, disconnect or communicate using your own headphones. The supplied headphones have a built in microphone and do allow you to dial out and answer calls using them. It pauses the iTunes during calls and then resumes them. Also, Blue Tooth headphones can only be used with the phone, not the iTunes- seems a little too expensive for such limited usage.It would be nice to use the charger and the headset at the same time, but they use the same jack in the phone.Sound quality is good. Speaker phone is good. The sound isn't effected by ambient noise. If my wife is with me she uses my phone instead of her Razr because she says she can hear much better on mine.The one button speed dial and the voice dial both work great and make it safer to use, if absolutely necessary, in the car.Autofill feature in the phone book and texting is helpful.The manual should have been written by someone for whom English is their first language.As far as using your old phone number: If that's important to you then don't get a phone through Amazon. If you try to change it after the fact you're gonna get hit with some hefty charges. I find, however, that after 2 years I start getting calls on my cell from people I don't know. It took 5 minutes to send my new number to the people I want to have my cell phone number. Of course, that's because I don't rely exclusively on my mobile. I give most people my land line number- that's just my preference though.I hope this covers most people's concerns about this phone. I like it and I'm glad I chose it. Of course, it's outmoded by the KRZR and the Chocolate or whatever by now, but I think for a penny it's pretty sweet deal.

I love it.  It's does so much right.  No wonder everyone buy Motorola phone.  They really know how to make the phone usable.  My only complaint is that the contact manager has not improve since my first cell in 1998.
CIngular claims falsely having the fewest dropped calls. I do not know where this came from but the call drops at least 2 times in a single talk?
THE ORIGINAL PIECE OF EQUIPMENT WAS EXACTLY WHAT I EXPECTED IT TO BE. Nokia product live up to their standards.
summary: Nokia DT-13 Universal Desk Top Stand

reviewText: Excitement to use my cell phone as an mp3 player turned to a disappointment rather quickly after using the ear piece. The volume is too weak with the ear piece.
summary: Does Not Work Well At All

reviewText: My phone was listed as one able to use this product; but it doesn't even fit!  I wasted my money! When I rated this item, I was FORCED to give it at least one star or I would have given it none!!
The title says it all. These guys' prices rock, and I received the battery within a week of ordering in good condition.
The battery arrived in a timely fashion.  Holds a charge for days, more than half the price of others would buy again and recommend to anyone
summary: V3 LiIon Battery for the Motorola RAZR Great Price Works Great

reviewText: The new batteries worked for a short time, about a week. Both then need to be recharge every day, even with only a couple of calls, lasting less then 2 min each. We have two cell phones. We are both in our 70's and don't make many calls. I wish we would have purchased better quality batteries, but this one had a high rating, so I went by that information.
summary: Not much better then the old, original battery

reviewText: The original battery I ordered was useless.  However, the company did send me a replacement that is marginally better.

I purchased this battery at less than half the price of the same one available from T-Mobile for my Razr V3. The only difference I could tell is that this one is not branded with the "Motorola" logos.  If you need those logos go ahead and pay 2 or 3 times as much!The phone I had for 2 years the original battery would just run out of juice by early afternoon with only moderate use.  I have not decided which phone I want to upgrade to, so for less than $20 with shipping and taxes I can by this replacement battery and have my old phone working like new again until I decide what I want to do.  The Razr V3 holds a charge all day now.As for the purchase the the battery delivery was faster than expected and I have had no other issues or problems with the seller.  I am very satisfied with this fast and easy solution to my problem.
summary: Just As Good at Half the Price

reviewText: I decided to buy this one because it's like the original one and for the free shipping. It's worked great. I only charge it once a week now.Some of the reviews on the cheaper batteries said there were problems with them. So I went the safe route and so far it's working fine!

I accidentally ordered this instead of an actual Motorola branded battery. I think the "Motorola" tag threw me off.I especially avoided the batteries that cost less than $15 as the reviews are all over the map regarding reliability. However, I decided to give this one a try. So far, it has worked flawlessly and the charge lasts for days. It's like having a new cell phone again!
Battery works as well as original battery did, no need for a new phone when all you need is a battery
perfect for use in the car- leaves your hands free and youcan hang up from the headpiece.

Received this phone pouch for my T-Mobile MDA and it really compliments my phone.It feels secure and protective when carrying on my belt. It also allows the ability to plug in DC charger/USB without removing from the case which is an unforseen benefit.For the price it is well worth it compared to even higher priced leather case from 3rd parties....
summary: Perfect fit and compliment to MDA

reviewText: Works great. It was built for the MDA so it fits perfectly
Based on the recommendation of another reviewer I bought this for my 7105T as well, and it works great...and at a very reasonable price.I highly recommend this item!

Charger worked well for my Blackberry Pearl.  I like the price but there are some off pink/ purple lights on the side that make it look cheap.  The version actually shipped was from T -mobile.  I prefer one small indicator light but for the price cannot complain too much.
summary: Is effective but looks a little Cheesy- Version shipped does not match photo

reviewText: I noticed on the Blackberry website that their car charger for the 7105t (7100 category) is also compatible with the 8700 and some others. So I took a chance and ordered this one (which is only labeled for the 8700) hoping it would work with my 7105t. It did. I paid a total of $11.34 for this one. That included shipping. It cost $25 on the Blackberry website. It does have a T-mobile label on it.Side note: I purchased this because my previous charger would not charge the phone when I plugged it in my car. The charge light would come on for about 2 seconds then stop charging. Purchasing this item solved that problem.
Product works perfectly with my Blackberry 8830. I have no problems with the light on the device. I actually think it looks cool.
worked a lot more smoothly then the motorola phonetools, had no problem installing, and the problems are pretty easy to figure out.
I have enjoyed having this charger in my car.  My experience with amazon has always been a positive experience.
Great Product. Fast Shipping. I am using it for the HTC Dash S620 and works great.
An excellent product.  The T-Mobile logo lights up when charging.  I was pleasantly surprised at the sturdiness of the product as I was not expecting anything quite as good as it actually was.
Good price, new product, as advertised, and quick delivery. Buying doesn't get any better than from this seller.
The phone only has the basic functions - but that's what I need the phone for. To talk.Camera sucks, no extras...On the other hand it is really tiny and has a fine reception.

I am 12 years old. I bought this phone, because our old contracts expired or whatever it's called. I personally think that this phone is great! I bring it everywhere with me. It fits in all of my pockets, even my tiny ones! The camera is OK considering how small the phone is! My friends think this phone is so awesome. This phone has great features too! One of the features is that it has a built in flashlight. It is kinda dim, but considering the size of the phone, it is very bright!

I got this phone when I renewed my Cingular service about three months ago.  All I've ever wanted is a simple-to-use, reliable, SMALL phone that I could easily carry around.  I have no use for internet features, IM/texting or a camera in a phone... which is probably a good thing as far as this review goes.Cons:1.) The camera is grainy and extremely limited in function.  If you snap alot of pics with your phone, this isn't the one for you.2.)  My first battery wouldn't hold a charge for even one day.  The second one lasts much longer, but still not as long as advertised on the box.3.)  My phone came pre-loaded with only melody and sound effect ringtones, no "regular" tones that sounded like a phone ringing.4.)  I gave up waiting on the internet to log on, so I can't even comment on it's functionality.Pros:1.)  It's freaking tiny.  As a guy who likes to carry his phone in a pocket rather than in a belt holster, this phone is the perfect size.  I hardly even know it's there.2.)  Signal strength is great.  I have no problem hearing calls, nor does anyone have a problem hearing me.3.)  The interface is really really easy to navigate though you'll have some problems if you got big fingers.So all in all, I'm satisfied with the Pantech C300 because it does the very basic things I need from a cellphone very well, in a very small package.  All the other features are a bit lacking in my opinion and that is why I'm only giving it 3 stars.

If you want a phone that does a lot, don't get this one.  When I was shopping for a new phone I wanted one that was small, loud, and vibrated strongly.  I had a hard time hearing my old phone (a Samsung x427m) ring or feeling it vibrate in my purse.  I wasn't looking for a phone that did a lot or had bluetooth.  If you have the same requirements for a cell phone as I do, then this phone is a great option.  It's small, it's loud, and it vibrates off the table.Pros:~very small, light, thin~loud~strong vibration~camera (I wasn't looking for a cameraphone, but I like it now that I have it...just don't expect to use it as you would a real camera)~outside screen~you can use the flash as a flashlight...and it's brightCons:~sometimes people tell me they have a hard time hearing me...I find myself having to talk louder than I used to have to on a cell phone~the buttons are small...i often hit 2 at once or the wrong one when texting (not a problem i've had before with other phones)
summary: better than my last phone, but could be better

reviewText: I originally returned this phone because I thought it didn't meet my criteria for contact info (more than one phone number, e-mail addresses, notes), but I was wrong. In fact it can store 800 contacts with 3 phone numbers, 2 e-mail addresses, notes and other stuff (the SIM card holds an add'l 250 contacts). So I returned my Nokia 6102i (which was too slow in performance for me) and went back to this phone.Cool features:I love the flash with the camera which you can also use as a flashlight (press the down arrow on the outer left side while the phone is closed).  The up arrow pressed down firmly for a few seconds triggers the camera. One button gets you to your contacts, another button directly to the calendar. The navigation performance is FAST! With the Nokia 6102i, there was a delay in navigating. The vibrate mode (which I use) is powerful. The multimedia messaging performance is pretty good. Sending an image to my email took just a couple seconds. Other cool features are a unit converter and world time.This is the perfect phone to carry around your waist even while jogging. I found a lot of the other flip phones out there were too heavy, bulky, long, or wide.The only drawback for me is how long it takes to turn off and on. It takes 10-12 sec to power on and 20-30 sec to power off. Other than this, I love this phone.
summary: Great reliable basic phone packed with cool features

reviewText: I love its size and sound quality but if you are big on pictures on your phone you will be disapointed by the low picture quality. I`ll be honest the picture part stinks big time but I still love my phone!

I have to use my phone as an alarm for school. Works normally, except when it just decides that I don't need to go to class. The alarm never goes off sometimes. Other than that I love the phone. Just beware.

So its time to basically upgrade my service plan and so I decide to splurge on a nice phone without paying anything near 200. I saw the "worlds smallest cameraphone" at a decent price $90 and decide that its right for me, especially since it would be my first camera phone. I take it home, after 1 day, I am completely dissatisfied with the phone. Here's why:1) The camera quality is disheartening, something I should've expected when buying a VGA camera, although I've seen MUCH nicer quality VGA cameras.2)The flash is incredibly weak. It basically defeats the purpose of having a flash. At night time, it literally wont have any kind of effect unless your subject is less than a foot away.3)The entire set up of the phone and its features are weak and severely lacking. I understand that its the "worlds smallest camera phone" but nonetheless I expect more features than a Firefly.On the 2nd day, I went ahead and returned it and got the Nokia 6030.

I am 16 years old and I find this phone to be really cool. It is extremely small and anyone can lose this phone if they do not keep it with them at all times. I would advise anyone to buy a carrying case. When I am using this phone, I get numerous comments about the size. To anyone who is buying this phone I would say, "GO FOR IT!".

Perfect if you just need to carry a small basic phone.  Not recommended for folks looking for lots of bells & whistles.Call volume and range is good, especially given the small size.Camera image quality is ok for web photos (VGA 640x480), but this wouldn't be the phone for you if you need to make prints from your photos.  It also doesn't take video (surprised).  No memory expansion slot (mini SD or otherwise).The biggest con was the lack of blue tooth support.  If you need to use a headphone you'll need one with wires (argh!).  If your state has a law on requiring you to drive hands free then this might not be the right phone for you.We bought this as a pre-pay Cingular phone plan but were able to get Cingular to unlock it to allow us to use our old ATT SIM in it.
it did not have the cover to the charger but overall its great.i would recommend this for sure...love the phone

I LOVE this phone. I got the Razr and didn't like it. . . so I was frustrated and like "just let me buy that little phone" while speaking to cingular. WELL, This is such a rad weird phone. The graphics are so fun and almost . . . french weird or something, there is a Clown that pops up when you want to take a picture. The online stuff works perfect, texting, downloading games, tones, etc. I love this phone. It's like super "japan" cute animation phone for the kid at heart. . . and I'm sure any teen would like it. I lOVE IT. It's my favorite I've ever had, granted I am very young at heartt. ;) It is a lil power house.
summary: Awesome for someone whose a kid at heart who wants everything. . .

reviewText: I have only had the phone for a few months but it seems durable enough to last a long time.I am disappointed that you can't put the phone on speaker phone while you are calling someone and it is ringing. You have press two buttons to put the phone on speaker phone and if you have dialed any numbers during the call you have to clear them out and then press two buttons to put it on speaker phone.  If you don't clear out the numbers it flashes over and tries to dial the numbers on the other line.My other big grip with this phone is that it doesn't delete old text messages when new ones come in.  Instead it says your inbox(or outbox) is full and you have to delete the oldest messages one by one or you can delete all messages.  There is no setting to have it automatically delete old messages and that is a pain.I like to color screen on the outside on the phone so you can see who is calling and that you can set personal ringtones for each caller.  You can also assign a picture to a caller.  The only problem is that it can't be a picture that someone sent you from there phone, it has to be one that you took on the camera.  This is very strange since they are both jpg's and both taken on camera phones.  Pictures that are sent to you are stored in a different place than pictures that you take with the camera phone.  They should be stored in the same place.  Conversely you can set the wallpaper background picture to either type of picture.Ringtones and Games - The ringtones that come on the phone suck.  I know this is because they want you to buy rinetones but they should at least have one ringtone that sounds like something ringing.  The phone only came with one game, again because they want you to buy them.I have used the wireless web to read news and sports scores and it works fine.  You have to scroll allot because of the size of the screen but that's ok if you want a small phone.No bluetooth but I'm not a fan of looking like a cyborg any way.The small size of the phone is one of it's best selling points but it should be pointed out that the small keys make it a little more difficult when sending text messages.  If you send more than 2 text messages a day you should consider getting a different phone.  The keys need to be more like the old Motorola Vader.Even with all the things I would change about this phone I still recommend it over the competition.  I hope the designers work out the kinks in the next model and I will buy it again.Here's a Tip/Trick about the phone: Hold down on the external down button to turn on the camera flash and use the phone as a flashlight.

The phone is really small, good for small purses or pockets. I love the flashlight I use it all the time.  The camera is awful, takes ugly photos. It is very loud, good for my loud home and in other loud places.  overall it works as a phone and a flashlight...but don't get it if you want good pics.

I waited 4 weeks for my wireless service to bring in this phone. Because I'm not a person who cares for all the extra features this is the perfect phone. For those who need something small and sleek this design could not be better.Even my daughter loves the smallness and design. This phone has a flash which can be used as a flash light if needed. Lots of extra features which I dont even use. Was worth waiting for and the price was right.

Too good to be true?  Yep!  You CANNOT port another number to this service contract and if you change your service in any way, they will stick you with a $250 charge.  If you don't care what phone # they give you, then go for it.  If you are just trying to save a few bucks, don't bother.  Time is more valuable than getting this mess straight!
This car charger works great, and having the T-Mobile Branded makes me feel secure that it came from a T-Mobile store, not the T-Mobile price.
I bought this along with the wall charger. The wall charger - literally - caught fire and the car charger went dead after two weeks. It isn't work the low price.

This unit fits great with no slop and even has an overcharge protection circuit. It has a light so you know that a connection has been made. And the coil cord is resilient and reforms its coil nicely after use.
Works fine in car.  Only complaint is, it is LONG and stands tall when plugged into car. Compared to other car chargers I had, this one is like 30% bigger.
summary: Works fine but size is big compared to other car chargers

reviewText: I got this for my mom and it didnt fit her phone, even tho her phone is listed as it would work.

These are chromed and have a black head and point.  The body feels thinner as well.  Will not catch in an MDA unless you wrap it with tape to make it stay in.

The tip is the only part of the stylus that catches anywhere inside the phone. Just put about three wraps of Scotch tape around the barrel and you'll survive to tell your story another day.

I have no complaints. There exactly like the Stylus that came with my t-mobile MDA.

Too pricey for a 3 pack of stylus' but I needed them

I had seen these advertised but hadn't wanted to pay extra.  Talk about value added!

reviewerName: Jim Apodaca "only the coolest guy you will ev...
reviewText: The after market stylist works fine. When i lost the orginal i was pretty bummed....but when i went on line and found replacements i was ok. The after market stylists dont lock in place as well as the orginal but if you take about a 2 inch strip of scotch tape and wrap it around the base of the stylist it fits nice and snug.  Peace Out Yo.

My girlfriend has the same phone and it fell out of hers too. I put a piece of scotch tape around it and now it kind of works.

These styli work great. I haven't notice anything different between these and my original except that they don't collapse quite as smooth- but who knows... my original might have been special? Besides, smooth collapsing isn't a real concern for me- but I thought I would add this note just in case it was for you. This product is exactly what I was looking for and for the best price around. If I needed too, I would buy them again.

If you are looking for an EXACT replacement of your lost or broken MDA stylus, you may be disappointed in this item, as I most certainly was when I received it. The item shipped was not in the same style as the photo, but instead an oem replacement with a different shaped top.The original stylus that came with the T-Mobile MDA had a slanted top that matched the curve of the bottom of the MDA smart phone, as shown in the photo. The item that I received has a different shape top that does not slant to match the curve of the MDA. You can see a photo here:HTC Stylus Pen for T-Mobile MDA (3-Pack)Although the stylus "fits" my MDA phone, it does not fit as snug as the original stylus. I believe that posting a photo that does not match the product is false and misleading advertising.
summary: Beware - the item shipped may not match the photo!

reviewText: Ordered this 'charging kit' for my Tungsten E2 through BargainCell, as I have purchased from them in the past, and up until this, didn't have a problem with them.Found that this 'charging kit' WILL NOT charge a Tungsten E2! Back and forth e-mails to BargainCell, two long distance telephone calls, about an hour on the telephone, with them telling me that this 'charging kit' is compatible with both Tungsten and Treo models.Well is 'not'... The cable will initiate a 'sync' when the button is pressed, but it will not charge the E2. Tested it myself, compared it to an original Palm cable and noticed that the cable from BargainCell has about half the number of pins in the connector base to connect to the Palm. No doubt missing the ones that provide the 'charging'!Kind-of makes the USB car adapter and the wall adapter like totally 'useless', unless someone wants to try and sync their palm to their car, or home!Looking around the Internet I see many similar products, all claiming to be compatible with both the Tungsten and the Treo.After this experience, with BargainCell still claiming that these cables are compatible with both models, now I have to question 'all' other such listings, making the same claim!Paying nearly as much for shipping as the item itself, BargainCell expected me to send this back for a refund! No doubt not refunding 'my' shipping expenses back to them, and deducting the shipping expenses I already paid to have this sent to me! Needless to say, a loosing proposition either way to me.Either go through all that trouble and expense for what would be a 'couple dollar' refund, or keep the USB auto and wall charger and toss the cable in the garbage.With numerous other listing all making the same claim as to 'compatibility', I think I'll save my time and aggravation and just spend the $20.00 and get an original from Palm!Had similar experiences with other 'so-called' compatible imported products, dumped on the market cheaply. No more for me! I'll spend the extra and get original OEM products, and probably in the long run, actually save money, not having to deal with time lost on e-mails and telephone calls, after incompatibly issues are discovered, and companies not bothering to do proper research! The picture is not quite accurate -- on the Palm end (it fits both a Tungsten E2 and a Palm Centro phone), it has both the sync cord plug and the data plug in one rigid housing (even though the picture only shows a sync cord plug). Because the power socket on my Tungsten E2 is damaged, I wanted a cord that would only have the data plug.My work-around was to use my sync cord between the supplied AC adapter & the Tungsten.  Because the sync cord delivers a trickle charge, the icon doesn't show that the Tungsten is charging; never-the-less it is, so it works fine.  Because I have both a Tungsten E2 and a Centro phone, I have 2 sync cords.I checked the supplied cord with a voltmeter, and it does supply the 5 volts to both the power plug (which turns on the charge icon) and the sync cord plug (which does not turn on the charge icon, but does never-the-less provide a trickle charge to both devices), so even if your power plug socket no longer works, the supplied cord should still work (unless you can't physically force the plug into the power cord socket -- then you wouldn't be able to use the supplied cord, since the Palm end is a single rigid housing).I'm using the car adapter & the supplied cord with my Centro phone when I travel.

I purchased this case in September of 2010.  Immediately I noticed it wasn't closing properly.  The flap wouldn't fold down.  It turns out the two tiny magnets sewn into the flap weren't glued into their settings.  The magnets would fall out and float around inside the flap.  Without them, the flap would not stay closed.  If they floated to the bend / crease at the top of the case, the flap would stay open all the way.  I couldn't return it because I was on the road, so to keep my phone from falling out of the case, I actually had to remove some of the stitching at the bottom lip of the flap and carefully glue the magnets in place.  I then restitched the flap.About two months after that, the elastic webbing on the side of the case completely gave way, leaving the entire side of the case wide open.  It was nowhere near where I "fixed" the magnets, so it wasn't my repair that caused the elastic to give way. I also never put anything in it other than my iPhone, so it was never stretched beyond its intended purpose.The case is garbage.  It didn't work properly from day 1 and became completely useless within 3 months.  I could have made a better case out of duct tape.Save your money and buy something from a company that pays attention to those little details like magnets that stay in place and elastic that lasts more than 3 months.

reviewText: I reactivated an older phone, but could not find a car charger for it in the stores. I checked online and found this one, which is exactly what I needed. Great price, shipped as promised, arrived in original packaging...brand new.

I had been looking for a dash-mount phone holder for my smart phone (LG Ally) that would be reasonably priced and not too bulky or 'contraption-y'. - Very few of the options out there seemed to fit the bill. I had a co-worker recommend this one and decided to give it a try.  - Glad I did.  The metal plate attaches firmly to the back of your phone/phone case via the manufacturer applied adhesive - just peel & stick.  For mounting the holder to the dash, I used 3M duo lock (similar to velcro, but stronger) and applied one piece to the back of the holder and other pieces to a couple different mounting locations on my dash - as well as one in my wife's car.  That way, it can be moved to wherever desired.  - Works great and holds strong.  The adjustable swivel of the holder seems to hold strong in whatever position/angle it is placed, despite the weight of a smart phone.  (Hoping this will continue over time, but so far, so good after a few weeks.)  Many phone holders seem to 'clamp' on to the phone from two or three sides and would look to somewhat obstruct view of the screen, but this holder provides great screen and button access. - Highly recommended.

I found one in my bedroom that works beautifully and have now used this twice to charge my player. The player acted odd (would not turn back on) after first use but after a few attempts it worked. I have no explanation for this. With second use it worked perfectly. I got the charger for 3.39 when shipping was included and BargainCell had it delivered within a few days. I could not believe how quickly it arrived and was obviously very happy with the price. It is nice to not have to charge through USB port especially when all I need to do is charge player (a waste of energy). And again, I highly recommend BargainCell.Update: Well it is March 9, 2013 and this charger is still working perfectly even with the new SanDisk clip player (4 GB) I bought. It's really great to have the ability to charge for a few hours w/o having to have my computer on to charge via USB port.

reviewText: The term "Mini USB" is used to describe a specific fit cable that most smart phones use nowadays. I feel this is misleadingly labeled. This fits solely the models listed, and not other devices listed as "Mini USB" compatible.

Amazon suggested a charger for my Sansa Clip 4 GB.  When I checked it out on receipt, it had the wrong specs. It was marked as a HTCCHA004 and designed for a cell phone. Talked to the vendor, bargaincell.com and they confirmed this was the wrong charger.  They were very nice and shipped me the correct charger. It is the SSANCHA006. Then I mailed the wrong charger back to them.The new charger is great.  I no longer have my Sansa clip dangling from my computer for hours, the charger has a built-in chip to prevent over-charging when you leave it on charge for more than the 3 hours suggested by Sansa for usb charging, and it's inexpensive. Just as important the vendor, bargaincell.com is reliable and trustworthy.  I will buy from them again.

The headset itself looks very nice and the LCD is a plus, but there are a couple of things that need to be improved:1) The power button.  The headset does not turn on consistently and it usually will not power up until the third or fourth attempt regardless of how long I hold down the button.2) Sound quality.  There is a noticeable lack of low frequency sounds when listening to MP3s.  The higher sounds are crisp and clear, however.Overall I like the headset, but then again I have a feeling that those of you that pay more than $70 for it won't be as forgiving.

reviewText: I'm amazed to see how many people say they've had problems with their device.. I'm sorry to say that I haven't encountered any problems with this headset at all. I'm actually happy to say that I love it, compared to other Bluetooth headsets that I've purchased in the past. I love the fact that I have a caller ID screen, and that I can hear people's conversations clearly.. I actually asked everyone who called me the first day I had it, if I sounded like I was on a Bluetooth device?? They all answered "I couldn't even tell, I thought you were using your phone." So I have to say that it's well worth what I paid for it... I'm sorry that the other's who purchased this device have had problems with it.. I love this product so much that my brother bought one, and he too loves his.Good Luck!! I hope my review helps =)

In spite of the reluctant and reserved reviews I've seen here, I purchased my LG headset at a Verizon kiosk after trying it out. The bass--to a lesser extent the whole range of sound--is noticeably softer than what Motorola HT820 provides. On the other hand, I use the LG headset to listen to podcasts and carry out conversations on the road; studio headphone quality is not what I expect or need.When I take the headset 10-15 steps away (plus a wall in between) from its paired source (in my case, a HTC Wizard PDA with T-mobile ROM 2.26), signal drop-out starts to occur. The streaming is interrupted once or twice every minute, each time for half a second to two seconds. This problem doesn't occur--or hasn't occurred--when I am near the source or in clear line of sight ("Bluetooth doesn't need line-of-sight, dummy!" yes dear, I heard you).(Addendum: 9 Apr. 2007) Because LG uses its proprietary connector to connect the Bluetooth reciever and the headphone, it's possible to get a LG connector adaptor and use the Bluetooth reciever with your favorite headphone. However, the connector's contact isn't terribly reliable even in the stock configuration, so sound may weave in and out considerably, especially during jogging, etc.
summary: Soft Bass, Occasional Drop-out, Loose Contact

reviewText: I was going to get a wired headset, but I got a good deal on this wireless bluetooth headset from the Verizon store.  If it cost more than it did, it might have received a lower review.  I am on the Verizon Merits program, so I get a discount on accessories, so the headset only cost about $50 (since it was also on clearance).The sound quality is pretty good.  Probably not the best, but it's fine.  It's really handy to be able to listen to music and not have to look for the phone when a call comes in.  This one device does it all.I like how it's designed where the cord acts as a neckband.... Really comfortable.I wouldn't pay $100 for it though.  For $100, there are probably better headsets out there.  Also, I wish it would show the current song on the LCD. I'm not sure if this is a limitation with the Bluetooth A2DP protcol, my phone, or the headset.Anyways, if you can get a good price on this headset, I'd say to pick it up.  It works well and does what it says it should.

Looks good, matches with my VX8600 perfectly, even the charger is interchangeable.Major gripes..sound quality: ridiculous for a >$100 ear phone. my $10 ear buds sounds WAY better. There is also a very annoying high pitched constant sound that's very noticeable when music is low.Fit: These don't match my ears at all, keeps falling off when I walk. They're also not comfortable, hurts my ears after 30 minutes of usage.

I finally got this Headset today (1/27/07) after ordering back in December for $69.98, and thankfully that is all I paid.  It looks great.  Nice shiny black and silver finish matches my LG VX8600 perfectly.  It has a nice cyan OLED display and a red glow behind the navigation keys that also perfectly matches my LG.  The fact that the charger is identical to and interchangable with the one that came with my phone was a nice bonus.  It paired easily and I was immediately able to voice dial and listen to music.  This was when my opinion sunk.  They sounded VERY tinny.  No lows at all.  I wasn't expecting all that much from a pair of ear buds, but the pair of ear buds that came with my Verizon Music Essentials kit sound WAY better as well as the pair of $10 Sony ones that I use with my old MP3 player.  I found that with a little modification I could plug my Music Essentials headphones into the Bluetooth receiver.  After doing this I found that although it wasn't pretty, they sounded as good as when connected directly to the phone.  So, this proves it is poor quality earbuds, and nothing wrong with the receiver, that is the problem.  So close, yet so far away.

I bought this product earlier last year, and after having it for 1 month and 4 days one of the earbuds stoped working.  I called LG to see if they could fix it and their answer was: "WE DON'T DO REPAIRS ON THIS PRODUCT".  Yes, the volume in it is very low.  Another problem I found about it is that it has way too much wire for my taste.  You are better off keeping the earbuds that come with the music essential kit.  I now know why this product wasn't popular at all.  Now it's being retailed for $79.99 on Verizon.  Being that it used to be $129.99  If you want an exceptionally good bluetooth headset, look at the new JABRA JBT8010Z which has an excellent sound and many more options.  It can be purchased with a seperate ear bud for the whole stereo experience. I have it and I love it!  Calls and music are crystal clear.
summary: Don't even waste your money on this.

reviewText: when i found out the charger didn't match my LGVX4650, seller immediately exchanged with one that works.positive experience, and now i am able to charge my phone.
summary: seller is good to work with

reviewText: What can I write about a phone charger?  Well, I bought one for $15 at Walmart which did not work.  The one from Walmart was a real piece of junk.  So I wanted to make sure that I got one that was actually made by LG.  Well this one works perfectly.

I was skeptical when ordering, but for the price, I thought, "what the heck."  I was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to put on, and how much it revamped my love of my phone's sleek style.  I'm very pleased.
Good fit for my Sprint phone.  The only negative is that you have to remove in order to use your camera feature on your phone.
Not what I expected, looked cheap, plastic. But it serves its purpose

The actual casing is fine. It's neoprene and clear plastic. The one thing I love about it is that there is a plastic layer over the push-to-talk button, which makes is usable but desensitizes it, so there are no unwanted chirps during phone fumbles. The one thing I don't like is that the ratcheting clip is very thick and increases the phone's projection from one's belt. It's a little ridiculous. But if you have a beer belly (I don't) that would cover up the stick-out-y-ness of the phone, you'll be fine.
I had this skin for quite a while. It has kept my phone like new. No issues.

and if you try to use the stylus on it, you leave permanent tracks on the cover. Also the white detailing on the edges is all printed, not stitched into the synthetic material.  The case looks very cheap, in fact ugly.
summary: The touch screen is covered with thick plastic

reviewText: I really like this protective cover for my Palm 700P.  The clear plastic is soft enough for my fingers and stylus to easily press the keys and tap the display.  The leather is smooth and black with white stitches match the Qwerty keyboard nicely.  The cover protects most of the palm but not quite all of it.  The top is exposed due to the way the strap connects to the back of the cover.  It also covers the beam area of the phone and part of the SD slot so you have to unsnap it if you want to switch the SD card.  It does however allow for pictures to be taken by having the back of the cover go below the lens in the  back.  The belt clip is easy to disconnect and locks at several angles so you can adjust it for when you are sitting or standing easily. Overall I find I almost never have to take the cover off my phone so I would have to say it is a very good design for the phone.
The case is nicely built, however the spring that locks the phone in place on the clip has already gone bad (in 2 weeks of use). I guess you get what you pay is true.
Product is ugly and doesnt complement the gorgeous looks of the Treo 650. Returning it...

Pros:*The Belt clip works well and it is easy to remove the phone in one motion.*I think the case looks pretty good and fits snug.*The plastic over the keys actually makes them easier to press with your stylus.Cons:The plastic.*The plastic over the screen is definitely a problem. It is hard to touch the screen with the stylus without significant amount of pressure and it is even harder at the edges and corners. And you can pretty much forget using your fingers.However, I just cut the plastic off from in front of the screen which basically solves that problem.*The plastic over the 5-way button also makes it harder to use. I will probably cut that off too.*The plastic over the other buttons means you can't really type by feel alone. (like feeling for the dimple on the "F/5" button)Overall I wouldn't recommend this or any other case with plastic over the screen unless you're going to cut it off. Or maybe if there's one with the plastic molded to the exact shape of the front.
After going with a cheap holder I purchased this one. One of the best holder's I've ever had. It is very durable and flexible.
This has served me well and even though this is for an older model Motorola I would not hesitate to buy this brand again.  It has held up for over two years of everyday use.
This case seems well made.  It looks good and looks like it will protect the cell phone.  I have one gripe....It was very difficult to get on.

This is a great case.  My phone fits well. The clip is a little fatter then I wanted but it is a great buy.  The swivel is nice because I work at a school and the kids hit my phone on my hip and it just moves with them.  Thanks

The case has perfomed excellently, in that it has protected the phone, has not popped off of the belt clip, and fits the phone well.  It lost a star, however, when the silver decorative markings began to rub off.  In my opinion, the case would be more attractive without flawed and meaningless decoration.  That said, since it is the best case available for this particular phone, I would buy it again despite its minor fault.
I thought that it fits a bit too tight on the top (screen portion of the phone).  Hard time getting it on.  Also, this WILL NOT fit if you have an extended life battery.

reviewerName: Rodolfo Almonte "r H a L Tech"
reviewText: Good product for the samsung a900, but it doen't cover all the partes, but it sure absorve all the shocks it gets

I bought this product mainly to protect the phone, so I don't use the clip.  For protection, it seems to do a great job.  It fits great and looks good, too.  The plastic on the side does make the already difficult side button a little harder to use.  Also, beware of the straps when you go to take a picture as they tend to get in the way.

I just wanted something to keep my phone safe from scratching and this case is perfect for that. I've dropped the phone many a time and especially when I throw it in my pocketbook, I don't want it to get dinged up. My phone still looks like new!You can still make calls by navigating through the menus to find recent calls or a number in your address book. The only thing you can't do with the phone in this case is use the keypad, so sending texts and dialing new phone numbers requires that you remove the phone. The case is a little tight at first, but it loosens up after a little while.You can still answer incoming calls easily and read texts without having to remove the case. This is the best phone and the best case I've ever had!

This is a terrible non-functioning case. Do not waste your time or money on this product. You need something that is more of a pouch with a slide phone. I would have sent this back, if it was worth the effort. The Samsung slide phones just do not work well with these cases.
The case seems sturdy enough.  The only thing I have found is the case likes to get in the way of the lens for the camera when the phone is open.

Things I like:1. The screen is completely covered.2. The belt clip ratchets and has a quick-release button.3. The cut-outs line up very well with the phone.Things I don't:1. The fit is a little awkward, particularly with an extended battery.2. The clear plastic over the screen also covers the keyboard and it's so thick that the keys are harder to press than normal.3. The part of the case that buckles into the belt clip doesn't come off, so even if you just slip the phone into your pocket without the clip, it's bulkier.

This type of case offers the most protection for my phone for the best value, and from what I've concluded after a little searching, is the last of it's kind available for a Motorola V190.  I only wish it was a little more durable, but then, that goes for pretty much all phones and phone accessories.  "They just don't make 'em like they used to."
summary: Wish I had more of a selection.

reviewText: I bought this for my Razr V3t thinking it would fit snugly and there wouldn't be any problems. The worst problem is that the part that goes over the camera slightly obscures the lens on one side. A more aesthetic difficulty is that the circular part does not go over my glowing blue Motorola logo, and the case isn't exactly symmetrical. Other than that, it does the job of protecting the phone and keeping the screen scratch free pretty well.
summary: Okay, but not worth the money

reviewText: I've been very happy with this cover, fits over the phone nicely. I've had no difficulties using the camera - when the phone is open you may have to make an adjustment to one of the straps, but is easily moved out of the way of the lens and stays out of the way. The cover all in all has held up, protects the phone and is not overly bulky.
Shipping and price great. The snap was slightly different in that it did not detach from the case. But it works good enough.
This item does not fit the 8700g Blackberry ! Watch out for this !
Super fast delivery, excellent product quality.  Exactly what it was supposed to be.
summary: Everything it was supposed to be.

reviewText: This snap-tight case snaps right on to cover my Razr V3 completely and needs no tools or two-sided tape to install.  It fits exactly, the vents and all cut-outs are in the right place. It looks sharp. You can't go wrong with this one.
I had to cut the sides out because it is so tight it kept pressing in on the side buttons. I tried streaching the cover out but that did not help.

It's very hard to get accessories for a 5 year old phone, something I found out the hard way when I bought a refurb'd Sanyo MM-9000. Searching for accessories on the net will give you thousands of results, but at best they carry generic stuff that doesn't quite fit or work and at worst it's totally useless junk. Carrying the phone in my left pocket was getting to be a bit of a pain, so I was very happy to finally find a case custom made for my phone. The plastic packaging had actually yellowed with age, but the case appeared to be in perfect shape.A clear plastic is sewn onto the black neoprene making two pouches that slip over the top and bottom halves of the phone. A snap fastener on the back connects the two halves. The screen is unobscured by the clear plastic and the keypad works fine through it, but I wouldn't want to have a long text conversation. Even the side buttons work fine through the clear plastic. The mini SD card slot, USB port, charger and headset jacks are all uncovered and easily accessible.Unfortunately the belt clip had a hairline crack and broke entirely in less than a day. I ordered a few generic clips from Amazon, but none fit the stud on the back. I removed it and replaced it with a self adhesive stud. If the 3M glue holds it should be fine.So despite the clip problem, I'm pleased with the improved look and feel of the phone and happy to have my left pocket back.
Fits very well, have not had a problem with the clip (a month).  Buttons are a little hard to press but that is expected with any glove.  Definitely absorbs the shock when dropped!

I purchased this item for my new Sony Ericsson W300i and it is great. Sony Ericsson cases are hard to find unless you want to pay alot for them but this item was great and it cushions the phone very well (trust me I have drop it many times). I like the fact that my screen is protect and it keeps out the dirt. I really recommend it.

Nice materials, great protection and function. Easy to use and handle. Sometimes makes dialing a problem, will add numbers becasue of taut sleeve over number pad...but truly a plus for cellphone protection!

I have owned this product for a year now, and I have been more than pleased with it.  (1) It fits the W300i like a glove; (2) I love being able release the phone from the clip with the push of a button; (3) I like that it has a ratcheting mechanism (for lack of a better term) that keeps the phone from swinging freely in the clip and allows you to position the phone vertically or horizontally (or any number of positions) when attached to the clip; and (4) It attaches tightly to your belt or pants waistband.  The clip will cause the phone to extend a little less than an inch from your body, and I have caught the phone on doorways, etc., but the alternatives don't provide a tough case to protect the phone.  And it IS a tough case.  I've probably dropped the phone somewhere in the neighborhood of 10 times this year -- usually from around waist-level onto asphalt and concrete.  The phone's functionality has never been affected and the only damage to the phone has been small nicks near the infrared sensor and stop/volume button, near the top of the phone -- areas not covered by the case.I have only a couple of minor complaints about the case.  First, the plastic on the top of the clip nearest the phone (that also contains the release mechanism) broke off after about 8 months.  However, I am partly to blame as I was using the phone's Walkman function as I jogged daily.  Each day I would squeeze the top of the clip to open it as wide as possible so that if would fit over the thick waistband of my shorts.  Eventually, it broke, leaving me without the ability to remove the phone from the clip.  If you can envision the clip as a spring-loaded clothspin, I was squeezing the top of the clothespin.  I believe that if I would have instead pried apart the bottom of the clip when attaching the clip to this one pair of shorts, the plastic never would have broken.  By the way, I can jog with this case clipped on and neither the clip nor the phone are in any danger of dislodging.  That's a big plus, as I've had other belt clips that would allow the phone to pop out of the clip just by simply bending over.The second minor complaint is that after a year the case's skin has cracked near the top (one of the two narrow sections connecting the back of the case to the front of the case.  The stitching has not unraveled anywhere around the case.So, is it perfect?  No.  But the pros of this case/clip combo far outweigh the cons.  Too me, it's the best choice for the W300i, and at $13 (I paid $18 a year ago) Amazon's the place to buy it.  (In fact, I just ordered another as a replacement.)UPDATE: After three months of using case #2, the ratcheting mechanism has failed, so the phone rotates freely in the clip.  The result is that the phone often ends up upside down and flips open.  Would reduce my rating to 2 stars, if I could.
summary: Best case for the Sony Ericsson W300i, but not perfect

reviewText: The Sony Ericcson w300i is one of the most attractive phones out there add to this all the features and the quality of the phone itsself and u have one heck of a phone. I had been obsessing over this phone for months when it was finally time to upgrade I was delighted with the phone but couldnt help but feel a bit worried that some harm would befall my phone due to my lifestyle. I purchased this skin to keep my phone safe from damage and to free my hands when i had more important matters to tend such as my baby work groceries whatever that would tie my hands. I have to say i was very suprised at how this skin grows on you and has done a wonderful job protecting my phone from whatever dangers may be out there i.e. my one year old daughter throwing it against the pavement outside. So far no harm has come to my phone and I know the skin has played a big part in this. The case has a snap button on the backside of it so its really a two piece it easily snaps back on once u have the case on the phone or vice versa theres not problem removeing the case or being able to quickly reapply if necessary. Not to mention its not really that expensive compared to what i have seen. It fits my phone perfectly and easily swivels free from the belt clip for easy access if ur on the go. Its also secure enuff that it has yet to come free from my belt when its clipped on even with kids tugging at it. The only thing I dont like about this cover is that it covers up the phones styleish exterior but hey sacrifices have to be made. As of yet the case dosent seem to interfere with the sound quality or nething of that nature. This product would have been five stars but the whole covering my phones natural beauty part made me change my rateing of it (which really is pretty much expected in ne case unless there clear.) I strongly recommend this product.

If you're looking for a nice glove for your w300i this is it! Protects your phone, easily clips to your belt, or anywhere else you may want to clip it. A recommended buy and this is the best price you'll find. (At least it was the best I could find, and I looked everywhere. :P)

The belt clip flew apart the first time I used it. I pressed the release button and pieces went flying. I found all the bits and tried to put it back together, but a piece of plastic that holds the large piece of spring steel was broken. The case itself fit perfectly, looks great, and I think it would've suited my needs. But, I need the belt clip. The return process is quite easy so far, so I'm quite happy with Amazon.

This case fits like a glove for my new Sony Ericsson W300i.  All features of the phone are still accessible with the case on - including the camera.  The case stays firmly on the belt clip - even when bumped.  Great value especially compared to cases sold by AT&T.
Fits very good, not a big enough hole for the camera though. The clip works great but it's a bit bulky.

So glad to get this protection for my new W300i -- was constantly worrying about dropping it and looked everywhere retail around Richardson (north Dallas) and couldn't find a thing at even double the price -- speaking of which ... nice price, nice grip and nice fit and it seems to be of good quality.  One thing to know is that it unsnaps to put on -- I nearly broke it and/or the phone trying to stretch the darn thing until I discovered that!  Would be nice if it mentioned that for us dummies ...
summary: Fits Like a Glove on my W300i

reviewText: I have received and have been using my case for some time now. It does fit the phone very well and helps to protect the screen and keypad. The only complaint I would have is that when I have it clipped, it likes to "swivel" too much. I am constantly having the phone open up on me. But the case itself is wonderful.
summary: skin case w/ swivel for sony ericsson w300i

reviewText: I've used this case for about 2 weeks and I'm somewhat disappointed.  The leather is a good sturdy quality but the stitching is beginning to unravel.  Also, the swivel/click mechanism has become worn and the phone will not stay upright on my belt.  It spins freely and has become annoying.  All this after only two weeks has left me disappointed.  I will not buy again.

At first I really liked this case. It fit the phone well and was easy to work with. The belt clip worked well and I liked that you could rotate the phone on the clip.Then the ratcheting mechanism broke and the phone spun around freely. Shortly after that it would not lock into the belt clip at all. After it popped off my belt and fell in the dog's water dish I gave up on it. Nice product if you only plan to use it a couple of weeks. Otherwise don't bother.

I purchased my case from Amazon last April.  Last week I purchased another one for my wife.  This is a quality case which fits the phone perfectly.  Equivalent cases at the mall are $25.  I do not use the swivel simply because I have always kept my cellphones in Coach Holsters that my belt slips through. This protects the phone from rain. I use this in additional to the Holster to protect the phone when it is out of the holster, and makes it less likely the phone will slip. However, the swivel securely locks the phone in place. This is an attractive case.
The case is ok, but I really was expecting something else. The white lines aren't stitches, but printed silver lines.
Bought this case for my phone and can't even get it in to the case. Right case for the right phone. Waste of money. Don't buy.

I've had my swivel case for about 8 months, and I expect some wear and tear.  I but I don't expect the straps that cover the top of the phone to wear down.  I don't know how, but they're tearing, and I'll have to replace this soon.  If you use your phone often, don't get this.  The material doesn't last as long as it should- even for the price.On a lighter note, I've dropped my phone several times, and no breaks yet (knocks on wood), so it does that much at least.

This skin case fits perfectly and completely encompasses the phone, plus it has clear plastic to protect the screens and numeric pad. The swivel clip sticks out too far and is too loose, but it detaches easily so I just carry it in my purse in case I need it. All in all, this protects the phone well, which is what I wanted.

xxx the skin wears out and renders this item almost useless!!XXX sorry for my review. I know a few people said my review was useful, so I am sorry! and upset that my phone keeps slipping out and falling!!  By the way I always used to take my phone out of this thing, I would not buy it unless  I planned to always leave my phone in it.

This holster for the LG Chocolate is totally inadequate. It fails in it's ease of use, it is difficult to operate the phone/music player with the case on. It also fails in its primary purpose, which is to hold and protect the cell phone. The phone falls out of the case, I think through the opening intended to operate the round control. I do not recommend this product.

The case looks great and seems reasonably well made.  The clip, however, is another story.  Spring loaded plastic catches are always a formula for disaster, especially when you're dealing with an item that is bound to come under some sheer forces.  Sure enough, within a few weeks the clip catch had broken rendering the entire case/clip combo useless.  Since the knob on the case is non-standard size, you cant' use other clips from other cases either.  Throw it in the trash!

I was extremely satisfied with the quick shipment. I was upset though with the durability with the case it has already ripped and the clip is quite inoperable without adjustment. If this is hand made i would look at these factors more.

Excellent case.  When I first got the case, it was so stiff I could not get even 1/2 of the base into the sleeve. The top half was even stiffer.  However, after a day of some stretching under a hot light bulb I was able to slide the phone right into both half's of the case...  Only minus to this case is the way the top snaps to the base sleeve - it snaps from the inside causing the tip of the "flap" to stick out and always catching of things - like chair backs and coat liners.  All in all an excellent case.  Probably the best case I've bought yet. Since I'm hard on my cases and like them to look good, I'm sure I'll be buying this one again!
Bought this to protect new phone. Was difficult to insert phone. Plastic seams had sharp edges making it impossible to hold phone next to ear.Swivel click broke after short time.

True there are a lot of cases out there, but I purchased the following for my W810i and actually works great.  Was a little skeptical from the previous review about the clip, but I haven't had any issues.  I'm able to take my phone wherever and not be concerned about dropping it.  Worth the purchase!

I have owned this case for one year.  I have dropped my phone several times while enclosed in this case, and the phone has survived many falls, even helping it survive a beach shower on vacation!  This case does an excellent job of protecting your phone from the normal scratches that accompany everyday wear and tear.  I am now about to purchase another after I ripped the circular disc out of the case, and it therefore no longer attaches to the belt clip, but again, that took a year.Great case.

The case is a nice fit, all features of phone are still usable in case. Clip is a tad awkward, would be nice if it were 'less intrusive'. But best case I have found available to date (for this phone).All in all nice find.
summary: Platinum Skin Case w/Swivel Clip --Sony Ericsson W810i

reviewText: The clip broke within the first week, I would say search out another brand.
Made it two months before the leather tore allowing the clip holder to pull out.  Tried another and same thing.  Nice fitting and looking but not durable.  I am hard on phones.
summary: Nice looking but clip tears out

reviewText: Maybe it was my own fault but I had this thing 3 days and bent over to get into my car and the leather separated from the little plastic piece that protrudes from the back that connects to the belt clip.  So now I can't wear it on my belt, I can only use the case for what it is sans the belt clip.

The case is a nice case with all the feathers cut out just for the sony W810i cell phone but after only having it 2 weeks the belt clip broke ,I beleive that it was just in the workmenship because the case is still like new over all besides the clip it is a good product!!!

I've owned some pretty expensive cases for cell phones that when received were pretty cheap and lasted less than a month. This one is different, the case is still just as rigged as the day I brought it, and the clip still works! That's something that usually last less than a week and it's already been a month. The only downside about this case is that the silver outlining will start to wear off in certain places after a month of use. That's why its smart to buy 2. If you plan to have your phone for a year or more, replace the old one after 6 months and you'll be set.
It works great with my phone.  Very good product and I would buy it again.

It's not easy to find an elegant case that also protects the W810i. The color of this case is black with narrow 'silver' strips. It has a classy, elegant look. The case's material is 2mm thick and forms a buffer zone around the camera lens. This buffer protects the lens, and was a very important feature to me.  All of the cut-outs for battery re-charging, music download with USB cable, turning the phone on and off: They are totally, correctly placed. A clear, thin material covers the LCD screen, and the shortcut, toggle, and number buttons. The clear cover is so strong I use a PDA stylus to store info quickly. But, it's so flexible I can dial a number with my fingers. I guess, in time, the clear cover might seperate from the black foam-rubberized material; that's why I bought two of these at the same time. The fit is very snug SO don't jam the phone into the case. The directions tell you to allow the case a few days to stretch a tiny bit.  The snug fit keeps out dust and sand. I also like the snap closure which keeps the phone inside the case; no 'phone-falls-out-of-case-again' disaster. * I can't imagine the force it would take to rip the clip in the back of the case out of the material it is embedded in; I pulled on the clip rather energetically and the clip did not move at all. (Cell phones should not be taken into some places, clipped to a belt.) This case really protects the LCD screen, all the keys, and prevents the camera lens from coming into direct contact with dried ketchup on a table top, etc. The case is not rainproof. Other than not being waterproof, it's a great, terrific case at a very reasonable price. Buy it with confidence. Thanks for reading, Linda.
summary: Best Case I Have Found for my SE w810i

reviewText: This is a great case for the W810I.  I have had it for 2 years and it is still going strong.  I have never used the clip but the part on the cover itself is still in great condition.  It has really protected my cell phone from dropping and from sweat when I am out running.  Alas, it is time to buy a new one as it has stretched out some and is covering some things it shouldn't.  I am definitely buying another one.  :)
This is a useful cover that protects the phone while allowing all the features to be used.  The open areas are exposed to the elements, but not as much as they would be without a case.
the product is not the right one for the money u spend..the price is very high if u compare the quality of the product.

After looking at different cases both, online and in stores, I finally settled on this case. I think this is the best case for the Sony-Ericsson wi810 phone. I've had it for more than a month now and have not had any problems so far.

I had this case for one week so far, the swivel clip looks durable so far, I can answer my calls and take a picture while the phone is inside the case.I can charge my phone without taking the case out.
summary: Custom made of Sony Ericsson W810i

reviewText: Bought this battery for my father's phone for longer intervals between charges.  Have had this product for several months, so far have been very satisfied. Of course I had to purchase a different back for the phone to accommodate the larger sized battery but that was expected.  This was a good choice for my needs.
summary: Battery for Verizon Samsung Knack phone

reviewText: I just got my Samsung headset in the mail today, and it surpassed my expectations!  I was expecting them to be uncomfortable, but they've got a little rubber piece on them so they're extremely comfortable.  They also deliver very clear sound through both earbuds.  The bass isn't to bad either.I had been looking for a headset like this for about a week because I wanted a two earbud headset with a 2.5mm jack for my phone to listen to my music, but I had read numerous reviews of headsets being incompatible with some phones.  I ended up going to samsung.com and searched for a model that was compatible with my Samsung SCH-u520, and they recommended these.  My suggestion, do your homework!  Be sure that the model you purchase is compatible with your phone.  This headset should work with most all Samsung phones, but if you don't own a Samsung look for a model with your phone's brand name on it.  It will save you money and frustration.  Again, these are a great pair of earbuds.

It is incompatible with the Sony Ericsson P910 even though it has a 2.5mm jack.  You get great sound out of one ear and an annoying ticking sound out of the other.  I still rated it highly because I think if you have a phone with which it works, it would be a great set for you.
Was looking for a headset compatible with my mp3 phone and this was totally it

I know sometimes you do not get what you expect ordering online, but these were a 100% exact replica of what came with my phone. They work great, and sound quality is "good", not great, but for the price they are great. I am very happy with my purchase.

This headset does not seem to be manufactured to standard. Bought 2 sets for my iPAQ 6920 with 4 conductor jack. Only got sound from one bud. Gradually pulled out plug and got sound from the other bud. So, both buds work, but not together. Received a set from HP that worked, so it wasn't the jack on the phone. Will cut one bud off and use it for phone calls only. Not worth the shipping to send them back.
nice pair of headphones i would have given a five star but i was sent wrong color

These sound good.  I use them with my Juke (and sometimes use the headset feature too). The problem is, this is my 2nd pair (just ordered a 3rd), and they are very flimsy.  They short out very easily, the wires seem to be very poor.  I use mine every day, I don't think however that I am harder on them than the average music listener would be, but they just don't seem to last..  The problem is, too, these seem to be the only headphones I can find that are compatible with the Samsung Juke cell phone.  Bummer.
summary: Good sound but very poor quality.

reviewText: I was looking for a replacement stereo headset for my sidekick 3.  I would always miss my calls because I could not press the on button because it was too small on the OEM headset.  The on button on this headset is a good size and now I don't miss my calls.  This headset is the correct size and works great!

Product doesn't look like what is in the picture. It is shipped by Accessory one. but the headphone is defective. The microphone doesn't work, Nor does the send/end button.
